loans.name: El Atardecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Atardecer está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Iliana Janina L. V. quien se dedica a realizar lo tradicionales dulces nicaragüenses como los churros, cajetas de leche, de coco, de maní, coyolito, piñonate, de masa…..etc.  
Sus compañeras de grupo son Martha Lorena V. Rodríguez quien desde hace 25 años es propietaria de una pulpería que ha ido surgiendo poco a poco y Keylin Julieth L. quien trabaja desde hace tres años en la realización de cajetas.
texts.en:
The El Atardecer group is comprised of three hard working women, one of whom is Iliana Janina L. V., who makes traditional Nicaraguan sweets such as churros (strips of fried dough), and different flavoured caramelised type toppings/fillings, which can be made with coconut, peanut, banana with sugar and cinnamon, papaya, dough, etc. Other members of the group include Martha Lorena V. Rodríguez who, for the past 25 years, has been owner of a convenience store, which has been gradually increasing its client base, and Keylin Julieth L., who has been working for the past three years as a cajetas maker (specialist in caramel toppings/fillings).

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the ingredients with which to make traditional sweets, in particular caramel, sugar, corn, milk, etc.

loans.name: Miyaray

texts.es: Miyaray tiene 45 años,  vive en su casa propia  junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Su negocio al que se dedica, es la venta de gaseosas y galletas, en su bodega que tiene en un espacio de su casa. Es así que todas las mañanas limpia y ordena sus productos antes de abrir su negocio. Hasta el momento ha logrado captar muchos clientes, que acuden diariamente a su establecimiento. Su hija Katty la ayuda en la atención de sus clientes, al final parte de las ganancias que obtiene son derivadas para la educación de su hija. Para Miyaray su trabajo la relaja, puesto que el atender a sus clientes y conversar con ellos la distraen bastante. Es así que hace más de 3 años que empezó con este negocio, siendo lo primeros meses muy difícil para conseguir clientes, ahora es muy reconocida por su barrio. En adelante le gustaría ampliar su bodega y abastecerse de variados productos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y promete pagar todas las cuotas dentro de las fechas establecidas, ya que será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar cervezas al por mayor, porque los fines de semana son muy requeridas y considera que así logrará aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Miyaray is 45 years old and lives in her own home together with her husband and two children. She sells soda and cookies for a living in her small shop, which is located inside her house. Every day, she cleans and arranges the products before opening her shop. Miyaray has managed to acquire a very sizeable clientele who go to her shop on a daily basis. Her daughter, Katty, helps her to attend to customers, as part of the profits made from the shop goes towards her education. For Miyaray, her work helps her to relax, as attending to customers and talking with them helps to keep her mind off things. It has been over three years since Miyaray started the shop. However, the first months were difficult in which to build up clientele. Nowadays, Miyaray’s shop is well known throughout the neighbourhood. In future, Miyaray would like to expand her shop and be able to stock it with a greater variety of products. This is her second loan with MFP and she fully commits to repaying the loan within the prescribed period. Miyaray plans to use the loan to buy beers from wholesale as customers often wish to purchase these at the weekend. She can then increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer to increase her earnings/profits.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a hard-working married lady with six children between the ages of 42 and 25. She practices dairy farming and sells milk in a dairy milk co-operative society to earn a living. She has been in the business for 30 years.  She was previously practicing poultry farming before she ventured into this business.  She saves her money with her group in Faulu Kenya on a weekly basis which enables her to access loans which the group guarantees.   She hopes to grow her business to a large scale and improve her living standards in the future. She has requested for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy another dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 37 años, es una mujer muy noble y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus suegros junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace  mas de 10 años se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos, con ayuda de su hija, quien se encarga de verificar las cuentas al por mayor del negocio. Cada vez que acude a sus proveedores, se asegura que esté en buenas condiciones el producto, para luego ser distribuidas al cliente, que la esperan cada dos veces por semana en sus domicilios.  Ella está muy contenta con su negocio, porque le permite cuidar a su familia. Hay momentos en que no ha logrado vender toda la mercadería, por lo que el producto pierde su calidad. En adelante planea comprarse una refrigeradora con nevera amplia, de esa manera lograr conservar los quesos. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido nuevamente en ser responsable en sus cuotas. En su grupo solidario, es una compañera muy respetada. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá incrementar el capital de su negocio, por que sabe que cuanto más clientes tenga, mayores serán sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosario is 37 years old. She is very hard working and ethical, and lives in her in-law’s house with her husband and three children. For over 10 years, Rosario has been buying and selling cheeses with the help of her daughter, who is in charge of checking the wholesale accounts of the business. With every visit to the suppliers, she makes sure that the product is in good condition, in order for subsequent distribution to the customer, whom she then visits twice a week in their homes. Rosario is very happy with her business as it allows her to take care of her family. There are times when she hasn’t managed to sell all her merchandise, which means the product can no longer be sold. In the future, Rosario plans to buy a refrigerator with a sufficiently sized cool box in which she can store her cheeses. This is her twelfth loan with MFP, and she has once again made the commitment to honour the terms of the loan repayments. In the cooperative, Rosario is a much respected member. The loan she seeks will allow her to increase business revenue, as Rosario knows that the more customers she has, the more profit is made.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cheeses.

loans.name: Nicaragua Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nicaragua está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Isabel Cristina G. R. quien se dedica a la realización de nacatamales, platillo típico a base de maíz, carde de cerdo, arroz, papa etc.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Meralia R. G. vende calzado en sandalias y zapatos y Angelia María Ríos G.
texts.en:
The group Nicaragua is comprised of three hard-working women. One of them is Isabel Cristina G. R., who dedicates herself to making nacatamales, a local food made from corn, pork, rice, potato, etc. Her companions in the group are Meralia R. G., who sells sandals and shoes, and Angelia María Ríos G..

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients, particularly corn, pork, potatoes and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Odo Pa Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Catherine calls herself a hard-working and honest wife of an ex-service man. She has 6 children but only 3 are currently dependent on her for their schooling and livelihood. She operates her business in a rented stall and retails maize, rice, yams and groundnuts. She has been in this business for the past 14 years and has supported the family with the income from the business ever since her husband retired. Catherine hopes to own her own store in Pokukrom, a suburb of Kumasi where she lives with her family.

Catherine is the leader of 'Odo Pa Trust' bank comprised of 5 members. Odo Pa simply means sincere love and members of the group are into the sale of vegetables, palm oil, plantains and cassava. Catherine was selected as the leader because of her hard work and her sense of responsibility. The group intend to use the loan to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize and rice

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel tiene 66 años, es un hombre trabajador y responsable, es padre de 6 hijos, de las cuales solo con sus dos hijos menores y con esposa en su casa que es propia. Todos los días de la semana confecciona a la medida del cliente, chaquetas y pantalones, es por eso que dedica su atención en la medida y el color de su hilado para las prendas. Su centro de trabajo se encuentra en los interiores de un mercado populoso de su zona, en donde tiene muchos clientes que aprecian su trabajo. Samuel disfruta mucho lo que hace, ya que le genera las ganancias que le ayudan a sostener a su familia. Además cuando tiene trabajo extra, su esposa se encarga de terminar con el trabajo en su casa, de ese modo no pierde clientes. Es así que ha logrado tener más de 45 años trabajando en esta actividad, siendo lo más difícil tener que confeccionar chaquetas femeninas, por los detalles que lleva.  En adelante planea comprarse un maquina para remallar. Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP y se compromete a seguir pagando todas sus cuotas respectivas, ya que considera que le será muy  útil para su negocio. En su grupo solidario es un compañero muy respetado por ser una persona responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, va comprar una gama de colores en hilos, además de elementos que le faciliten la confección de prendas.
texts.en:
Samuel, 66 years of age, is a hard-working and responsible man. He is the father of 6 children, and lives with the two youngest and his wife in a house he owns. Each and every day, he makes tailored jackets and pants, measured to fit, for his clients. He spends a great deal of time focusing on proper fit and matching the thread for his clothing. His place of work is located in a busy market in his area, where he has many customers that appreciate the quality of his work. Samuel very much enjoys his profession, given that it provides income to help him support his family. In addition, when he has extra work, his wife helps him from home so that he won’t lose any customers. This is how he has managed more than 45 years in this line of work. The hardest projects are women’s jackets, due to the amount of intricate detailing they require. In the future, he plans to purchase a serger sewing machine. This is his fifteenth loan with MFP, and he commits to paying his installments on time since the continued access to credit greatly benefits his business. He is a well-respected member of his group because of his responsible nature. He plans to use the loan he is requesting to buy a range of colors of threads, as well as other supplies that will facilitate his tailoring activities.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy threads and other supplies to facilitate his work as a tailor.

loans.name: Ñamba'apo Hagua(Para Trabajar) Group

texts.es:
El comité “Ñamba'apo hagua” (para trabajar) está conformada por 18 integrantes, en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. 
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, empleada Doméstica.
 Las integrantes participan puntualmente en las reuniones semanales  y en la Capacitaciones, demostraron interés con respecto al Programa Comité de Mujeres y todos los programas de la Fundación Paraguaya.
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable y con vistas a un crecimiento constante, con la ayuda de una asistencia financiera permanente.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Blanca quien se dedica a la venta de mercaderías varias, tales como enlatados, alimentos no perecederos, golosinas, bebidas, descartables, etc. distribuidos al detalle a los consumidores en general y tambien a pequeñas tiendas dedicadas al ramo.
Su intención principal es la ampliación del ramo de su negocio, procurando implementar otros medios de distribución como serían pequeños carritos, para facilitar la entrega de mercaderías a los clientes, todo teniendo en cuenta la demanda que posee gracias a la buena clientela ya formada.
texts.en:
The group “Ñamba'apo hagua” (“To Work”), comprised of 18 members, is in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All the members of this group carry out their own activities, which include working as merchants and maids. The members are punctual about attending their weekly meetings, and demonstrated interest in the Women’s Programs and all the programs of Fundación Paraguaya. All the members are mothers who carry out various activities in order to contribute to the financial stability of their households. They have hopes of growing their businesses in a sustainable manner, and want to see continued growth along with the assistance of permanent financial support. One of the members is Blanca, who dedicates herself to selling various types of products such as canned goods, non-perishables, snacks, beverages, etc. She distributes her merchandise both directly to the consumer, as well as to small stores that also sell these types of goods. Her primary goal is to expand her business and finding other means of distributing her merchandise by other means, such as small carts, so that she can sell to a greater number of customers. She makes all her plans based on the demand she has thanks to the good customer base she has established.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large quantities of beverages, canned goods, bread products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a consignment of drugs for her pharmacy

loans.name: Atsoupi

texts.fr: Cette femme a installé depuis son propre cabinet d’assistance en gestion, beaucoup de petites sociétés de la place sollicitent ses services de gestion, elle a des problèmes d'yeux, les verres médicaux qu'elle utilise actuellement sont épuisés, elle n'a pas assez d'argent pour acheter d'autres verres médicaux, cela ralentit beaucoup son activité car elle ne peut pas travailler sans ses verres médicaux, elle demande alors à WAGES un prêt  pour acheter des verres médicaux.
texts.en:
Atsoupi D. owns an office for management consultancy. Many small companies turn to her for assistance with management services. Atsoupi has poor eyesight. Her current glasses are old and don't correct her vision properly. She lacks sufficient money to buy new corrective lenses, and this severely hampers her activity since she can't work without her glasses. She came to WAGES and applied for a loan to buy new corrective lenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corrective lenses

loans.name: Elda Maritza

texts.es: Elda Maritza tiene 33 años de edad. No es la primera vez que obtiene este tipo de experiencia de financiamientos, pues para ellas han sido lo más indispensables en su vida para mejorar su negocio. Es madre soltera. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, para Elda no fue fácil realizar este trabajo ya que no tenía suficiente experiencia al ofrecer sus productos a los clientes esto es algo que ella ha logrado aprender con el tiempo, para ella lo más difícil pues también es Madre y tiene que atender a sus hijos. Pues ella ha puesto de todo su empeño por mejorar. Solicita un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de cosméticos, ropa, colonias, sandalias, toallas y sabanas. El deseo de ella es mejorar cada día en la buena atención que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elda Maritza is 33 years old. This is not the first time she has obtained this type of financing, and this access to credit has been indispensable to her in improving her business prospects. She is a single mother with 4 children in her care. She dedicates herself to selling general merchandise, an activity she has carried out for more than 5 years. It was not easy for Elda to realize this type of work, as she didn’t have enough experience in how to offer her products to customers. This is something she has managed to learn over time. The hardest part for her is also being a mother, and having to work and simultaneously care for her children. She has put forth all her effort to get ahead. She requests a loan to serve as working capital for the purchase of cosmetics, clothing, colognes, sandals, towels and sheets. Her wish is to make strides each day in the level of service she offers her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Linter

texts.es: Linter es una mujer muy carismática, tiene 39 años, su vida la comparte a lado de su esposo y de sus dos hijos varones en su casa que es propia. Hace más de tres años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que realiza con gran entrega y dedicación pues lo hace para generar un ingreso extra a la economía familiar y pueda cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos. Linter cree que toda esa fuerza que tiene para sacar adelante a su familia y su negocio, la heredó de su madre, quien siempre le ha inculcado el trabajo duro y la abnegación por los suyos. Es por ello que emprendió la venta de lencería, ofreciendo a sus clientes por medio de catálogos de reconocidas marcas en el mercado. Actualmente se siente muy cómoda con su trabajo pues le permite tener tiempo para dedicárselo a sus hijos. Por tal motivo desea instalar un negocio más estable, como una tienda de ropa o un bazar. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y promete ser tan puntual como lo fue en su crédito anterior pues la responsabilidad es lo primero. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza y lograr buenas ventas en las próximas festividades por el día de la madre.
texts.en:
Linter is a very charismatic 39 year old woman. She shares her life at the side of her husband and their two sons in their own house. She has been selling beauty products for three years. She does this with great devotion and dedication in order to generate extra income for the family and to be able to cover her sons’ necessities. Linter believes that she inherited from her mother all of this strength that she has to get her family and her business ahead. Her mother always instilled in her hard work and self-sacrifice for her loved ones. That is why she undertook selling lingerie. She sells to her customers by catalogs of well-known brands in the market. She currently feels very comfortable with her work. It allows her to have time to devote to her sons. That is why she wishes to set up a more stable business like a clothing store or a bazaar. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to be as punctual as she was with her previous loan. Responsibility is the most important thing. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy a greater quantity of beauty products to be able to have good sales in the coming festivities for Mother’s Day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Adjo Diane

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce  le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce  depuis 2004 dans une boutique qu’elle a loué. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Sa clientèle se compose de personnes de tout âge. Faisant face à une diminution de son stock de marchandises, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour compléter ses économies et acheter 20 cartons de cannettes de différentes  boissons, 10 cartons de spaghetti,  des tomates en boîte de conserve et divers.
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants
texts.en:
Adjo Diane K. makes a living selling grocery products in a rented store. She has been in this trade since 2004. She gets her supplies at the Great Market of Lomé. Her customers are people of all ages. Since her stocks are depleting, she came to WAGES and applied for a loan to add to her savings and buy 20 boxes of cans of various drinks, 10 boxes of spaghetti, canned tomatoes and similar items. Adjo Diane is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 32 years old and married with three children who are in school. She runs a retail shop where she sells household goods, plastics and cereals to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years now and has many customers. She is married to a carpenter and together with their businesses they are able to cover their family expenses and pay school fees for their children.  

Ruth saves her money with her group "Amani" (which means "peace") in Faulu Kenya, and that enables her to access loans because the group guarantees them.  She had previously taken out a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Faulu Kenya, which she used to expand her business, and successfully repaid it. To add to her stock of cosmetics, detergents, flour, rice and sugar, she has requested a new loan of 30,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.   She hopes to grow her business and improve her living standards in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of cosmetics, detergents, flour, rice and sugar.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El Señor Miguel Ramirez es propietario del Taller Mecanico V y R especializado en motos, cuenta con el respaldo de la marca TAIGA en Villa Hayes, es soltero, cuenta con más de cuatro años de experiencia, también hace trabajos de gomería y auxilio las 24 Hs.
El aprendio esta profesión ya que le gusta mucho desde muy joven. 
Cuenta con un personal que trabaja a destajo con el en taller.
El trabaja y le ayuda muchisimo a su familia.
El mismo solicitó nuestra asistencia financiera para la compra de repuestos para motos porque desea ampliar su negocio a venta de repuestos para motos.
texts.en:
Miguel Ramirez owns the V and R Mechanic’s Garage, which specializes in TAIGA brand motorcycles. The garage is in Villa Hayes. He is single. He has over four years of experience. He also fixes tires and provides 24 hour assistance. He learned this profession, which he really likes, when he was very young. He has people who do piecework with him in the garage. He works and helps his family a lot. He asked for our financial assistance in order to buy motorcycle replacement parts because he wishes to expand his business to sell motorcycle replacement parts.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy motorcycle replacement parts to expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pastries to sell.

loans.name: Abla Jacqueline

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce  de produits cosmétiques elle fait ce commerce depuis 1999 et de façon ambulante, son stock de produits cosmétiques est en baisse, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 9 parfums, 20 déodorants, 15 shampoing et divers.
texts.en:
Abla Jacqueline K. makes a living selling cosmetics. She has been hawking her products since 1999. Her inventory of cosmetics is depleted and she wants to restock. This is why she came to WAGES and applied for a loan to buy 9 boxes of perfume, 20 boxes of deodorant, 15 boxes of shampoo and a few similar items.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 30 year old medical practitioner who operates a clinic in Nairobi. He has been in this business for two years and describes it as good. He has requested a second loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to add stocks of medicine, buy a sterilizing machine, and renovate the clinic. He also practices farming to earn extra income. He hopes to have a nursing home complete with wards and a financially stable family in future. He describes himself as determined, hard-working, and focused.

loans.use: To buy a sterilizing machine, medicine and renovate the building

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Cette femme  a appris la coiffure, après son apprentissage, elle a ouvert en 2001 son salon de coiffure qu’elle a appelé « M COIFFURE », les produits qu’elle utilise pour faire son activité sont finis, elle souhaite s’approvisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de mèches, défrisants, shampoing, et divers.
Etant célibataire, c’est  avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle subvient à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
Akouavi A. is a trained hairdresser. When she had finished her training in 2001, she opened a salon called "M COIFFURE" ("M Hairdressing Salon"). The inventory of products needed for her activity is exhausted and she wants to restock. This is why she came to WAGES and applied for a loan to buy hair extensions, hair straighteners, shampoo and similar items. Akouavi is single and she provides for her needs with the income from this activity.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, hair straighteners, shampoo and similar items

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf femmes du groupe Bendiya sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Dougounikoro dans la préfecture  de Barouéli (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de parenté et professionnels.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce, de grains et de pâte d’arachide, de poisson frais, séché ou fumé, de condiments alimentaires (Sounbala, l’ail et datou), de pagnes wax, d’encens, de savons et des galettes à base de mil.
Magnini C. est un des membres qui exerce le commerce poissons sous plusieurs formes.   
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les marchandises à vendre, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et son à leur 3ème  prêt solidaire.
Madame Magnini C. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 150kg de poisson frais avec les pêcheurs de Banankoroni. Une partie du poisson est séchée dans un coin de la cour avec des séchoirs conçus spécialement pour la circonstance pendant une semaine au moins.  
Madame Magnini C. à l’instar des autres membres du groupe espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 36 000FCFA qui sera réinvestir dans leurs activités et acheter des petits ruminants pour des fins d’élevage.
texts.en:
The nine women of the group Bendiya are married for the most part in polygamous families and average 39 years of age and three children each. They all live in the village of Dougounikoro, in Barouéli Prefecture (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women know one another through ties of marriage, kinship, and profession.  This group of women does commerce in grains, peanut butter, fresh fish, dried and smoked fish, condiments (sounbala, garlic, and datou), wax pagnes  (colorful West African cloth), incense, soaps, and millet cakes.  Magnini C. is one of the members who sells fish in several of its forms.  With the goal of increasing their working capital and diversifying the merchandise for sale, the group members decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan.  Magnini plans on using her loan for buying 150 kg of fresh fish from Banankoroni fishermen.  Some of the fish is dried over a period of a week or more in a corner of the courtyard with the use of driers especially designed for this. Just like the other members of the group, Magnini hopes to make an average monthly profit of 36,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in their businesses and used for buying young ruminants for livestock farming purposes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying fresh fish

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Yiriwa est composé de huit  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent ensemble dans le village de Dougounikoro dans la préfecture de Barouéli (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de parenté. 
Le groupe Yiriwa fait le commerce d’articles divers : encens,  savons,  tasses de marque inox, pâte d’arachide, galettes à bases de mil, du thé et des cartes de recharge téléphonique. 
Elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso  dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et sont à leur 3ème  prêt de groupe.
Madame Fatoumata S. qui excelle dans la vente de la pâte d’arachide compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 sacs de grains d’arachide.  Elle s’approvisionne en arachide en gros à la foire de Konodimini.
 Pour préparer la pâte d’arachide, les gousses d’arachides sont décortiquées (à la mains),  débarrassées de ses décoctions, elle trie les meilleures graines pour les griller, après  les amène au moulin pour broyage. La pâte ainsi obtenue est prête pour être  vendue dans des petits seaux ou en détail dans des sachets en  plastiques, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, à domicile et à Ségou ville, au comptant et à crédit parfois. 
 Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, Madame Fatoumata S. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour la scolarisation des enfants et réinvestir  le reste dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The Yiriwa group is made up of eight women, mostly married and living in monogamous families, and are on average 37 years old and have four children. They live together in the village of Dougounikoro in the Barouéli prefecture (4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other through family and marriage ties. The Yiriwa group deals in various products: incense, soap, stainless steel cups, peanut butter, cookies made from millet, tea, and telephone cards. They decided to get involved with Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of increasing their working capital, and they are on their third joint loan. Mrs. Fatoumata S., who is quite successful at selling peanut butter, plans to use her loan to buy five sacks of peanuts. She gets her peanuts wholesale at the market in Konodimini. To make peanut butter, the peanuts are shelled (by hand), she selects the best peanuts for grilling and then takes them to the mill for grinding. The resulting peanut butter is ready to be sold in small pots or at retail in small plastic bags. Her clientele consists mainly of women who buy from her home and in the town of Ségou, who pay in cash and sometimes on credit. Like the other members of the group, Fatoumata S. hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35, 000 FCFA which will used to pay for their children’s schooling and to reinvest in their business.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 45-year-old entrepreneur who operates his business in Nairobi, Kenya. He sells shoes retail at a very busy market. He sells his products to area residents and other people who visit the market. He has been in this business for four years. 

Moses is a married man and he is father to three children, ages 7 to 19. He is requesting a first loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to add to his stock of shoes for sale. Moses' loan is guaranteed by the members of his group. He hopes to grow both financially and socially and have a well stocked shoe shop. He says that since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt new business skills that are very helpful in his business. He describes himself as very aggressive and focused.

loans.use: To add stock of shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle a plus de 10 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce et exerce son commerce dans le quartier d’akodessewa qui est  un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Elle fait face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises, pour se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite d WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  cartons de pâtes alimentaires, de cartons de couscous, de sacs de riz et divers.
Elle est mariée et  a un enfant.
texts.en:
This lady has a revenue-generating activity selling general grocery products. She has more than ten years' experience in this business, which she carries out in the Adodessewa district, on the outskirts of the town of Lomé. She is experiencing a decline in her stock and in order to get fresh supplies she is requesting a loan from WAGES, in order to buy cartons of pasta and couscous as well as sacks of rice and other diverse products. She is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general grocery products

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is widowed with children and none of her children is in school. She resides in and owns a two-room house and stays with additional family members. Her monthly expenses include medication and rent for her business premises. She owns a restaurant in Mulago selling all types of food like Irish potatoes and cassava, mostly in the evening. She wants to use this loan to stock more food items like cooking oil, a sack of Irish potatoes, cassava and yams. She joined MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by getting timely loans. She aspires to acquire another plot of land and build a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like cooking oil, Irish potatoes, cassava and yams

loans.name: Las Colinas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Las Colinas”  está conformado por 20 integrantes, en la ciudad de Las Colinas de Mariano Roque Alonzo. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes y de servicios, como son las ventas, y de servicio.
Es un grupo de señoras muy activas, emprendedoras y muy responsables en todo.
Todas las integrantes del comité son mujeres amas de casas y madres  que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa.
La Sra. Bernarda C. integrantes del comite ella es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, se dedica a la compra-venta de ropas.
Ella ofrece sus prendas de vestir en un salón que alquila en centro de ciudad y atiende el negocio con su hija. Está interesada en incrementar sus ingresos mediante la inversión en adqusición de prendas de temporada como camperas, pantalones, tricotas, medias, gorras, camisas, etc., teniendo en cuenta la llegada del invierno y la clientela formada que ya posee.
texts.en:
The Las Colinas Communal Bank is comprised of 20 members. They are in the city of Las Colinas de Mariano Roque Alonzo. All of the members work at independent activities or service like sales or providing services. It is a very active group of women who are hard-working and very responsible in everything. All of the members of the communal bank are housewives and mothers. They work at various activities in order to strengthen their household economies. Bernarda C. is a member of the communal bank. She is a tenacious and hard-working woman. She buys and sells clothes. She sells her clothing in a salon that she rents in the center of the city. She and her daughter take care of the business. She is interested in increasing her income by purchasing seasonal clothing like boots, pants, sweaters, hosiery, hats, and shirts, etc. She is keeping in mind the arrival of winter and the fixed customers that she already has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seasonal clothing like boots, pants, sweaters, hosiery, hats, and shirts, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old and married with four children who are in school. She sells clothes such as lessos, children's clothes and ladies clothes in the market to earn a living. She has been in the business for ten years. She also runs a cafeteria to earn enough money to support her family and pay school fees for her children since the cost of living in the capital city is high. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

Mary has joined a group in Faulu Kenya who meet on a weekly basis to save their money. She has benefited much from the group. She can access loans which the group guarantees and gets training offered by Faulu Kenya to the group. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of clothes to sell.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José Alfredo M. Rodríguez, tiene la edad de 31 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y 4 hijos que tienen 9, 6, 4 y 2 años, ellos son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don José también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. 

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
José Alfredo M. Rodríguez is 31 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 4 children who are 9, 6, 4, and 2 years old. They are his main priority. The loan that he wants is for his farm, specifically for the cultivation of coffee. The idea is to buy various fertilizers. He wants to provide good maintenance of the coffee crop to achieve a better quality and obtain the best possible income when it is time for the harvest. This is the first time that he seeks a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very satisfied with the assistance they are offering him. Don Jose also has worked for many years in agriculture. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of live and increased economic stability and to be able to continue growing as a person and a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Assistance with the cultivation of coffee

loans.name: Kossi Fofovi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un homme marié, il vit avec sa femme dans le quartier d’aguikopé avépozo. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’il exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses charges est le commerce en détail de ferraille, il fait son commerce dans son propre atelier qu’il a appelé «  A. et fils », il s’approvisionne au marché local du port autonome de Lomé, sa clientèle est composée en majorité de soudeurs. Son stock est en baisse, il voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour il laquelle il demande à WAGES son premier prêt pour l’achat de ferraille.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married and lives with his wife in the Aguikopé Avépozo district. He has an income generating activity, buying and selling scrap iron, and this allows him to cover his expenses. He runs his business in his own workshop which he has named "A. and Son". He gets his supplies at the local market in the independent port of Lomé. His customer base is made up primarily of welders. His stock is declining and he would like to get fresh supplies. For this reason he has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy scrap iron.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of scrap iron

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
La Señorita Carolina M.,se dedica la fabricación de Bijouteri (aros, cadenas, pulceras y otros adornos, ella  comenta que comenzó esta actividad motivada por una compañera de la facultad la cual le pregunto si quería aprender el oficio y le regalo un video y algunos materiales para practicar, al principio no le dió mucha importancia añade, luego de seis meses de trabajo y dedicación comenzó la comercialización de su propia marca ANAHI BISU.

Cabe destacar la dedicación y creatividad en esta joven micro empresaria, la cual con esfuerzo se esta abriendo camino y ya cuenta con su propio local. El crédito solicitado a la Fundación Paraguaya será destinada a la compra de materiales para el nuevo salón.
texts.en:
Carolina M. works making costume jewelry, such as rings, necklaces, bracelets, etc. She reports that she started this business after being inspired by a fellow student who asked if she would like to learn the trade and gave her a video and some materials to practice with. At the beginning, she adds, she didn't think it would amount to much, but after six months of work and dedication, she began selling her own brand, ANAHI BISU. This young microentrepreneur shows a remarkable amount of dedication and creativity. Through her own efforts, she is making her way forward and now has her own jewelry stand. She will use the loan she is requesting from the Paraguaya Foundation to buy materials for her new stand.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials and tools to expand her business (beads, spangles, rings, clamps, scissors, paint, wires)

loans.name: Agbegnignan

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un homme marié qui est père d’un enfant, pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille, il s’est lancé dans la restauration et a ouvert son cafetariat. Son stock de matières nécessaires aux activités de restauration est en baisse , il sollicite un premier crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec divers achats de produits alimentaires nécessaires à l'activité de restauration
texts.en:
This gentleman is married and father to one child. In order to cover his family's expenses he went into the restauration business and opened a cafeteria. Since his stock of basic restauration products is declining, he is requesting a first loan, in order to get fresh supplies of the necessary food products for his business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs necessary for restauration business

loans.name: Las Rosas De Mazateupa Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Rosas de Mazateupa” esta integrado por seis integrantes mujeres todas ellas. Las representa doña Miguelina, que se dedica a vender artículos de plástico por medio de catálogos, doña Ma. Anita, vende pollo vivo o aliñado como doña Anabel, doña Marina vende “pozol” que es una bebida tradicional tabasqueña hecha a base de maíz y cacao; Andrea, vende zapatos de varias marcas por catálogo y doña Viviana, antojitos tradicionales.

Doña Miguelina comprará más catálogos de plásticos además de los pedidos que ya tiene. Ella tiene fe en que trabajando duro logrará su meta que es ampliar su casa y que sus hijos terminen una carrera, ella quiere obtener mayores ingresos y vender en más comunidades.

Éste grupo es muy jovial y tienen variadas actividades, se debe resaltar que es un grupo familiar, ellas piensan que así se pueden apoyar más y lograr muchas cosas juntas.

Están muy agradecidas con la Fundación y con KIVA por creer en la gente “choca”, término con el que se les conoce a las personas de Tabasco.
texts.en:
The group “Las Rosas de Mazateupa” (The Roses of Mazateupa) is made up of six members, all women. The representative, Mrs. Miguelina, sells plastic goods through catalogues. Mrs. Anita sells chicken, live or prepared by Mrs. Anabel. Mrs. Marina sells “pozol” which is a traditional drink in the Tabasco region made from corn and cocoa. Mrs. Andrea sells various brands of shoes by catalogue and Mrs. Viviana sells traditional snacks. Mrs. Miguelina will buy more catalogues of plastic goods in addition to the orders that she currently has. She has faith that by working hard she will succeed in her goal which is to enlarge her house and have her children finish university. She would like to have a greater income and sell to more communities. This group is very positive and does a variety of activities which has resulted in the group feeling more like a family. They believe that in this way they can better support one another and accomplish many things together. They are very grateful to the Fundación and to KIVA for believing in the “choca” people, a term by which they are known in Tabasco.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic goods, perfumes, deodorizers, shoes, live chickens, corn, cocoa, and firewood.

loans.name: Ameth

texts.fr: Monsieur Ameth D. est un professeur de collège au niveau des établissements de Mbour .En plus de ses heures de cours Mr D. s'occupe d'un poulailler où il élève des sujets au bout de 45 jours pour être revendu dans le marché . Vu l'état de son salaire et la chére té de la vie ,il sollicite ce crédit pour combler son déficit budgétaire
texts.en:
Mr. Ameth D. is a middle school teacher with Mbour schools. In addition to teaching his classes, Mr. D. operates a chicken coop, raising the chickens to be sold at market when they are 45 old. Considering the level of his salary and the high cost of living, he is requesting this loan to make up for his budget deficits.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of poultry

loans.name: Adjoa Edem

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est lancé en 1998 dans le service de la décoration, la qualité de ses services fait qu’elle est très sollicité lors de grand évènements, actuellement son stock de matériel de décoration est en baisse raison pour laquelle elle s’est adressée à WAGES pour demander son premier crédit afin d’acheter  son matériel de décoration.
texts.en:
This woman took up the business of decorating in 1998, and the quality of her work has put her in great demand for big events. Presently her decorating supplies are very low. She has therefore approached WAGES to ask for her first loan to allow her to buy decorating supplies.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase decorating supplies

loans.name: Glenda Siomara

texts.es:
la sra. Glenda Siomara M. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion. doña Glenda es muy dedicada a su negocio y a sus 2 hijos, los cuales los tiene en la escuela de la comunidad en donde viven.
doña Glenda se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar a sus hijos para enviarlos a la escuela y luego atiende a sus clientes.
doña glenda utilizara el prestamo para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio. las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Glenda Siomara M. sells everyday products. She has a general store in her home. Doña Glenda is very dedicated to her business and to her two children, who go to school in the community where they live. Doña Glenda gets up at 4 in the morning to get her children ready for school and then attend to her customers. Doña Glenda will use the loan to buy more merchandise and thus stock her store. She needs the earnings to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, lard, rice, sugar, tortillas, bread, crackers, soups, churros, soft drinks, juice, milk, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, batteries, wheat flour, cornmeal, oil, sardines, peppers, sweets, and sauces

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Antoliano

texts.es:
El señor Antoliano tiene 68 años, es separado, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, independientes y profesionales.
Posee una despensa en su domicilio, con una antigüedad de 19 años aproximadamente, se inicio a esta actividad poco antes de su retiro de la milicia,  de a poco cargó un pequeño kiosko que  fue creciendo, actualmente tiene buena clientela y  buen inventario de mercaderias.
Solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderias tales como: azucar, yerba, fideos, panificados y bebidas en general.
texts.en:
Antoliano is 68 years old. He is separated and has two grown children. They are independent, and they are professionals. He has had a grocery store in his house for approximately 19 years. He started this business a little bit after retiring from the military. He gradually set up a small kiosk, and it was growing. He currently has good customers and a good inventory of merchandise. He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise like sugar, herbs, noodles, baked goods, and beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like sugar, herbs, noodles, baked goods, and beverages

loans.name: Calvin

texts.en:
Calvin is 52 years old and married with four children who go to school. He has been running a taxi business in Nairobi to earn a living. He has been in the business for nine years and has two employees. He describes himself as humble and hardworking.

Calvin saves his money with a group in Faulu Kenya. They meet on a weekly basis to save their money and the group guarantees loans. This is his first loan. He is determined to grow his business and improve his living conditions now that he can access loans. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to spray his vehicle and replace the vehicle's tyres. He hopes to double his turnover and improve his living conditions in the future. His wish is to see his children go through school and be professionals.

loans.use: To spray his vehicle and replace the vehicle's tyres

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Basilica,  ella tiene 59 años de edad es casada y nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración de su tienda de abarrotes puesta en su propia casa y la implementación de un internet en el distrito de San Sebastián. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio de internet.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the Comuzone Communal Bank. Our member lives in the city of Cusco, Huanchac district, Cusco department. Our member is Mrs. Basilica. She is 59 years old and married. Our member alternates between her household activities; running her grocery store, which is in her own house; and setting up an internet business in the San Sebastián district. Our member is requesting the loan to establish her internet business. The member is grateful for and values the support given through this institution, and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up her internet business

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 28 years old and married with one child. He runs a retail shop selling general merchandise such as sugar, rice, flour and cooking fat to earn a living. He has been in the business for eight years and has one employee.

Ronald has joined a group of young entrepreneurs in Faulu Kenya who meet on a weekly basis to save their money and guarantee each other's loans. He is determined to improve his business now that he can access loans. He has requested a first loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to add stock of maize and wheat flour. He hopes to grow his business into a wholesale and open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of maize and wheat flour

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Cette femme a appris le métier de la coiffure, en 2006 elle a ouvert  son propre atelier de coiffure, elle a associé plus tard à ce commerce la vente de produits cosmétiques qui lui réussit bien la demande de produits cosmétiques est élevée raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de mèches tissages et divers produits cosmétiques.
Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Avec les profits de son commerce, elle contribue aux charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This lady learned the hairdressing trade and in 2006 opened her own hairdressing salon. She complemented this business later on with the sale of cosmetic products, and this has worked well. The demand for cosmetic products is high, and for this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES, in order to buy hairpieces, hairweaves and various cosmetic products. She is married and mother to three children. With the profits from her business she contributes to the household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hairpieces, hairweaves and various cosmetic products

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es:
Los socios D. Alcancía Comunal "CRECER" se dedican a diversos actividades D., comercio minorista, Tal es el caso D. Pilar que con mucho esfuerzo pudo obtener un puesto en el mercado por donD. ella resiD., se dedica a la venta D. locería como son platos, tazas y otros productos que solicitan sus clientes. El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra D. productos para ampliar su stock.
Clelia da pensión alimenticia diariamente hace varios años para una fábrica, pero las ganancias no eran suficientes para mantener a sus hijos así que decidió aperturar una .librería bazar para así poder apoyar para la educación D. sus hijos.
Hace varios años Elena se dedica a la venta D. gas, como ella nos comenta que lo poco que gana lo vuelve a invertir para tener mayor cantidad D. productos.
Elsa venD. refrescos en su casa además D. menú toda la semana esto le permite aportar con los gastos D. su familia ya que tiene hijos en edad escolar.
Los socios tienen como objetivo la mejora D. su situación económica familiar, así que agradecen los prestamos y desean seguir trabajando con EDAPROSPO y KIVA. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "Crecer" (to grow) work at different activities in retail sales. Such is the case with Pilar, who through much effort was able to obtain a stall in the market in the area where she lives. She sells ceramics such as plates, cups, and other products that her customers ask for. She will invest her loan in the purchase of products to increase her stock. Some years ago, Clelia provided daily meals at a factory, but the earnings were not sufficient to proviD. for her children, so she decided to open a bookstore in the market, so that she would be able to support the education of her children. Elena sold gas for a number of years. She tells us that she invested the little she earned so that she would have a larger quantity of products. Elsa sells soft drinks at her house in addition to a set menu every day of the week. This permits her to contribute to the family expenses, since they have children of school age. The goal of the members is to improve their families' economic situations, and thus they are thankful for the loans and want to continue working with EDAPROSPO and Kiva. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for retail sale

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
Un grupo D. crédito del poblado D. Tapotzingo llamado “los Ángeles” que esta integrado por seis señoras: María Reyes, María Clementina, Rosa María, María Lina, RubiceL. y Antonina. Ellas tienen diferentes actividades como L. manufactura D. ropa, venta D. perfumes, refaccionaria D. artículos del hogar, pollería, venta D. refrescos y una tiendita D. abarrotes, en ese orden. Decidieron ponerle este nombre en honor a sus hijos que son unos angelés y por ellos trabajan.

Doña Reyes, como L. conocen en su comunidad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija que estudia el nivel básico. Doña Reyes dedica su tiempo a L. costura principalmente D. uniformes D. las escuelas cercanas confecciona pantalones, camisas, blusas, faldas y shorts. Sus clientes son los vecinos D. L. comunidad y comunidades cercanas como Guaytalpa, Mazateupa y El Santuario. Decidió poner este negocio porque le llamo mucho L. atención desD. hace 10 años y tomó varios cursos D. ello. ElL. quiere que su hija salga adelante, que concluya una carrera y un trabajo bien remunerado, además quiere ampliar su casa.

Éste grupo es muy unido y como se conocen desD. pequeñas saben que trabajando así lograrán sus objetivos. Todas agradecen que KIVA las apoye por medio D. L. Fundación porque trabajan mucho y lo que les falta es recursos monetarios.
texts.en:
The loan group from the town of Tapotzingo called "Los Angeles" is maD. up of six women: María Reyes, María Clementina, Rosa María, María Lina, RubiceL. and Antonina. They all participate in different activities such as producing clothes, selling perfume, refurbishing household products, selling chickens, selling soft drinks and running a small grocery store (in that order). They decided to name the group "Los Angeles" in honor of their children, who are angels and who they work to benefit.

Doña Reyes, as she is known in the community, is a single mother. She has a daughter who studies in elementary school. Doña Reyes works as a seamstress, mainly sewing uniforms for nearby schools. She makes pants, shirts, blouses, skirts and shorts. Her customers are her neighbors in the community and in nearby communities like Guaytalpa, Mazateupa and El Santuario. She decided to start this business because it caught her attention 10 years ago and she took many courses in sewing. She wants her daughter to do well, pursue a well-paying job and career. She also wants to expand her house.

This group is very close and since they have known each other since they were little, they know that working together they can reach their goals. All of them are grateful that Kiva supports them through the Foundation because they work very hard and what they need is monetary resources.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabrics, thread, needles, women's perfume, menswear, lipstick, nail polish, spare parts for washing machines, air conditioners, chicken, soft drinks, milk, sugar, beans, rice, salt.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 24-year-old single man who operates a mobile phone repair business (Masswave Technicians) in Nairobi. He has been in this business for six years and describes his business environment as busy. He serves walk-in clients. Joseph is a member of the Kikwetu self-help group whose members guarantee each other's loans. They have guaranteed him to get a loan of 20,000 KES from Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. Joseph intends to buy a computer with the loan. He desires to have a stable business and family in the future and describes himself as quiet, humble and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy a new computer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Résurrection Plus Group

texts.en:
Mamie B., aged 50, is the president of the Community Bank “Résurrection Plus”, which is composed of 23 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through its partner, HOPE RDC, with the goal of developing their businesses. 
Mamie is married and has five children aged between 13 and 31, three of whom go to school. In 2002, Mamie started a business selling smoked and salted fish at the market located west of Kinshasa city. She is a loyal client of Kiva partner, HOPE RDC, and has already received five loans and repaid them properly. 
As demand for fish is high in her community, she intends to use her next loan to increase her stock of fish for resale with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $100. Mamie's ambition is to open a storage facility.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fish

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo S. C., tiene la edad de 30 años, está soltero, y vive con sus padres y un hermano. El crédito lo quiere para preparar el terreno para sembrar los tubérculos, específicamente tiquisque, la idea es además de darle mantenimiento al cultivo, comprar insumos y realizar trabajos dentro del cultivo. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al terreno sembrado de tiquisque, el cual cuenta con un buen desarrollo, para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Eduardo  trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. 

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Eduardo S. C. is 30 years old, is single, and lives with his parents and one brother. He is applying for a loan to prepare land for planting tubers, specifically yautia. The plan is furthermore, to maintain the field, buy materials, and complete work on the fields. He wants to give proper maintenance to the land planted with yautia, so that he can count on good development and thus obtain the greatest income possible at harvest time. This is the first time that he will receive a loan from FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with their services. Don Eduardo has worked in agriculture for a number of years. In the future, he hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and better economic stability and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant yautia

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito D. Huanchac departamento D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. BUENAVENTURA,  ella tiene 66 años D. edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia pertenece a este banco comunal desD. hace 9 años y es muy cumplida y D. un gran carisma, Nuestra socia tiene una tienda con sus mesitas para tomar gaseosas y viendo la televisión, es un espacio muy simpático, y en esta oportunidad nuestra socia desea comprar una fotocopiadora para instalar en su tienda, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una fotocopiadora. 

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the "COMUZONE" communal bank, and she lives in the city of Cusco, in the district of Huanchac, department of Cusco, Peru. Her name is Señora Buenaventura. She is 66 years old and married, and has two children. She alternates her household work with retail sales. She has been a member of her communal bank for 9 years, and in that time she has shown herself to be a capable, polite, and very caring person. Señora Buenaventura has a store with small tables for people to sit and have a soda while watching television. It is a lovely little space. She has recognized an opportunity to make more money by installing a photocopy machine in her store. Therefore, Señora Buenaventura is requesting a loan to purchase a photocopy machine for her store. Señora Buenaventura thanks COMUZONE and values the support they offer to her through their system of microlending, and she promises to complete her loan payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una fotocopiadora.

loans.name: Tres Marias Group

texts.es:
Este unidad de desarrollo (UDE) se llama Tres Marías porque la comunidad en donde inicio esta ude se llama así  Las UDEs son grupos de más de 10 personas que tiene una cuenta de banco y tienen que reunir semanalmente o quincenalmente para realizar sus pagos.  Tiene un representante y un comité que lo gobierna.  Este grupo está ubicado en la comunidad de covadonga chalco en el estado de mexico.  El grupo está conformado por: Guadalupe R. R., Lucina  González García, Irma Hernández A., Maria de Lourdes Pérez Sánchez, Gilberto M. C., Hortensia C. S., Maria de Lourdes López Ramírez, Maria Magdalena M. S., Judith Carmelina Pérez Sánchez, Juana B. Sánchez, Maria Josefina S..

El representante del grupo se llama Guadalupe R. R. tiene 37 años, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, y tiene en total tres  hijos dos mujeres y un varón.  Ella se dedica a la venta de pan y necesita el préstamo para  comprar charolas, pinzas bases para colocar su pan.  Sus clientes se encuentran a gusto con su negocio por que se encuentra a un costado de una tienda y alrededor no hay un negocio similar.
La señora Guadalupe R. R. desea este préstamo para invertir su negocio, y de esta manera  aumentar sus ganancias para apoyar a sus hijos en su educación  y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

La señora Maria de Lourdes Pérez  Sánchez forma parte del comité de este grupo, ude tres marias.Ella tiene 39 años estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, y tiene en total tres hijas.  Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos en un puesto que esta en la esquina de su casa  y necesita el préstamo para arreglar su puesto y así tener mejores ingresos y de esta manera poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa. Sus clientes le dan preferencia por que les gusta  el sazón de sus alimentos y sobre todo su higiene.	

Los otros nueve integrantes quieren el préstamo para acrecentar tanto sus ingresos como su negocio de la cual ejercen diversas actividades, como por ejemplo:Lucina González García (bisutería de temporada), Irma Hernández A. (productos de belleza y joyería de fantasía), Gilberto M. C. (abarrotera), Hortensia C. S. (venta por catalogo de ropa interior ,fajas,etc), Maria de Lourdes López Ramírez (venta de productos de belleza por catalogo), Maria Magdalena M. S. (venta de zapatos por catalogo), Judith Carmelina Pérez Sánchez (venta de dulces),  Juana B. Sánchez (venta de blancos por catalogo), Maria Josefina S. (venta de ropa interior).
texts.en:
This "development unit" (UDE) is called Tres Marías, named after the community in which this UDE began. UDEs are groups of 10 or more people who have a bank account and that have to meet either weekly or biweekly to make payments. There is a representative and a committee that governs each group. This group is located in the community of Codvadonga Chalco in the state of Mexico. The group is made up of: Guadalupe R. R., Lucina González García, Irma Hernández A., Maria de Lourdes Pérez Sánchez, Gilberto M. C., Hortensia C. S., Maria de Lourdes López Ramírez, Maria Magdalena M. S., Judith Carmelina Pérez Sánchez, Juana B. Sánchez, Maria Josefina S.. The group representative is named Guadalupe R. R. and is 37 years old. She studied until the 6th grade, and has three children (two girls and one boy). She sells bread and is taking out this loan to buy trays and clips to put her bread on. Her clients really like her business because it is next to a store and there isn't a smilar business around it. Sra. Guadalupe R. R. wants this loan to invest in her business and through this investment increase her earnings to help her children with their education and to provide them a better quality of life. Sra. Lourdes Pérez Sánchez is part of this groups committee. She is 39 and studied until the 6th grade. She has 3 children. She sells Mexican snacks from a stand that is on the corner in front of her house and needs this loan to fix her stand to help increase her income. This way she can help her husband pay for household expenses. Her clients like the quality of her snacks and above all the cleanliness of her stand. The other nine members of the other 9 members of this group want to take out this loan to increase their business incomes that come from a diverse range of activities like: Lucina González García (seasonal jewelry), Irma Hernández A. (beauty products and fancy jewelry), Gilberto M. C. (groceries), Hortensia C. S. (underwear), Maria de Lourdes López Ramírez (beauty products), Maria Magdalena M. S. (shoes), Judith Carmelina Pérez Sánchez (candy), Juana B. Sánchez (linens), Maria Josefina S. (underwear).

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and materials for their businesses

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh K. est un chauffeur  taximan qui a acheté sa voiture grâce à des prêts de l'institution .actuellement il sollicite un crédit pour réparer cette voiture qui est une source de revenu pour lui.Sans cette voiture il ne dispose d'aucune revenu pour faire vivre sa famille qui se trouve dans un village à 7 km de Mbour
texts.en:
Mr Cheikh K. is a taxi driver, who bought his car thanks to loans from the institution. He is currently asking for a loan in order to repair this car which is a source of income for him. Without this car he has no income to support his family, who live in a village 7 kilometers from Mbour.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Lucila Saida

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito D. Huanchac departamento D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. LUCILA,  ella tiene 51 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos nuestra socia es docente D. primaria, ella comparte su tiempo con la venta D. productos D. belleza y tiene un taller D. tejidos, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio del taller y comprar las lanas y un repuesto para la máquina.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the “COMUZONE” communal bank; she lives in the city of Cusco, Huanchac district, Cusco department. Her name is LUCILA, she’s 51 years of age, married and has 4 children. She’s an elementary school teacher but also sells beauty products and has a weaving workshop. She is asking for funds to invest in her workshop, to buy wool and to for a replacement part for her loom. She is grateful for the support offered through this means and pledges to replay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her workshop, buy wool and a replacement part for the machine.

loans.name: Julia Erminia

texts.es: Julia Erminia tiene 57 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar de manera independiente. Ella tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, por lo que su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo y una pulpería, por lo que hace más de 3 años que decidió establecer un pequeño establecimiento en donde ofrece una variedad de productos, así sus clientes acuden mucho a su vivienda, pues su mayor desafío es mantener sus 2 negocio, pues para ella son muy importantes ya que con ellos sufraga los ingresos de su familia. Es así que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Julia Erminia is 57 year old hardworking woman. She has always liked to work independently and has one dependent child. She works as a pork butcher and in a grocery store where three years ago she decided to establish a small shop where she offers a variety of home products to her customers. Her biggest challenge is to maintain both jobs as they are important to sustain the income for her family. Therefore, this funding request for the purchase of raw materials. Her desire is to provide improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more provisions for her shop

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a widowed lady with three boys and two girls of whom two are in school and two have completed schooling.

Asha sells new clothes and also operates a shop selling cereals. She has been in the cereal shop business for two years and in the clothes business for fifteen years. She also earns income from her rental housing.

Asha wants to use the loan to buy beans, rice, sugar, maize flour and wheat flour. The main challenge to her business is that transport costs are high and cut into her profit.

Asha would like to open another retail shop in future and improve her standard of living as she is currently living in a house with neither electricity nor piped water.

Asha decided to join Yehu because the organization has simple repayments and the clients are taken good care of.

loans.use: To buy more beans, rice, sugar, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Gomez

texts.en: Gomez Ma. C. is from the town of Daan Lungsod, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Gomez owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 27,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Gomez joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gomez is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 10th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Angel Israel

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE”; Nuestro socio vive en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el  Sr. ANGEL,  Nuestro socio tiene 63 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos todos independientes, Nuestro socio es jubilado, el presta servicio de taxi en su propio carrito, nuestro socio también vende zapatos que le envía un pariente desde el norte del país (Trujillo), y siempre está activo y haciendo cosas, es un hombre con muy buen carácter y trabaja con este banco comunal desde hace 13 años, nunca falló ni llegó tarde a las reuniones, el dice que le gusta mantenerse activo y le encanta reunirse con sus amigos en el banco comunal, Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para poder terminar de construir un pequeño ambiente en su casa. 

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, ANGEL, 63, is a member of the “COMUZONE” communal bank; he lives in the city of Cusco, Huanchac district, Cusco department. Angel is married and has three independent children; he’s retired but uses his car to provide public taxi services. In addition, he sells shoes that a relative sends him from the north of the country (Trujillo) and he is always active doing lots of things. He is a pleasant man who has collaborated with this communal bank for 13 years and has never missed or been tardy to any meeting. He states that he likes to stay active and loves getting together with his friends in the communal bank. He is requesting funds to complete construction of a space in his house. He is grateful for and values the help offered through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Monzoto Plus Group

texts.en:
Monzoto Plus is a community bank made up of seventeen micro-entrepreneurs whose chairman is Jules N.. These members are united in the same goal: to grow their businesses through loans received from Kiva via the MFI HOPE DRC.

Jules operates a drugstore in the northern suburban area of Kinshasa. He is 38 years old and is the father of three children who are between the ages of 7 and 14. All of them attend school.

Jules began his business in 1994. With hard work and good management, and by providing good customer service, his business has prospered and has permanent customers to sustain it.

Jules’s wife has been helping him by promoting the business, which generates $40 of profit per week.
