This activity helps her to be able to support her household, which is comprised of two children. One goes to school, and the other attends the university. Also, it was verified that this client lives modestly. There is not much furniture or many possessions in the room where they live. Her husband is a carpenter, and he works sporadically. For all of the things that have bee mentioned, she was given the preferred interest rate from Kiva. They work hard to get ahead and to be able to improve the quality of life for the whole family. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have shown in granting her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single woman with one son and two daughters. Two of her children attend school but her third child suffers from epilepsy and does not attend school. Mariam rents her home and has no electricity or water and her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Mariam sells clothes and wants to purchase handbags, shoes and materials with the Ksh 40,000 loan. She sells her products door-to-door and her customers are mainly women. The main challenge to her business is transport and sources of capital to run the business. She has been in this business for almost ten years and was previously selling cosmetics.

Mariam aspires to expand her business and buy a home someday. She decided to work with Yehu in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy shoes, handbags and materials

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía Comunal las Pioneras son socios comprometidos con sus créditos ellos pagaran sus cuotas en 4 meses y así pueden renovar sus crédito.
Auria una D. las socias, vendé menestras y cereales hace varios años, este negocio lo inicio con ayuda en una amiga, ella tiene 2 hijos que mantener, así que se esfuerza mucho por ello. Gracias al crédito pueD. invertir en su negocio.
Albina se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo hace algún tiempo, las ganancias que obtiene solo alcanzan para aportar con algunos gastos en casa, Así que desea invertir en otro negocio con el cual poder subsistir.
Emma tiene un Salón D. Belleza, que con mucho esfuerzo pueD. pagar los gastos D. la educación D. su hijo, su objetivo es aperturar otro Salón D. Belleza donD. poder brindar trabajo a sus compañeras.
About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty
texts.en:
The Las Pioneras Communal Bank members are committed to their loans. They will make their payments in four months. That way they will be able to renew their loan. Auria is one of the members. She has sold vegetable and grains for several years. She started this business with the help of a friend. She has two children to support, and she puts forth great effort to do so. Thanks to the loan she is able to invest in her business. Albina has been selling cosmetics by catalog for some time. The earnings that she gets only pay for some of the household expenses. That is why she wishes to invest in another business with which she would be able to survive. Emma has a beauty salon. She is able to pay her child’s educational expenses with a lot of effort. Her objective is to open another beauty salon where she would be able to proviD. her colleagues with work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité   Mujeres unidas se  encuentra en su tercer  ciclo, tiene  un ahorro y todas se encuentran trabajando muy satisfechas.
 Una de las integrantes es la señora Mirian quien trabaja en la elaboración y venta de alimentos. Ella quiere comprar un puesto de venta por lo que solicita el préstamo.
Esto sería para dejar de pagar el alquiler en forma mensual y que resultaba muy caro.
Ella nos comenta que esta actividad le deja muy buena ganancia y mantiene muy bien a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) committee is in its third cycle; they have some savings and they are all working very happily. One of the group members is Mirian who prepares food for sale. She is asking for funds to buy a food sales stand so that she can save paying her current expensive monthly rental fees. She comments that this line of work produces good profits that support her family very well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a food stand.

loans.name: Raquel Yaquelin

texts.es:
Raquel L. de 26 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín (zona muy humilde con calles de tierra y casa de caña) de Guayaquil. Su casa es de cemento/caña, solo cuenta con luz como servicios básico. Su esposo es pintor, ellos tienen tres hijos de 9, 8, 3 años de edad. 

Raquel decidió hace dos años atrás dedicar mas tiempo a sus hijos por eso ella compro papelerías y artículos para vende. En la parte delantera de su casa ella adecuo un local y lo comenzó a utilizar para su papelería. 

Ahora ella tiene una papelería muy pequeña pero se siente a gusto porque tiene tiempo para sus hijos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 07:00 am hasta las 20:00 pm en las tarde ella les enseña a sus hijos como atender la papelería, Vende papeles, cuadernos, plumas etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, bloques y arena para cambiar la parte de caña en cemento.     

En el futuro quiere agrandar y surtir más su papelería, y poder construir mejor su casa para que sus hijas tengas un cuarto cada una.
texts.en:
Raquel L., 26, lives in a periurban area in El Fortín (a very humble area of Guayaquil that has unpaved streets and houses made of sugar cane stalks). Her house is part cement and part sugar cane stalk; the only utility it has is electricity. Her husband is a painter and they have three children who are 9, 8 and 3 years of age. Two years ago Raquel decided to dedicate more time to her children so she bought stationery and other articles to sell. She set up the front part of her house as a store and used it to sell her stationary supplies. Now she has a small stationery shop and she is very happy because she has time for her children. She is open for business every day from 7am until 8pm and in the afternoons she teaches her children how to mind the store; she stocks such items as: paper, notebooks, pens, etc. She will use the requested funds to buy cement, sand and concrete blocks to replace some of the sugar cane stalks with cement. In the future she would like to enlarge and increase the stock of her store as well as to improve the construction of her house so that each daughter will have her own bedroom.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, concrete blocks and sand.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Jose Roberto G. H., tiene la edad de 58 años, es casado y con sus 3 hijos, habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, él señor labora como Guarda de Seguridad desde hace 5 años, siendo la principal fuente económica de la familia.

Ellos habitan en una casa muy humilde, que con sus limitados ingresos, han podido edificar su hogar, pero necesitan de un préstamo para la construcción de la fachada de la casa y para la compra de una puerta, que les brinde una mejor seguridad para la familia, espera que se les apoye económicamente y de esta manera mejorar su nivel de vida y esto los motive y asegure su forma de vivir a todos sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose Roberto G. H., 58, is married and has three children; they live in Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla. He has been employed as a security guard for the last 5 years; this is his family’s main source of income. They live in a very humble home which, with his very limited income, he has been able to build. However, they need funds to complete the façade of the house and to buy a door to provide more security for the family. He hopes to receive this economic support so that their living standard will improve and that his children will be motivated and have their way of living assured.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a main door for his house.

loans.name: Yesaria

texts.es:
Yesaria M. N., tiene la edad de 49 años, está casada, y vive su esposo y un hijo de 12 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de inventario para su negocio. Desea tener un inventario más amplio y variado de productos que ofrece en su pulpería. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en el negocio, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecida con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Yesaria is 49 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 12-year-old son. She requests a loan to buy added inventory for her business. She wants to have a more ample and varied inventory of products in her general store. It has been several years since she began this business, and she can count on very good customers. That's why she views it as necessary to offer a greater variety of products in the business, in addition to providing better economic income for her home. This is the first time Yesaria has requested a loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very grateful for the opportunity. She hopes in the future to offer her family a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to continue growing as a person and as a merchant. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MORE EXTENSIVE AND VARIED MERCHANDISE FOR HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Descripción:	El Sr. Roberto tiene 37 años, y esta en pareja con la Sra. Clara con quien tienen 3 hijos todos en edad escolar.                                Sr. R. se dedica a la compra y venta de Carbón Vegetal desde hace 5 años en forma independiente antes trabajaba como cobrador de una casa comercial que luego salio para independizarse y formar su propio negocio.
Actualmente esta actividad lo realiza en forma personal pero su objetivo mas adelante es el de trabajar como mayorista y tener  vendedores y así poder agrandar su zona de trabajo y llegar a tener mayor ingreso.
El crédito será  destinado a la compra de carbón al por Mayor.
texts.en:
Roberto is 37 years old. Clara is his life partner, and they have three school age children. Mr. R. has been working independently selling charcoal for five years. He previously worked as collector for a commercial house. He then left in order to become independent and form his own business. He currently personally makes sales, but his objective later on is to work as a wholesaler and to have salespeople. That way he will be able to expand his work area and come to have greater income. The loan is to buy charcoal wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy charcoal

loans.name: Norma Silvana

texts.es:
La  señora  Norma Pérez tiene 25 años es socia del bankito Damas Responsables, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay  situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana y  es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador  caracterizándose  por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua y sobre todo  su centro histórico  que fue declarado Patrimonio Cultural  de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

Norma  se encuentra casada y tiene dos hijos de  7 y 3 años, la mayor estudia en una escuelita de la localidad  y el pequeño pasa en casa con ella, su esposo trabaja en su taller de carpintería ubicado en su casa propia, mientras que  ella se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y en sus momentos libres ayuda a su esposo en la carpintería desde que se casaron. 

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo gracias a la invitación de su hermana,  los créditos le han beneficiado para  comprar  material para la carpintería de su esposo, con su nuevo crédito va a comprar planchas MDF, trupan, madera, clavos, cola blanca, etc. Además tiene como sueño salir adelante junto a su esposo e hijos e ir incrementando su carpintería para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Norma Pérez is 25 years old and is a member of Damas Responsables (Responsible Ladies), a small bank. She lives in the large city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay province located on the meridian of the Andean mountain range on the equator, which is the third-most important city in Ecuador, and known for maintaining the peace and beauty of an ancient city, and most of all for its historic downtown that was declared a Cultural Heritage Site by UNESCO in the year 1999.

Norma is married and has two children who are 7 and 3 years old. The older one studies in the area school and the little one spends the day at home with her. Her husband works in his carpentry shop in their home while she does the housework and in her free time helps him in the shop. It has been this way since they got married.

She is now on her third loan cycle thanks to her sister's invitation. The loans have helped her buy materials for her husband's shop, and with the new loan she will buy plywood, Trupan, wood, nails, white glue, etc. It is her dream to get ahead with her husband and children and keep growing the carpentry shop to provide better service to their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials

loans.name: Victor Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Víctor tiene 38 años. Esta casado con la Sra Blanca Alonso y tienen dos hijos menores de edad. Se dedica a la actividad de taxista desde el año 2006. se inició siendo chofer de un vehículo no propio. Hasta que con esfuerzo pudo comprar su vehículo. 
Actualmente necesita cambiar su vehículo, pues de esta forma tendrá menos egresos por mantenimientos y podrá brindar mayor comodidad a sus pasajeros; por estos motivos es que  necesita de este crédito.
En el futuro desea poder adquirir su propia parada, de esta forma podrá asegurar a largo plazo sus ingresos y a través de esto también brindará estabilidad y bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor is 38 years old. He is married to Mrs. Blanca Alonso and they have two young children. He has worked as a taxi driver since 2006. He started by driving a vehicle that was not his own and after a lot of work he was able to purchase his own vehicle. Now he needs to replace his vehicle, as this will allow him to spend less money on repairs and provide more comfort for his passengers. It is for this reason that he needs a loan. In the future he hopes to have his own stop, to guarantee a long-term income and also give stability and provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a vehicle

loans.name: Maria Carmela

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa trajeamos en quechua.
Maria es casada, tiene 79 años y 6 hijos, vive en el Distrito D. Chiara que se encuentra a 90 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Maria tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general. Además Maria junto a su esposos se dedican a la ganadería del cual obtienen leche y luego producen quesos, productos que venden en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños D. Maria son tener ahorro suficiente para los demás años y comprar mas animales.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Llamkasum Community Bank. Llamkasum means 'We Clothe' in Quechua. Maria is married, 79 years old, and has 6 children. She lives in the district of Chiara, located 90 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Maria has a store in her home where she sells groceries and basic items. Maria also works with her husband with livestock, gathering milk and later making cheeses that they sell in the city of Ayacucho.

Maria needs a loan of 1,800 soles to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Maria's dreams are to save enough money for the rest of her life and to be able to buy more animals.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa trajeamos en quechua.
Gladys es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Gladys junto a su esposo tienen un restaurante en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 4 personas.
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de víveres.
Gladys sueña con terminar de construir su casa, comprar un carro para realizar transporte urbano.
texts.en:
Glays is a member of the LLamkasum Communal Bank, which means “We clothe” in Quechua. Gladys is 36, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Gladys, together with her husband, has a restaurant in a rented location. They work at the restaurant everyday with the help of four other people. Gladys needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy supplies. Gladys dreams of finishing the construction on her house and buying a car for urban transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Josefa Betty

texts.es:
Betty es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa trajeamos en quechua.
Betty  es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Betty vende frutas, gaseosas de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad, actividad que realiza los días domingos. Además Betty se dedica a la crianza de animales menores en su casa.
Betty necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuy, gallina.
Betty sueña con tener una pastelería y tener un recreo.
texts.en:
Betty is a member of the LLamkasum Communal Bank, which means “We clothe” in Quechua. Betty is 28, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Betty sells fruit and soft drinks as a street vendor in the city’s wholesale market. She does this every Sunday. Also, Betty raises small animals at her house. Betty needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy guinea pigs and chickens. Betty dreams of having a pastry shop and of having fun.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.es:
Jenifer es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa trajeamos en quechua.
Jenifer es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hija, Jennifer viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, productos que luego vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Jenifer necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada y maíz.
Jennifer sueña con tener casa propia, una tienda y comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo.
texts.en:
Jenifer is a member of the communal bank "Llamkasum" which means "we clothe" in Quechua. Jenifer lives with her partner, is 24 years old, and has a daughter. Jennifer travels to fairs in her region where she buys cereals, products, she later sells in Ayaucho's markets. Jenifer needs a loan of 1000 soles. She will invest this money in the purchase of wheat, barely, and corn. Jennifer's dream is to have her own home and to buy a car so her husband works.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat, barely, and corn.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna P. M., tiene la edad de 42 años, está casada, y vive su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 16,12 y 8 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una máquina de coser y reparar otra que tiene en mal estado. Desea  tener máquinas en buen estado para poder aumentar su capacidad de producción de ropa y mejorar el producto. Tiene varios años de  dedicarse a la costura, y  cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad modernizar sus máquinas y así poder ofrecer calidad en sus productos, además de aportar mayores ingresos a la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecida con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como profesional.
About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Mirna P. M. is 42 years old, married, and lives iwth her husband and three children ages: 16, 12, and 8. She wants a loan so she can buy a sewing machine and repair another one that is in bad shape. She wants to keep her machines in good condition so she can increase her capacity to produce clothes and also to improve her product. She has made a living sewing for seveal years and is able to count on very good customers. This is why she needs to modernize her machines so she can offer good quality products as well as providing better income for her household. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and is very grateful for the opportunities they have always offered her. In the future she hopes to provide her family a better quality of life and better economic stability. She would also like to continue to grow as a person and as a professional. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FU

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and to repair one that is in bad condition.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa trajeamos en quechua.
Judith es soltera, tiene 39 años y 1 hija, Judith junto a su hermano tienen una tienda en local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes en general, además venden productos de Bimbo y Unión que reparten a las tiendas y market de la ciudad.
Judith necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Judith sueña con tener casa propia, local propio y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Judith is a memember of the Llamkasum Community Bank. Llamkasum means 'We Clothe' in Quechua. Judith is single, 39 years old, and has a daughter. Judith and her brother have a store in a rented property where they sell groceries as well as Bimbo and Unión products that they distribute to the stores and city market.

Judith needs a loan of 2,100 soles to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Judith dreams of having her own home, her own store, and for her daughter to have a professional career.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Crecelia

texts.es:
Crecelia es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa trajeamos en quechua.
Crecelia tiene 30 años y 4 hijos, Crecelia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra animales, la carne lo vende al por mayor.
Crecelia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de animales.
Los sueños de Crecelia son tener un puesto estable para su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Crecelia is a memember of the Llamkasum Community Bank. Llamkasum means 'We Clothe' in Quechua. Crecelia is 30 years old and has 4 children. Crecelia travels to different markets in the area to buy livestock and sell meat in bulk. Crecelia needs a loan of 1,000 soles to invest in the purchase of animals. Crecelia dreams of having a fixed place of business and for her children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Dina Mercedes

texts.es:
Dina es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa trajeamos en quechua.
Dina es casada, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Dina junto a us esposo se dedican a la venta de materiales de construcción, sus ventas los realiza en su local y también reparte a domicilio.
Dina necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de agregados.
Los sueños de Dina son ampliar su casa, comprar mas carros.
texts.en:
Dina is a memember of the Llamkasum Community Bank. Llamkasum means 'We Clothe' in Quechua. Dina is married, 32 years old, and has 2 children. Dina and her husband work selling construction materials from their store and they also deliver to homes. Dina needs a loan of 2,100 soles to buy aggregates. Dina's dreams are to add on to her house and to buy more cars.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy aggregates

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry M. Rubí, tiene la edad de 28 años, está en unión libre, vive con la pareja y sus 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para comprar materiales y remodelar la porqueriza, además, darle mantenimiento al cultivo de café que posee. La idea es reparar el local donde  tiene a los cerdos, ya que se encuentra en mal estado, por lo que desea arreglarlo para el adecuado desarrollo y mantenimiento de los cerdos, y así obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento a la pequeña plantación de café que tiene, para aumentar su producción y obtener una buena cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Henry tiene varios años en este negocio de cría de cerdos y la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Henry M. Rubí is 28 years old. He lives with his common law wife and their two children, aged six and two. He wants the loan to purchase materials and remodel the pigsty. He also wants to maintain the coffee crop that he has. The idea is to repair the place where the pigs are, since it is in a poor state. He wants to fix it in order to have adequate development and maintainance of the pigs so that he can have more income when they are sold. He also wants to maintain his small coffee plantation that he has in order to increase its production and have a good harvest. This is the first time that he has had a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the opportunties they have offered him. Henry has been in the swine raising and agricultural business for several years. In the future, he hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and more finanacial stability, as well as to keep growing as a person and as a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintanance of the coffee and to repair the pigsty for the pigs.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa trajeamos en quechua.
Victoria es separada, tiene 32 años y 4 hijos, Victoria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes en general, ropa y frutas, de las ferias compra animales menores que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y fideos.
Los sueños de Victoria son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the communal bank Llamkasum, which means "we clothe" in Quechua. Victoria is separated. She is 32 years old and has 4 children. Victoria travels to different fairs in the region where she sells general groceries, clothing and fruit. At the fairs, she buys small animals to sell in the city of Ayacucho. Victoria needs a loan of 2,500 soles. This money will be invested in purchasing rice, sugar and pasta. Victoria's dreams are to improve her business and for her children to be have a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and pasta.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa trajeamos en quechua.
Claudia es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Claudia se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos, actividad que realiza en horno alquilado. Además Claudia vende ropa en la feria los días domingos.
Claudia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Los sueños de Claudia son tener horno propio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the Llamkasum communal bank. Llamkasum means "we make clothing" in Quechua (language of the indigenous people of Peru). Claudia is married, 35 years old, and has 4 children. She uses a rented oven to make traditional breads. In addition, she sells clothes in the street market on Sundays. She needs a loan of 1500 soles ($550). The loan proceeds will be invested in flour. Claudia's dreams are to have her own oven and to give a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Magdalena M. G., tiene la edad de 27 años y habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla es casada y sus esposo labora como jardinero y le ayuda económicamente para suplir los gastos del hogar, ellos son una familia de dos hijos pequeños que son la razón de vivir y mejorar sus estándares de vida.

Debido a sus limitados problemas económicos no han podido, realizar unas mejoras que necesitan componer en la infraestructura de su hogar, es por tal razón que ellos solicitan de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción y de esta forma terminar las edificaciones de su vivienda, sobre todo la parte del frente de la casa, el apoyo que se les pueda brindar a la familia les ayudara a cambiar sus estilo de vida y favorecerá al crecimiento óptimo de los pequeños, debido a la delincuencia que habita en los barrios de Managua actualmente.
texts.en:
La señora Maria Magdalena M. G. is 27 years old and lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla district. She is married, and her husband works as a gardener. He helps her with household expenses. They are a family with two small children, and the children are their reason for living and for improving their standard of living. Due to economic difficulties, they have not been able to make needed structural improvements to their home; therefore they have requested a loan to buy construction materials and finish building their home, especially the front of the house. This loan will help them change their life style to one which favors the development of their children and protects them from the current delinquency in the neighborhoods of Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of the front of the dwelling

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El señor Walter K. esta casado con la señora Rossana Maidana  ellos tienen 2 hijos menores  y viven en la casa de sus padres.

Walter  empezó desde muy joven a trabajar  como costurero en el taller de  su tía, luego viajo a la Argentina en busca de algo mejor y logro comprar unas maquinas, hace 2 años que regreso y esta trabajando con su señora en un pequeño local que alquilaron en la ciudad de San Lorenzo; ya tiene una buena clientela y  necesitan de este crédito para la compra de telas polar en cantidad por la temporada que esta llegando.
En el futuro desea construir  para su local propio.
texts.en:
Walter K. is married to Rossana Maidana. They live with their two young children in his parents' house. Walter began working as a tailor at a young age in his aunt's workshop. Later he travelled to Argentina to look for better work and managed to purchase two sewing machines. He returned to Paraguay two years ago and now works with his wife in a small shop which they rent in the city of San Lorenzo. They already have a good client base, so they need this loan to purchase fleece in bulk for the winter season that is on its way. In the future Walter would like to build his own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fleece

loans.name: Sr Cautivo Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR CAUTIVO”; Nuestros socios viven en el valle sagrado de los inkas, en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el Sr. Abel, Nuestro socio nació en el distrito de Lares, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca; Nuestro socio tiene 4to de primaria y no pudo estudiar ninguna carrera, desde muy temprano el socio se dedicó a trabajar para ayudar a sus papas en la crianza de sus hermanos menores, el es conviviente y tiene 2 pequeños hijos, Nuestro socio trabaja como albañil el en el colegio arcoíris, en su tiempo libre se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, el socio compra cuyes en Lares y los lleva a vender a Urubamba el tiene una casita acondicionada para criar cuyes al por mayor. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar más cuyes y el transporte de los mismos.
Nuestros socios se dedican al comercio de yeso, obrero, artesano, venta de productos secos, construcción civil, venta de chicha, crianza de animales menores, venta de golosinas, empleada en restaurante.

 Los socios agradecen y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank 'Sr Cautivo'. They live in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, in Urubamba province, in the Cusco department of Peru. Abel was born in the Lares district, Calca province. He finished the fourth year of primary school and couldn't study a career, so from a very young age he worked helping his parents raise his younger siblings. Abel lives with his partner and has 2 small children. He works as a builder in the Rainbow College. In his spare time he works breeding small animals. He buys guinea pigs in Lares and takes them to sell in Urubamba. Abel has a small air-conditioned house to breed his guinea pigs in. He is seeking a loan to purchase more guinea pigs and transport them. The other members work as plasterers, labourers, artisans, selling dried production, civil construction, selling chicha, breeding small animals, selling sweets, and working in a restaurant. They are all thankful and value the support given by the bank. They promise to meet their debt repayments in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and transport guinea pigs

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Agripina es soltera, tiene 60 años y 4 hijos, Agripina se dedica a la venta de chicha variada que ella prepara en su casa, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado central de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Agripina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, maíz y sorbetes.
El sueño de Agripina es viajar y descansar.
texts.en:
Agripina is a member of the Marcela Communal Bank. She is 60, single, and has 4 children. Agripina works selling different types of chica (the typical Peruvian drink) that she makes in her house. She sells the chicha in the central market of her city every day. Agripina needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy sugar, corn and sherberts. Agripina's dreams are to travel and relax.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, corn and sherberts

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es:
La socia América pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal Las Azucenas, ella tiene una estación donD. venD. accesorios para autos, además aceite, filtros, tiene este negocio hace 4 años los ingresos que obtiene los vuelve a invertir en el negocio, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos mayores, su esposo aporta en casa.
Juana se dedica a la venta D. confiteria como son papitas, chifles, maní, y otros productos hace mas D. 15 años, tiene 10 hijos mayores, pero su preocupación es su compromiso el sufre D. diabetes  así que el préstamo lo invertirá en la venta D. Ceviche, en la puerta D. su casa y así obtener mayores ingresos.
Leonor es consultora D. productos D. belleza, este trabajo le permite aportar con algunos gastos en casa, ella es separada y tiene 6 hijos los cuales mantener así que su objetivo es tener un taller D. belleza para enseñar a otras personas. Nuestros socios destinaran el crédito recibido a la compra D. productos e insumos para mejorar sus ventas y obtener mayores ganancias. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty
texts.en:
América belongs to the Azucenas (Lilies) Community Bank. She has a station where she sells car parts, as well as oil and filters. She has had this business for 4 years and she reinvests her earnings in the business. She is married and has 4 grown children. Her husband helps with the home's expenses.

Juana has worked selling snack foods like potato chips, plantain chips, peanuts, and other products for more than 15 years. She has 10 grown children but her main worry is her partner. He suffers from diabetes. She is going to invest the loan money to sell ceviche from her home and earn more money.

Leonor sells beauty products, and this job lets her earn the money for part of the expenses of the home. She is separated and has 6 children to care for. Her goal is to have a beauty school to teach other people.

The group members will use the loan to buy products and supplies to improve sales and obtain higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and products

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Alejandra es casada, tiene 48 años y 3 hijos, Alejandra vende helados de manera ambulatoria en una calle transitada de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días en una carreta.
Alejandra necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de helados.
El sueño de Alejandra es comprar un carro para ir de viaje.
texts.en:
Alejandra, 48, is a member of the Marcela communal bank. Alejandra is married and has three children. She is an itinerant frozen treat merchant along one of the city’s busy streets; she sells from her cart every day. Alejandra needs a 600 sol loan to buy more frozen treats. Alejandra’s dream is to buy a car so that she can travel.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy frozen treats.

loans.name: Juan Benigno

texts.es:
Juan Benigno A. propietario de un local de Fotocopias y Estacionamiento en pleno centro de la ciudad de Asunción, el mismo es soltero y de profesión estudiante de Canto y Música.
El cliente es el sostén de sus padres con quienes atiende el negocio, con estos ingresos sustenta además sus estudios y sus propios gastos.
Cabe mencionar que con el crédito obtenido de la Fundación Paraguaya realizaría algunos arreglos como mejoras y pintura en su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan Benigno owns a parking lot and photocopying service right in downtown Asunción. He, himself, is single and a student of Music and Singing. He supports his parents, who help him out in the business; this income also pays for his studies and his personal expenses. It’s worth mentioning that he will use the loan obtained from Fundación Paraguaya to make some improvements to his business, like new paint.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for paint and labor costs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Maria es separada, tiene 49 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende especerías que ella misma prepara, además viaja a las ferias de la región llevando sus productos.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra comino, canela.
Maria sueña con aumentar su mercadería y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria, 49, is a member of the Marcela communal bank. She is separated and has two children. Maria has a stall in the 12 de Abril market where she sells spices that she herself prepares; she also travels to regional farmers markets to sell her products. Maria needs a 900 sol loan to buy cumin and cinnamon. Maria dreams with increasing her stock merchandise and to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cumin and cinnamon.

loans.name: Juana Rosario

texts.es: La señora Juana Rosario se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Su esposo trabaja como administrador de una pequeña micro empresa y sirve de apoyo para el ingreso de la familia. Algo que ha influido, en el manejo de su crédito, es la buena administración y el buen uso de los recursos. Juana es una mujer muy trabajadora y disfruta de seguir adelante sus recursos. Pues siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. El sueño de Juana es tener  un pequeño negocio formal en el mercado. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de de materia prima necesaria para su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana Rosario sells assorted merchandise. Her husband manages a small micro enterprise and contributes to family’s income. One of the factors that have been important in the management of her loans is the efficient management and good use of resources. Juana is a hard-working woman who enjoys moving forward with her resources because she is always looking for ways to improve her income. Juana’s dream is to have a small, formal business in the market. She is asking for funds to buy stock merchandise that is needed for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Ruth Marcia

texts.es:
La comunidad San Bartolo se caracteriza por sus bellas praderas, su vegetación exuberante y sus lindos campos y su gente amable y muy cordial como nuestra socia la señora  Ruth Z. es socia del Bankito Progresista hace  dos ciclos, con los préstamos recibidos ha sobrellevado su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras  en el mercado 9 de Octubre  donde labora hace  16 años; ahora con el dinero que reciba comprará fréjol, arveja, zanahoria, remolacha, apio, acelga, naranjas, uvas, fresas, manzanas, guineos, etc.  para abastecer su puesto con productos surtidos.

Ruth tiene 41 años  vive en la comunidad San Bartolo junto a dos de sus tres hijas, la mayor casada con quien comparte la casa y los gastos que en ella se generan y su hija de 14 años que estudia en un colegio de la comunidad;  la segunda hija vive en unión libre de forma independiente con su pareja.  Nuestra socia  se divorció de su esposo hace 14 años porque mucho la maltrataba.
su meta es de poder seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The San Bartolo community is known for its lovely meadows, thick vegetation, beautiful fields, as well as friendly, cordial people, such as Mrs. Ruth Z., member of the Bankito Progresista for two cycles now. Using loans granted, she has maintained her business, which is selling produce in the October 9 Market, where she has been for 16 years. With the money granted her, she will buy beans, peas, carrots, beets, celery, chard, oranges, grapes, strawberries, apples, bananas, etc. to stock her stall with a variety of products. Ruth is 41 years old, and lives in the San Bartolo community with two or her three daughters. She shares a house with the oldest, sharing expenses as well, and her 14-year-old daughter, who is a student in one of the community’s high schools. The second daughter lives independently with her common-law husband. Ruth divorced her husband 14 years ago, because he abused her. Her goal is to continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, peas, carrots, beets, celery, chard, oranges, grapes, strawberries, applies, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Ellvira

texts.es:
La Sra. Elvira Cristina F. propietaria de una despensa de Nombre Apolo 11 ubicado en el barrio Tacumbu de la Ciudad de Asunción, con antigüedad de mas de 7 años.
 Es soltera, madre de 2 hijos la misma vive en casa propia y el local es atendido personalmente por la propietaria.
Con el crédito que solicita desea aumentar su capital operativo inventario para responder mejor a las necesidades y exigencias de su clientela.
Ella quiere anexar a su negocio artículos de ferretería y electricidad de primera necesidad como cables, focos, baldes, clavos, pinturas, caños y otros.
Desea mucho progresar mediante la ampliación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Elvira Cristina F. has owned a store, called Apolo 11, located in Asunción‘s Tacumbu neighborhood, for over 7 years. She is a single mother of two children; she lives in her own house and she, herself, tends to her store. She will use the requested funds to increase her operating capital to better meet customer needs and demand. She wants to add hardware and basic electrical items like cables, light bulbs, buckets, nails, paint, etc. to her store’s stock. She very much wants to progress by enlarging her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nails, paint, lightbulbs, plastic pipes, cables, etc.

loans.name: Teofano Rene

texts.es:
Rene forma parte del banco comunal “MI PERU”,  tiene 30 años y es soltero. 

Su principal actividad económica es la fabricación de muebles de madera, el tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería que funciona en la casa de su abuelo. El socio aprendió el oficio en el Centro Educativo Ocupacional de Garcilaso. Ya son 7 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Rene es un joven responsable y emprendedor que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, él requiere el préstamo para comprar el motor de la maquina cierra circular que cuesta 450 soles y el disco que cuesta 30 soles. El sueño del socio es tener su propia casa.    

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Rene is a member of “MI PERU” communal bank; he is single and 30 years old. His main commercial activity is furniture manufacturing. He has a small carpentry workshop in his grandfather’s house; he learned his trade at the Garcilaso Occupational Education Center. He has been in this line of work for 7 years now and does quite well. Rene is a responsible and enterprising young man who is always looking for ways to get ahead and to help his family through his daily efforts. He needs funds to buy the motor for his circular saw that costs 450 soles; the blade costs 30. His dream is to have his own house. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor and blade for his circular saw.

loans.name: Mariano Nieves

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestro socio es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el Sr. Mariano,  Nuestro socio tiene 56 años de edad es casado y tiene 4 hijos independientes todos, Nuestro socio se dedica a la agricultura, el siembra papa, maíz, avena, habas, alverjas, quinua y tarwi, Nuestro socio nos comenta que la producción de sus sembríos está sufriendo una plaga que está matando todo lo que sembró, por lo que está preocupado por su futura cosecha, el socio solicita el préstamo para poder comprar semillas, abono, en esta época que está más barato y así no le costará tanto para el tiempo de nueva cosecha.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Sacro Communal Bank. He is a native of the Cruz Pata community, in the town of Chinchero, Urubamba province, department of Cuzco. Mariano is 56 years old, married, and has 4 children, all of whom live independently. He is a farmer, growing potatoes, corn, oats, beans, peas, quinoa, and tarwi. He tells us that his crops are suffering from a disease that is killing everything he sowed, and that he is worried about the harvest. He asks for a loan to buy seed and fertilizer, which are cheaper right now, and thus won’t cost so much at harvest time. Mariano is grateful for and appreciates the support offered to him by this means, and commits to paying off his debt per the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for sowing his land

loans.name: Editha

texts.es:
Editha tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de una hermana en la ciudad de Chiclayo, conocida a nivel nacional por su movimiento comercial y de transporte. Es conocida como La Ciudad de la Amistad.

Se dedica a trabajar como vendedora y confeccionista de prendas de vestir desde hace un año. Inició trabajando hace cinco años en un pequeño taller de confección de prendas de vestir, fue así como se interesó en el rubro y hace un año logró independizarse. Ella ha logrado alquilar un puesto en una de las principales galerías comerciales de la ciudad y allí se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir para ofrecerlas a la venta, por otro lado también encarga ropa al por mayor en la ciudad de Lima para ofrecerla en su puesto de venta.

Editha trata de sacar adelante a su negocio con mucho esfuerzo, la calidad de las prendas que confecciona han hecho que su puesto tenga muy buena acogida. Ella desea adquirir ropa de temporada otoño – invierno para complementar su negocio y poco a poco ampliarlo, siguiendo su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograrlo.

Editha es una joven alegre y bastante trabajadora, ella también estudia una carrera técnica porque sabe que así obtiene mas posibilidades de salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su taller y crear su propia linea de ropa.
texts.en:
Editha, 25, is single and lives in her sister’s house in Chiclayo, a city known countrywide for its commercial activity and transportation; it is known as the City of Friendship. For the last year she has worked as a seamstress and selling clothing. She started out five years ago working in a small seamstress workshop and this is how she became interested in this line of work; a year ago she managed to become independent. She has leased a small stand in one of the city’s main shopping malls where she makes clothing to sell; she also buys clothes at wholesale in Lima to sell in her stand. Editha puts a lot of effort into her attempt to succeed in her work; the quality of the clothing items she makes has made them quite sought-after. She wants to get clothing for the fall-winter season to increase her available stock. To help her reach this goal, she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a 1500 new sol loan. Editha is a cheerful and quite hard-working young woman; she’s also studying a technical career because she realizes that this affords more possibilities to get ahead in life. Her greatest wish is to enlarge her workshop and to create her own fashion line.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing.

loans.name: Nelbi

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es el Sra. NELBI,  Nuestra socia tiene 37 años  conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, de 17 y 10 años de edad, nuestra socia trabaja desde hace muchos años en el transporte ella tiene un par de combis que prestan servicio urbano en la ciudad del Cusco y la socia ahora solicita el préstamo para poder ampliar su casita y construir un ambiente más, la socia está trabajando con este banco comunal 3 años y también tiene sus tierras agrícolas y siembra papa y maíz.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nelbi is a member of the community bank SACRO. She is native to the town of Chinchero, Urubamba Province, Cusco. Nelbi is 37 years old, married, and has two children, age 17 and 10. For a number of years, she has been working in the transportation field. Nelbi has a few vans that she uses for an urban shuttle service in Cusco. Nelbi has applied for a loan so that she can do some home renovations. She has been working with SACRO for three years. She also has land where she grows potatoes and corn. Nelbi appreciates your support, and promises to make all her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 59  años y tiene cinco hijos. Es socia nueva y por primera vez que participa en el banco comunal.

Su principal actividad económica es vender comestibles en su domicilio, ella acomodo una habitación de su domicilio para convertirla en una tienda de venta de abarrotes. Ella abre la tienda a las 5 de la mañana y cierra a las 10  de la noche. Ella es una madre joven, responsable y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un  mejor futuro a su hijo, ella requiere el crédito para comprar dos exhibidores para poner pescado y pollo y para comprar también comestibles como por ejemplo azúcar, fideos, arroz, leche, pan, etc.  El anhelo de la socia es sacar profesional a sus hijos. 

Norma se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the community bank Mi Peru, which is part of the Arariwa Association. She is 59 years old and has five children. She’s a new member; this is her first time working with Mi Peru. Her primary source of income is selling foods in her home, where she converted one room into a grocery store. She opens at 5 AM and closes at 10 PM. She is still a young woman, and an entrepreneur who feels responsible for seeking out every opportunity to succeed. She works every day to create a better future for her children. She needs this loan so that she can buy two display cases for fish and chicken. She will also buy sugar, noodles, rice, milk, bread, etc. Norma wants to be professional and successful so that she can help her children. She’s grateful for your support, and has promised to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying display cases and grocery items.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es el Sra. VALERIA,  Nuestra socia tiene 56 años  la socia es viuda y tiene 2 hijos, de 28 y 26 años de edad, nuestra socia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, ella cuida a su nieta con mucho amor y se la lleva a todo lado, nuestra socia  también compra y vende productos secos como son, habas, maíz de toda variedad, cebada, trigo, quinua. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas de maíz, y de papa para la venta.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the lending group "SACRO". She is a native of the Cruz Pata community in the town of Chincero in the province of Urubamba, in Cusco department.

This borrower is named Valeria. She is 56 years old. She is a widow and has two children, 28 and 26 years old. She has a small grocery store. She lovingly takes care of her granddaughter and brings her with her everywhere. She also sells and buys dry products like beans, all types of corn, barley, wheat and quinoa. She is requesting this loan to buy seeds for corn and potatoes to sell.

Valeria is grateful for and values the support offered by these loan services. She promises to make her repayments in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for corn and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Demetrio Calendonio

texts.es:
El señor Demetrio Calendonio C. es casado y habita en el barrio La Borgoña, tiene 9 hijos, los mayores están casados y los menores estudian y apoyan a sus padres en los trabajos del campo, debido a que los ellos se dedican a la agricultura de frutas cítricas.

Desde hace más de 26 años, se dedican a esto y fue con el apoyo de sus padres y su esfuerzo propio, que se valió de los recursos necesarios para realizar la compra de un terreno, ahora con el problema de la sequia y la afectación de los de las plagas y enfermedades, solicitan un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos vegetativos que provean a las tierras de mejores condiciones de producción que a futuro favorezcan económicamente a la familia.
texts.en:
Demetrio Calendonio C. is married and lives in the La Borgoña neighborhood. He has 9 children the older ones are married and the younger ones are students and help their parents with field work because they farm citrus fruits. They have been farmers for over 26 years. With help from his parents and his own effort he was able to buy a field. However, the current drought, pest infestations and plant illnesses make it necessary to request funds to buy fertilizers and farm supplies that will provide their lands with better production conditions that will favor the family in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and fungicides.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es el Sra. TOMASAI,  Nuestra socia tiene 58 años  casada y tiene 1 hijo, de 13 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura, nuestra socia tiene terrenos de cultivos en los que produce papa, maíz, habas, cereales, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora desde muy temprano está tras de sus animalitos llevándolos a pastear y después a limpiar poco a poco su terreno ahora nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar abono, semillas, y guardará un poco para pagar el jornal (el diario de trabajo) de sus trabajadores en cuando hagan la siembra.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Tomasa belongs to the community bank “Sacro”. She comes from the town of Chinchero in the community of Cruz Pata, which belongs to the province of Urubamba, located in the department of Cusco. Tomasa is 58 years old and has one 13 year old son. Tomasa alternates between her domestic and agricultural tasks to tend to her cultivated land which produces potato, corn and cereal. She is a very hardworking woman, getting up very early in the morning to take her animals out to pasture. Now that she has cleared her land she is applying for a loan to purchase fertiliser and seeds, and to keep some to pay her workers after they sow the seeds. Tomasa is very grateful for the valuable support which Kiva offers her and promises to make her repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser, corn seeds, potatoes, cereal and pay workers

loans.name: Elsa Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 66 años y tiene tres hijos. Ya son dos ciclos que participa en el banco comunal.

Su principal actividad económica es vender comida  de forma ambulatoria. Ella sale a vender a las 5 de la mañana y  se va a las 10  de la mañana. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien. Ella es padre y madre para sus hijos y es una madre responsable y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un  mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella requiere el crédito para apoyar al negocio de su hija. (El negocio de su hija es hacer llamadas a celulares móviles de forma ambulatoria). 

Gregoria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “MI PERU” communal bank; she is 66 years old and has three children. She has participated in two communal bank cycles. Her main commercial activity is being an itinerant food saleswoman. She goes out to sell at 5am and stays out until 10am; she’s been in this line of work for 10 years and has done well. She is both father and mother to her children and she is a responsible and enterprising mother who is always looking for ways to get ahead in life and provide a better future for her family through her own daily efforts. She needs funds to support her daughter’s business. (Her daughter provides itinerant cell phone calling services). Gregoria is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support her daughter's cell phone business.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El comité “Santa Ana”se formó gracias al deseo de superación y mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de sus integrantes. 
Incluyen entre las actividades realizadas la venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comestibles artesanales como empanadas de carne, empanadas de pollo, venta de mercaderías varias como :fideo ,azúcar , harina ,aceite, jabón, entre otros artículos ,venta de ropas , venta de remedios etc.
Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales  para  su desarrollo y formación.  
Así como la se María quien se dedica a la venta de ropas. Ella es un mujer muy trabajadora para mantener a su familia ya que viaja por el interior del país para vender sus ropas.
Ella viaja hasta los lugares donde tiene su cliente y trabajo con ellos en forma al contado y a crédito.
Nos comenta que el futuro le gustaría comprar u vehiculo para su traslado ya que es sacrificado el manejo en bus.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de vestir en gran cantidad, como camperas, abrigos, pantalones.
texts.en:
The “Santa Ana” committee was formed thanks to its members’ desire to succeed and improve their quality of life. Among their commercial activities are: fruit and vegetable sales, traditional food, like meat and chicken turnovers, sales, grocery and general merchandise, like pasta, sugar, flour, cooking oil, soap, etc., sales, clothing sales, home remedies sales, etc. They all want better futures for their children so they work doubly hard to provide the tools necessary for their development and formation. Such is the case of María who sells clothing. She is a very hard-working woman who, in order to support her family, travels to the interior of the country to sell her clothes. She travels where ever she has customers and sells both for cash and on credit. She comments that she’d like to buy a vehicle in the future because all the travel she does by bus is quite exhausting. She is asking for funds to buy large quantities of articles of clothing like jackets, coats and pants.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jackets, coats and pants.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marcos Antonio F. P., es  casado y habita en el Barrio Medardo Andino, tiene 3 hijos y el mayor de 18 años, trabaja y apoya en los gastos del hogar, los dos menores dependen económicamente de la cabeza familiar.

Ellos se dedican a la carpintería y tienen su taller y uno de los principales problemas que los agobian, es la falta de materiales y maquinaria para realizar las ofertas de trabajo que se le presentan, él comenzó con el taller, gracias a su esfuerzo propio y su ahorro diario de años atrás, a futuro comprara un torno, que mejore y agilice las labores, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo,  para la compra de un mayor inventario de madera que pueda aumentarle las ventas y favorezca su economía  doméstica.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcos Antonio F. P. is married and lives in the district of Medardo Andino. He has three children, the oldest of whom is 18 and works and helps support the household expenses. The two younger children are financially dependent upon the head of the family. Marcos and his son devote themselves to carpentry and have their own workshop. One of the main problems that hold them back are the lack of materials and machinery to carry out the offers of work they are presented with. Marcos started his workshop through his own effort and his long-term savings. He would like to buy a lathe, which would improve and speed up the work, and is the reason he asks for a loan, as well as for the purchase of a larger wood supply, which will increase his sales and improve his household finances.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick Clarke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material for his business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es el Sra. MARTHA,  Nuestra socia tiene 41 años  casada y tiene 3 hijos, de 21, 18, 5 años de edad, nuestra socia trabaja  vendiendo granos secos, la socia a fin de no ausentarse de casa acomodó una pequeña tienda en su casa hacia la calle principal y puso todo tipo de granos para la venta, (trigo, maíz, habas secas, quinua, arvejas) Nuestra socilita el préstamo para comprar granos al por mayor.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Martha belongs to the community bank “Sacro”. She comes from the community of Cruz Pata in Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba, located in the department of Cusco. Martha is 41 years old, married, and has three children of 21, 18 and 5 years of age. She works selling dried beans and grains. As Martha couldn't leave her house to work, she set up a small store in her own house which faces the main street and offers many types of dried beans and grains to purchase, such as wheat, corn, dried beans, quinoa and peas. She is applying for a loan to buy dried beans and grains in bulk. Martha is grateful for the valuable support provided by this institution and promises to complete her repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dried beans and grains in bulk

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es el Sra. ANDREA,  Nuestra socia tiene 38 años  casada y tiene 4 hijos, de 19, 17, 15, 6 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista ella tiene  un  pequeño negocio de venta de chicha en su casa, la socia misma lo elabora con maíz fermentado, Nuestra socia también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados y a su respectivo engorde, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder compra un torete pequeño, ella tiene 2 toros actualmente.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Sacro Community Bank. She is a native of the Cruz Pata community, in the town of Chinchero, Urubamba province, department of Cusco. Andrea is 38 years old, married, and has four children who are 19, 17, 15, and 6 years old. She alternates her various activities with her retail business. Andrea has a small business selling chicha (a sweet drink made of corn) from her home; she makes the chicha herself from fermented corn. She also buys and sells livestock, as well as raising them. Andrea requests this loan to buy a small bull; she currently has two bulls. Andrea is thankful and appreciative of the support offered here and promises to pay what she owes in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a small bull

loans.name: María Teodora

texts.es:
María Teodora es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el sector Arbolsol del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito de la provincia de Lambayeque caracterizado por poseer a la mayoría de su población agrupada en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre si, la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace 24 años a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría aves de corral, cerdos y vacas en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando los animales que cría alcanzan un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los diversos negociantes que visitan la zona. El negocio es de mucha utilidad para la economía familiar, ya que las ganancias que percibe complementan los ingresos que percibe su esposo como peón agrícola y ayudan al sostenimiento de la familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más cerdos y aves, además también tiene planeado adquirir alimento balanceado para que estos de desarrollen correctamente. Esta acción le permitirá percibir mas ganancias y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a alcazar su meta.

María es una mujer bastante entregada a los suyos y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacarlos adelante. En la zona donde vive ella es muy estimada, sus vecinos le consideran una persona tranquila y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
María Teodora is a mother, 36 years old, who lives with her husband and three children in the Arbosol sction of the Mórrope district, a district in the Lambayeque Province, known for having the majority of the population grouped in rural areas that are distanced from one another. The area is located one hour and 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Since she was 24 years old she's devoted herself to raising and selling animals. She raised ranch birds, pigs, and cows in the backyard of her home. When the animals she raised reach a certain healthy point of development, she sells them to diverse merchants that visit the zone. The business is quite useful for the family's economics, as her earnings complement the income her husband makes as a farm worker, and they help sustain the family. Maria wants to enlarge her business by buying more pigs and birds. In addition she's planning to buy nutritious feed so that her livestock develop in healthy ways. This action will enable her to achieve greater profits and help her family move forward. For this reason, she's come to see the need to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 soles to help her reach her goal. Maria is a rather generous woman who always does her best to move her family forward. In the neighborhood where she lives she is highly regarded and her neighbors consider her a calm person who will help anyone who needs it.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs, farm birds and nutritious feed to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Gladys Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU” de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 23  años. Ya son tres ciclos que participa en el banco comunal. Su principal actividad económica es atender el restaurante “Antojitos” que está ubicado cerca a la plaza de armas de la ciudad Cusco. Ella trabaja como moza desde 9 mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. 

Ella por las tardes estudia la carrera profesional de turismo en el instituto superior “Khipu” y está cursando el cuarto semestre, ella nos cuenta que con su trabajo paga sus mensualidades.

Zoraida es una joven responsable que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregarse un mejor futuro. Ella requiere el crédito para pagar sus mensualidades del instituto. El anhelo de la socia es abrir su propio restaurante  turístico  en la plaza de armas.   

Zoraida se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Zoraida belongs to the loan group "Mi Peru" of the Arariwa Association. She is 23 years old. She has been a part of this loan group for three cycles. Her main economic activity is serving in the restaurant Antojitos, which is located close to the Plaza de Armas in Cusco. She works as a waitress from 9 in the morning to 3 in the afternoon.

In the afternoons, she takes a course in tourism in the Instituto Superior Khipu. She is in her fourth semester. She tells us that she pays her monthly school fees by working.

Zoraida is a responsible young woman who is always looking for the opportunity to progress and secure a better future with her daily efforts. She needs a loan to pay for her monthly school fees at the Instituto. Her dream is to open her own restaurant for tourists in the Plaza de Armas.

Zoraida is thankful for the opportunity provided by Kiva and promises to make her repayments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying school fees

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
La señora Maura T. M., es casada y con sus dos hijos habitan en el Barrio Laureles Norte, el señor labora como taxista y el hijo menor trabaja, el hijo mayor ayuda a sus padres en los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen una pulpería desde hace 5 años, siendo esta una fuente de ingresos importante para la familia.

En los últimos meses las ventas han disminuido, debido a la crisis económica por la que atraviesa el país, sumado a esto no tienen los recursos necesarios para suplir de un mayor inventario el negocio, es por esta razón que solicita este préstamo para la compra de mercadería de uso domestico, abarrote y uso personal, ellos lograron emprender este negocio gracias a la buen ahorro de la cabeza del hogar, con este préstamo ellos buscan aumentar las ganancias del hogar y de esta forma a futuro remodelar su hogar, que necesita de unos cambios a la infraestructura que garantice una mejor vida económico social a toda la familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Maura T. M. is married and has two children. She and her family live in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte. Her husband works as a taxi driver. The older child works and the younger child helps with the household expenses. Maura has been managing a store for the past five years, since it is an important source of income for her family.

Sales have decreased in recent months as a result of the economic crisis that is affecting the country. In addition, she does not have the necessary resources to buy a large supply of inventory for her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise such as household products, groceries, and personal use items. Maura managed to start her business as a result of being a good saver in her role as a head of household. The proceeds from the loan will help increase her household income and provide for future home renovations since a few infrastructural changes are needed to guarantee a better life for her entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es el Sra. PLACIDA,  Nuestra socia tiene 41 años  casada y tiene 2 hijos, de 11 y 9 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura, la socia se dedica a cocinar cuando los varones siembran las tierras, y también deshierban los cultivos cuando la mala hierba va creciendo junto a lo sembrado, Nuestra socia trabaja vendiendo todo lo que su tierra produce, vende papa, maíz, habas y lo que ese año hayan producido. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas para plantar en sus terrenos.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Placida is a member of the “Sacro” (Sacred) Communal Bank. She is originally from the community of Cruz Pata in the town of Chinchero, which is part of Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Placida is 41 years old, married, and has two children (ages 11 and 9). She divides her time between her household activities and farming.
