Placida prepares food while the men are working in the fields. She also works the land by removing weeds that can impact her crops. Placida sells everything that is produced on her land such as potatoes, corn, and beans that are grown that year. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds to plant.

Placida appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Diana C. tienen 27 años  es soltera y vive con sus padres  en una casita pequeña de su propiedad, ellos se dedican a la agricultura y ella a la venta de almuerzos y meriendas gracias al apoyo de sus padres que le otorgaron un lugar de la casa y su madre le enseñó su rica sazón para preparar sus platos, lleva cuatro años en ésta labor.

 Es socia del Bankito Progresista hace tres ciclos, con los créditos obtenidos ha ido incrementando poco a poco su negocio y el dinero que recibirá del nuevo préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de mesas, sillas, vajillas y algo de menaje de cocina.

Este banco comunal está ubicado en la ciudad  de Cuenca considera  la ciudad más bella del país por su paisaje natural andino que se divisa cuando se ingresa a la ciudad marcado por la linea del  horizonte que forman  las cúpulas radiantes de sus iglesias. Sus calles empedradas, sus ríos serpenteados, agraciados balcones de hierro, y bellos jardines forman parte de la atmósfera afable de esta ciudad histórica. 

Su meta es seguir estudiando y alcanzar su título en Contabilidad y Auditoria
texts.en:
Diana C. is 27 years old, single, and lives with her parents in a small house on their own property. While her parents engage in agriculture, Diana sells lunches and snacks. Her parents helped her by providing a place in their house for her to work. Diana’s mother taught her how to prepare flavorful dishes. She has been in this business for four years.

Diana has been a member of the “Progresita” (Progressive) Communal Bank for three loan cycles. The loans she has obtained have helped increase her business gradually. Using the proceeds from her new loan, she will purchase tables, chairs, dishes, and a few kitchen utensils.

This Communal Bank is located in the city of Cuenca, which is considered to be the most beautiful city in the country because of its natural Andean landscapes. Upon entering the city, the site of church domes line the horizon. This historic city is made up of cobblestone streets, meandering rivers, charming wrought iron balconies, and beautiful gardens that contribute to the friendly atmosphere.

Diana’s goal is to continue her studies and obtain her degree in accounting and auditing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs, dishes, and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Narcisa Del Pilar

texts.es:
Narcisa M. de 40 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín (lugar muy humilde, con calles de tierra y casa de caña) de Guayaquil. Solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Su esposo trabaja dando mantenimiento a las maquinas de una empresa, ellos tienen dos hijos de 6 y 4 años. 

Narcisa empezó vendiendo meriendas en la puerta de su casa a todas las personas que pasaban caminando, pero debido a los malos ingresos que tenia decidió retirarse y empezar otra actividad. Por esa mala decisión tuvo que iniciar un nuevo negocio con poca inversión e inicio la venta de artesanías.     

La venta de artesanías le rindió buenas ganancias y ahora es su principal actividad, trabaja todos los fines de semana sola. Ella hace muñecos de maneras, muñecos de trapos, cadenas etc. Con el préstamo quiere construir mejor su casa y comprar cemento, bloques y piedras para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y poder darle una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Narcisa M. is 40 years old and lives in the periurban district of Fortín in Guayaquil. This modest place has dirt roads and houses made of reeds. Narcisa receives electricity as her only basic service. Her husband works for a company by maintaining its machinery. They have two children, ages 6 and 5.

Narcisa began selling afternoon snacks from the doorstep of her house to people who pass through the area. Due to her low earnings, she decided to quit and start another business. With little investment, she began selling crafts.

Making and selling handicrafts generates good revenue, so it is now her main business activity. She works alone every weekend. She produces handmade dolls, rag dolls, chains, and other items. With this loan, she wants to improve her home and buy cement, blocks, and stone for her business.

In the future, she wants to build a better house and provide her children with a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, blocks, and stone

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es:
La señora Johanna O. G. es casada y madre de  2 hijos pequeños que dependen económicamente de ellos, ella tiene 36 años y hace 3 años emprendieron un negocio de venta de  abarrotes, productos para el hogar y personal.

Fue gracias a la ayuda de su esposo que lograron la apertura de la pulpería, desean invertir en el negocio en la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería, para el negocio, es por esta razón que solicitan de este préstamo, esperan se les apoye económicamente para tener una mejor estabilidad económica que les beneficie a futuro en proyecto de la familia. Este no es el primer prestamo que tienen con Afodenic, gracias a este apoyo es que ellos han  logrado evolucionar el negocio, y cada dia mejoran sus niveles de vida, esperan que esta no sea la excepción.
texts.en:
Sra. Johanna O. G. is 36 years old, married, and the mother of two young children who are financially dependent on her. She started a business three years ago selling groceries, including household and personal products.

Thanks to help from her husband, she was able to open her store. She wants to invest in a large supply of merchandise for her business, which is why she is requesting this loan. Johanna seeks support in hopes of having better financial stability that will benefit her family in the future. This is not her first loan with AFODENIC. Thanks to her previous loans, she was able to develop her business and improve each day her standard of living. She hopes this loan will be no exception.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es el Sra. VICTORIA,  Nuestra socia tiene 53 años  es casada y tiene 4 hijos, todos ellos independientes; nuestra socia se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivos y siembran papa, maíz, habas, hortalizas, quinua, tarwi y según la época. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abono y pagar el tractor para remover la tierra antes de sembrar.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria is a member of the “Sacro” (Sacred) Communal Bank. She is originally from the community of Cruz Pata in the town of Chinchero, which is part of Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Victoria is 53 years old, married, and has four children who are all independent. She spends her time farming and raising small animals. Victoria has land on which she grows potatoes, corn, lima beans, vegetables, quinoa, “tarwi” (a type of bean grown in the Andes), and other crops according to the season. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and compost. In addition, she will pay to have a tractor till her land prior to planting.

Victoria appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & compost; rent a tractor to till her land

loans.name: Alfredo Ernesto

texts.es:
El   Señor. ALFREDO ERNESTO L. A., Labora como Conserje en el Teatro Nacional Rubén Darío de Managua.
El tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y estos se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, como: zinc, perlines y clavos para el techo de su casa de habitación ya que anteriormente se encuentra en malas condiciones.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
El Señor. ALFREDO ERNESTO L. A., Labora como Conserje en el Teatro Nacional Rubén Darío de Managua. El tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y estos se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, como: zinc, perlines y clavos para el techo de su casa de habitación ya que anteriormente se encuentra en malas condiciones. Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Tito  Doroteo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestro socio es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el Sr. TITO,  Nuestro socio tiene 48 años  es separado y tiene 3 hijos, de 18, 16, 8 años de edad, nuestro socio se dedica a la agricultura, el tiene sus terrenos de cultivo de maíz, papa, habas, entro otros productos, el socio también cría ganados vacunos para la venta, Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un pequeño toro, para criarlo y hacerlo reproducir en su debido tiempo.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Tito is a member of the “Sacro” (Sacred) Communal Bank. He is originally from the community of Cruz Pata in the town of Chinchero, which is part of Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

Sr. Tito is 48 years old, separated from his spouse, and has three children (ages 18, 16, and 8). He is a farmer who has land on which he grows corn, potatoes, beans, and other products. Tito also raises cattle to sell. He is requesting a loan to buy a small bull to raise for breeding in due time.

He appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, he promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a small bull

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: La señora Janeth V. R., labora,tiene 37 añoes de edad es madre soltera labora como conserge en la UNIVERSIDAD CATOLICA DE NICARAGUA me siento agradecida con el financiamiento que CEPRODEL me ha otorgado y el tiempo en que me lo tramitaron ya que era de urgencia , para comprar algunas laminas de cin para mi vivienda ya que esta en mal estado y ya viene el invierno y no quiero mojatrme.
texts.en:
La señora Janeth V. R., labora,tiene 37 añoes de edad es madre soltera labora como conserge en la UNIVERSIDAD CATOLICA DE NICARAGUA me siento agradecida con el financiamiento que CEPRODEL me ha otorgado y el tiempo en que me lo tramitaron ya que era de urgencia , para comprar algunas laminas de cin para mi vivienda ya que esta en mal estado y ya viene el invierno y no quiero mojatrme.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: mejoras de vivienda

loans.name: Josefa Dolores

texts.es: Doña Josefa es una mujer trabajadora de edad de 36 años, con una bonita familia de tres hijos estudiantes, su esposo trabaja como cadete. Desde hace varios años formo su pequeño negocio, una vulcanización, en donde también vende nacatamales, frito, lo que empezó con una necesidad de poder apoyar a su familia ya que con lo que su esposo daba, no ajustaba. Con ahorros compro un freezer en donde guarda la carne que prepara para los alimentos. Su casa es sencilla y no ha logrado hacer las mejoras ya que con las ganancias ha logrado invertir en la vulcanización  y con lo que su esposo gana cubre la alimentación. Su casa es de tabla ya muy vieja pero lo primero es que quiere invertir en el negocio para dar un mejor servicio en la vulcanización ya que hay mucha demanda y su meta es la captación de  más clientes. Con este financiamiento comprara llantas usadas, neumáticos y acondicionara la vulcanización.
texts.en:
Doña Josefa is a hardworking woman who is 36 years of age. Her beautiful family includes her three school age children and her husband who works as a military cadet. Several years ago she and her husband opened a small business providing tire repair services. In addition, she sold Nicaraguan tamales and fried foods to help support her family since she was not familiar with her husband’s work. Josefa used her savings to buy a freezer for keeping meat used in the preparation of her dishes.

Her house is modest and in need of improvements. However, Josefa and her husband have not been able to make any repairs because her income is invested into the tire shop and his earnings go toward feeding the family. Their house is very old and made of wooden boards, but first, they want to invest in the tire business so that they can provide better service. There is great demand and they have a goal of attracting more customers. With this loan, Josefa will buy used rims and tires to stock her repair shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rims & tires

loans.name: Olga Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Olga Cristina D. A. tiene la edad de 44 años, es casada y su esposo labora como camionero, ellos con sus dos hijos habitan en el Barrio Laureles Norte, ellos tienen una pulpería que desde hace 6 años ha suplido el sustento para la humilde familia.

Los planes a futuro es el convertir su pequeño negocio en una miscelánea, es por esta razón que solicita de un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de productos, en el pasado ha tenido problemas con el flujo del dinero, debido a que opto por una forma de pago al crédito, a sus clientes y le han quedo mal en la cancelación de sus deudas, es por esta razón que solicita de un mayor préstamo, para comenzar nuevamente con nuevas clientelas y nuevas medidas de pago  se hagan efectivos el día de la compra, el apoyo brindado a la familia, aportara ha mejores estabilidades económicas que beneficien a toda la familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Olga Cristina D. A. lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte. She is 44 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband works as a truck driver. They have a grocery store that she has been managing for six years to help support their humble family.

Olga’s plans for the future include converting her small business into a variety store. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy a large supply of merchandise. In the past, she has had problems with cash flow because she has chosen to offer credit as a payment option. Her customers have not been very good at paying their bills. By requesting a larger loan, she hopes to start fresh by attracting new customers and instituting a policy of payment at the time of purchase. The support provided to her family will give them the benefit of improved financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a large supply of merchandise for her business

loans.name: Juana Vanessa

texts.es:
Juana es una joven de 25 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Pacora, un distrito agrícola perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque, es conocido a nivel regional por sus festividades religiosas, se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir a pedido, adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Chiclayo y la distribuye entre sus vecinos y conocidos de acuerdo a los pedidos que le solicitan, adicionalmente cuenta con un stock permanente de ropa  que ofrece en venta todos los domingos en el mercado de su distrito. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales, de educación y para apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia. Juana estudia computación en un Instituto de la ciudad de Lambayeque, ella desea salir adelante y debido a ello se esfuerza mucho por sobresalir en sus estudios. 

En los ultimos meses, su negocio ha tenido un aumento de demanda, dado a la calidad de prendas de vestir que ofrece, por ello actualmente desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas mercadería, siguiendo su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1400 nuevos soles.

Juana es una joven empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y tener su propio establecimiento de ropa. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Juana is a young woman who is 25 years of age, single, and lives with her parents in the District of Pacora. This agricultural district is part of Lambayeque Province, which is known on a national level for its religious festivals. It is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Juana sells clothing by order. She acquires her merchandise in the city of Chiclayo and delivers the products to her neighbors and acquaintances according to what they requested. In addition, she maintains a permanent stock of clothing to sell every Sunday at the district market. The revenue she generates goes toward her personal expenses, her education, and support for her family. Juana is studying information technology at an institution in the city of Lambayeque. She wants to get ahead and work hard so that she can excel in her studies.

In recent months, her business has experienced increased demand as a result of the quality of clothing she offers. She now wants to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise. To accomplish this objective, Juana has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1400 PEN.

Juana is a trustworthy and hardworking young woman. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and open her own clothing establishment. She has worked previously with Edpyme Alternativa and demonstrated that she is a punctual and responsible client when it comes to completing her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestro socio es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el Sr. ALBERTO,  Nuestro socio tiene 49 años  es casado y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos aún son dependientes y tiene 14,12 años de edad, nuestro socio se dedica a la agricultura y tiene su triciclo en Urubamba allá el socio presta servicio de transporte en triciclo, el lleva carga pesada a los mercados y terminales, Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para su esposa, ella trabaja en Urubamba en el mercado ella vende granos secos de lo que ambos producen en los terrenos, su esposa logró comprar su stand en el mercado y el socio le dará el dinero para que ella venda cereales y papas en el.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Sacro Community Bank. He is a native of the Cruz Pata community, in the town of Chinchero, Urubamba province, department of Cusco. Alberto is 49 years old, married, and has five children, two of which are 14 and 12 years old and still dependents. Alberto works in agriculture and has a tricycle cart in Urubamba. There, he offers transportation services on his tricycle cart, carrying heavy loads to the markets and terminals. Alberto requests this loan for his wife. She works in Urubamba in the market, selling dry grain that they both produce on their land. His wife bought herself a stand in the market, and he will give her the money to sell grain and potatoes there. Alberto is thankful and appreciative of the support offered here and promises to pay what she owes in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dry grain and potatoes for his wife's stand in the Urubamba market

loans.name: Daniel Adolfo

texts.es:
El  Señor.   DANIEL ADOLFO M. G., Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua
El tiene seis hijos a su cargo, y cuatro  de  ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado nueve  créditos con CEPRODEL durante nueve años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los nueve  créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, hierro, cemento y piedrin para la construcción de un baño en su casa de habitación. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
El Señor. DANIEL ADOLFO M. G., Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua El tiene seis hijos a su cargo, y cuatro de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado nueve créditos con CEPRODEL durante nueve años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los nueve créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, hierro, cemento y piedrin para la construcción de un baño en su casa de habitación. Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Juan Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo forma parte del banco comunal “MI PERU”,  tiene 41 años y tiene una hija llamada Marcela. Su principal actividad económica es la transformación agro industria como por ejemplo  yogurt  y la elaboración de dulces de níspero y dulce de durazno, él vende los sábados y domingos en la feria de la plaza “Túpac Amaru” de la ciudad del Cusco, 


Oswaldo es una persona, responsable y emprendedor que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. Oswaldo requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas de los mayoristas y azúcar. El anhelo del socio es elaborar productos a base de Kiwicha y luego exportarlos.    

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is a member of the communal bank "Mi Peru." He's 41 years old and has a daughter named Marcela. His main business activity is agro-business occupation is transformation, as for example making yogurt and the production of rare fruit sweets and peach sweets, which he sells on Saturdays and Sundays in the marketplace in the plaza "Tupac Amaru" in the city of Cusco. Oswaldo is a responsible and enterprising person who is looking every moment for opportunities to move forward, with his daily efforts to help his family. Oswaldo wants a loan to buy wholesale fruits and sugar. His partnership wants to develop products based on Amaranth and then export them. He is very grateful for the opportunity afforded to him this way and he promises to complete payment in full.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale fruits and sugar

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Juliana es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Juliana viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende ropa y de las ferias compra cereales, animales menores, productos que vende a sus vecinos.
Juliana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, blusas.
Juliana sueña con aumentar su mercadería y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the Triunfo Community Bank. Juliana is 48 years old, married, and has four children. She travels to the markets in the area, where she sells clothes and buys grain, small animals, and products that she sells to her neighbors. Juliana needs a loan of 1,500 soles that she will invest in the purchase of sweaters and blouses. Juliana hopes to increase her merchandise and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sweaters and blouses

loans.name: Geysel Del Carmen

texts.es:
La  Señora.   GEYSEL DEL CARMEN S. G., Labora como Secretaria Ejecutiva en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería UNI.
Ella tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y   estos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado tres  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los tres  créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, hierro, cemento y piedrin para la construcción de una pared   de su casa de habitación. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Ella tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, hierro, cemento y piedrin para la construcción de una pared de su casa de habitación. Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Ruth Biviana

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Ruth es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Ruth vende pan que compra del horno y reparte a las diferentes tiendas de su barrio, anteriormente Ruth vendía ropa actividad que dejo de realizar por que su hijo es pequeño y ya no podía viajar.
Ruth necesita un préstamo de 700 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panes.
Los sueños de Ruth son construir su casa y tener una panadería.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Triunfo Community Bank. Ruth is 22 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child. Ruth sells bread that she buys from the bakery and distributes to various shops in her neighborhood. Previously, Ruth sold clothing, which she stopped because her son is small and can't yet travel. Ruth needs a loan of 700 soles that she will invest in the purchase of bread. Ruth hopes to build a house and own a bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bread

loans.name: Lucy Aurora

texts.es:
Lucy es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Lucy es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Lucy tiene un taller de confecciones en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Lucy esta implementando un recreo en su casa que se ubica cerca al terminal de la ciudad.
Lucy necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza y gaseosa.
Los sueños de Lucy son ampliar sus negocios y poner en funcionamiento su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the Triunfo Communal Bank.

Lucy is married, 40 years old, and has 5 children. Lucy has an alterations/seamstress shop rented and located in the center of the city, in where she works everyday. Further, Lucy has a recreation place in her home that is located near the terminal of the city.

Lucy needs a loan of 1500 soles, money that will be used to buy beer and refreshments.

Lucy’s dreams are to expand and run her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer and refreshments.

loans.name: Guillermo Alfredo

texts.es:
El  Señor. GUILLERMO ALFREDO M., Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua.
El tiene tres hijos a su cargo, y dos de  ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado dos  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido el  crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de dos perlines y cinco laminas de zinc para el techo de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Martha Osiris

texts.es: La señora Martha Osiris García Z. , labora para LOTERIA NACIONAL desempeñándose como glosador tiene un hijo a su cargo madre soltera, solicito crédito a CEPRODEL , para cubrir gastos de salud ya que tuvo un accidente y se fracturo un brazo,y algunos gastos de deudas pendientes ,y gastos escolare.he trabajado con 3 financiamientos con CEPRODEL , me siento agradecida ya que me han atendido bien con los créditos los he utilizado para pagar deudas y otros gastos escolares
texts.en:
La señora Martha Osiris García Z. , labora para LOTERIA NACIONAL desempeñándose como glosador tiene un hijo a su cargo madre soltera, solicito crédito a CEPRODEL , para cubrir gastos de salud ya que tuvo un accidente y se fracturo un brazo,y algunos gastos de deudas pendientes ,y gastos escolare.he trabajado con 3 financiamientos con CEPRODEL , me siento agradecida ya que me han atendido bien con los créditos los he utilizado para pagar deudas y otros gastos escolares

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cubrir gastos de medicamentos

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Julia es soltera, tiene 67 años y 2 hijos, Julia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa y de las ferias compra animales, la carne lo vende de casa en casa. Además Julia hace 3 meses implemento una tienda de abarrotes y le esta yendo muy bien.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza, azúcar, arroz, golosinas.
Los sueños de Julia son que sus hijos progresen y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Triunfo Communal Bank.

Julia is single, is 67 years old and has two children. She travels to different markets in the region where she sells clothing and she also buys animals whose meat she sells door to door. Three months ago, Julia started a grocery store and it is going very well.

Julia needs a loan of 2000 soles, money that will be used to buy beer, sugar, rice and candy.

Julia’s dreams are that her children progress and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer, sugar, rice and candy.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 41 años y es enfermera. 

Su principal actividad económica es vender productos naturales  para enfermedades, ella ofrece sus productos a sus amigos, vecinos, familiares,  etc. mediante un catalogo. Ya son 6 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella es una mujer  responsable y emprendedora que busca  a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia,  ella requiere el crédito para comprar productos naturales. Victoria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to “MI PERU” communal bank in partnership with Arariwa. She is 41 years old and is a nurse. Her main source of income is gotten by selling natural products for illnesses. She sells her products to her friends, neighbors, family, etc. via catalogue. Victoria has been in this business for 6 years and its going really well. She is a responsible and enterprising woman that is looking for opportunities to get ahead and with her daily efforts she wishes to help her family. She needs the loan to buy natural products. Victoria is very grateful for the opportunity granted by this organization and she is committed to meeting her payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Victoria needs the loan to buy natural products.

loans.name: Jacinto Jose

texts.es:
El   Señor. JACINTO JOSE Q. E., Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua.
El tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo, y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado nueve  créditos con CEPRODEL durante nueve años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los nueve créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de pintura para pintar su casa de  habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestro socio es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el Sr FRANCISCO, Nuestro socio tiene 40 años  es casado y tiene 1 hijo, Nuestro socio se dedica al transporte, el tiene un vehículo que presta servicio de taxi en la ciudad del Cusco y algunas veces lleva a Urubamba pasajeros desde el Cusco. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar algunos repuestos para su vehículo.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the communal bank “SACRO.” Our member is from the cruz pata community in the town of chinchero, province of Urubamba department of Cusco.

Our member is Mr. Francisco; he is 40 years old and married and has a son. Our member is in transportation, he has a vehicle and is a taxi driver in the city of Cusco and sometimes he takes passengers to Urubamba from Cusco. Our member needs a loan to buy some spare parts for his vehicle.

The member is grateful and values the support given to him by the organization and is determined to meet with his payments to the debt in the time set.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member needs the loan to buy some spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Jorge Manuel

texts.es:
El   Señor. Jorge Manuel González V., Labora como Auxiliar Contable en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua.
El tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado tres  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, como: arena y cemento para  embaldosar   su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:

El tiene un hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, como: arena y cemento para embaldosar su casa de habitación. Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Celia Esperanza

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. ESPERANZA,  Nuestra socia tiene 47 años  es soltera, nuestra socia se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores en chequere,  la socia tiene también un pequeño terreno de cultivo. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono para sembrar en su terreno y comprar animales menores y aves de corral para criar y vender.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the communal bank “SACRO.” Our member is from the cruz pata community in the town of chinchero, province of Urubamba department of Cusco.

Our member is Mrs. Esperanza; she is 47 years old and single. She works in agriculture and raises small animals in chequere. The member also has a small crop area. Esperanza needs the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sow her land and to buy small animals and barnyard fowl to breed and sell.

The member is grateful and values the support given to her by the organization and is determined to meet the payments to her debt in the time set.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member needs the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sow her land and to buy small animals and barnyard fowl to breed and sell.

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es:
El  Señor. JOSE DOLORES R., Labora como Supervisión de Limpieza en el Mercado Oriental de Managua.
Ella tiene un hijo a su cargo, y   este se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado diez  créditos con CEPRODEL durante diez años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los diez  créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, hierro, cemento y piedrin para la construcción de dos paredes   de su casa de habitación ya que estas se encuentran en mal estado. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Gioconda

texts.es: La señora GIOCONDA O. trabaja para la Universidad católica de Nicaragua como conserge ellas tiene cuatro años de laborar y este es su primer préstamo que trabaja con CEPRODEL este lo quiere para mejorar el teccho de su casa ya que se aproxima el invierno.
texts.en:
La señora GIOCONDA O. trabaja para la Universidad católica de Nicaragua como conserge ellas tiene cuatro años de laborar y este es su primer préstamo que trabaja con CEPRODEL este lo quiere para mejorar el teccho de su casa ya que se aproxima el invierno.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. .Eulalia, Nuestra socia tiene 33 años  es casada y tiene 3 hijos,  nuestra socia se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores, también se dedica a la ganadería, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, maíz, habas, también tiene animales menores como cuyes, chanchos, y aves de corral, ella tiene una vaquita, nuestra socia es una mujer muy ocupada y trabajadora. Nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para comprar un toro.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eulalia belongs to the community bank SACRO. She is from the community Cruz Pata in the village of Chinchero which belongs to the Urubamba province in the Cusco department. Eulalia is 33 years old, she is married and has three children. She dedicates herself to farming and raising small animals and livestock. Eulalia has farmland where she plants potatoes, corn and fava beans. She also has small animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, poultry and a small calf. She is a busy and hardworking woman. Eulalia is requesting this loan to purchase a bull. Eulalia is grateful for and values the support given to her through this medium and she promises to make her loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull.

loans.name: Maria Esmirna

texts.es:
La  Señora. MARIA ESMIRNA P. L., Labora como Auxiliar de Cocina en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua. 
El tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, por lo que comprara  arana, piedra, cemento y piedrin para la construcción de un muro en la parte trasera del patio de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Alejandro dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene dos hijos  de las cuales ya son independientes. 

Su principal actividad económica es vender yogurt en el mercado de Vino Canchón del distrito de San Jerónimo de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya es un año  que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella es una mujer  responsable y emprendedora que busca  a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella requiere el crédito para comprar azúcar y saborizantes. Janet se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Janet is a member of the community bank Mi Peru of the Arariwa association. She has two children who are independent. Janet's principal economic activity is selling yogurt at the Vino Canchon market in the district of San Jeronimo in the city of Cusco. She has been doing this for a year and she is doing very well. She is a responsible and enterprising woman who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead and with her daily efforts provide a better future for her children. She is requesting this loan to purchase sugar and flavorings. Janet is grateful for the opportunity afforded to her through this medium and promises to make her payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar and flavorings.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 40 años D. edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos, vive junto a su familia en el anexo San Carlos, perteneciente al caserío Arbolsol, una zona rural del distrito D. Mórrope, sus habitantes tienen como principales actividades productivas son L. agricultura y L. crianza D. animales. Se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media hora D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. animales desD. hace diez años. El cría chivos, cerdos y aves D. corral en algunos corrales instalados en L. parte exterior D. su domicilio, cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen punto D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan L. zona y eventualmente también los venD. en el mercado del pueblo D. Mórrope. Este negocio es L. única fuente D. ingresos con L. que cuenta su familia por lo que trata D. mantenerlo D. L. mejor manera posible, además L. comercialización D. animales es un negocio con bastante demanda en L. zona.

Santiago se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en L. compra D. alimento balanceado para hacer que sus animales sean D. mejor calidad y tengan una buena acogida por parte D. sus compradores.

Santiago es un padre D. familia muy trabajador y que gusta mucho D. lo que hace. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Santiago is 40 years old, he is married and has five children. He lives with his family in the San Carlos annex of the Arbolsol homestead which is a rural zone in the district of Morrope. The principal productive activities of the population are farming and raising animals. It is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Santiago has dedicated himself to raising and selling animals for ten years. He raises goats, pigs and poultry in pens installed outsiD. of his home. When his animals have reached a point in their development, he sells them to merchants that visit that area and eventually he also sells them at the market in Morrope. This business is the only source of income for his family which is why he tries to maintain it in the best possible way. The commercialization of animals is a business with high demand in this area. Santiago is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to purchase balanced feed so that his animals are of better quality and will be better received by his buyers. Santiago is a hardworking parent and he loves what he does. His greatest hope is to proviD. a better quality of life for his family. He has previously worked with this partner and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in paying his quotas.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase balanced feed for his livestock business.

location.town: Anexo San Carlos - Arbolsol - Mórrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Aracely De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Aracely  S. PerezLabora para la Universidad Catolica de Nicaragua ,tiene tres años de laborar como conserge es madre de un hijo y es soltera ella costea los gastos del hogat, este es mi segundo préstamo que trabajo con CEPRODEL, los cuales los he utilizado para mejoras de vivienda , ya que de acuerdo a mi ingreso es poco lo que me pueden financiar , poco a poco hago mi obra , hasta terminar , me siento agradecida por al oportunidad y la rapidez de los créditos .

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 52 años, tiene un hijo  de la cual ya es independiente. 

Su principal actividad económica es vender pollos para reuniones familiares  y de trabajo y su actividad económica complementaria es vender ropa a pedido del cliente.  Ya son dos a tres años  que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella es una mujer  responsable y emprendedora que busca  a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un spoyo a su hijo, ella requiere el crédito para  comprar pollos. 

Ana Maria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ana Maria belongs to the “Mi Peru” [My Peru] communal bank of the Arariwa Association. She is 52 years old and has one independent son. Her main economic activity is to sell chickens for family reunions and work gatherings. Her other economic activity is the sale of custom made clothing. She has been in this business for two to three years and it is going very well. She is a responsible woman and entrepreneur that is at each moment looking for opportunities to get ahead, and with her daily efforts she gives support to her son. She needs the loan to buy chickens. Ana Maria is grateful for the opportunity given by this means and promises to repay the loan according to the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens.

El  Señor. FRANCISCO JOSE B., Labora como Colector de Ruta en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua.
El tiene tres hijos a su cargo, y   estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado ocho  créditos con CEPRODEL durante ocho años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los ocho créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de medicamentos para sus dos hijos pequeños que se encuentran mal de salud.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. SONIA,  Nuestra socia tiene 34 años  es casada y tiene 4 hijos, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, La socia compra y vende productos agrícolas desde el año 2005 Nuestra socia vende productos secos como son maíz, quinua, trigo, cebada, habas, arvejas, papa. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para compra al por mayor la mercadería (productos secos).
 
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the communal bank “SACRO”. She is from the Cruz Pata community in the town of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba, department of Cuzco. Our member is SONIA. She is 34 years old, married and has 4 children. She alternates her activities between her home and her retail business. She has bought and sold agricultural products since 2005. Sonia sells dry products, such as corn, quinoa, wheat, barley, beans, peas and potatoes. She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise wholesale (dry products). This member is grateful for and values the support offered in this way and she is committed to making the payments of her debt according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member is asking for the loan to buy merchandise wholesale (dry products).

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Aldrin

texts.en:
Aldrin V. is from the village of Mohon, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He is 39 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Aldrin owns and operates a business providing motorcycle habal-habal services to local community members (a habal-habal is a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers). He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Aldrin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Aldrin is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for his business. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria M. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, married, and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ice candy, candies and snack food in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Gloria joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Charmalou

texts.en:
Charmalou U. is from the village of Miputak. She is 29 years old. Charmalou is married, has 1 school-aged child and 1 infant child. To make a living, Charmalou owns & operates an agricultural business raising pigs for sale. Charmalou has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP average per month for these activities.

In 2008, Charmalou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Charmalou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase pigs needed to make products for sale. Charmalou is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Charmalou from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo menor de edad, vive junto a su esposo en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en el anexo Monteverde del caserío Tranca Sasape, un sector rural del distrito de Mórrope, perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella viene residiendo en la zona desde hace un año y desde entonces ha decidido apoyar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de su familia incursionando en la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza vía catálogo. Ella se esfuerza por mantener su actividad, siempre buscando nuevos clientes a los cuales ofrecerles sus productos.

En los últimos meses su negocio está gozando de muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes, por lo que está pensando en instalar un pequeño establecimiento en su domicilio en donde pueda ofrecer a sus clientes un stock permanente, de modo que no tengan que esperar siempre por su producto hasta fin de mes, que es cuando llega el pedido. Para lograr su objetivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Alejandrina es una madre bastante luchadora y que gusta mucho de sentirse activa. Su mayor anhelo es poder construir una casa para su familia en la zona donde actualmente residen. En el poco tiempo que lleva viviendo en el lugar, ella ha sabido ganarse a sus vecinos, los cuales la respetan y estiman mucho.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 23 years old. She is married and has a minor child. She lives with her husband in her parents-in-law's house, located in the Monteverde annex of the township of Tranca Sasape. It is a rural sector of the district of Mórrope, which belongs to the province of Lambayeque, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has lived in the area for a year and since then has decided to help her husband support the family by getting into selling cosmetics and beauty products via catalog. She works hard to maintain her activity, always seeking new customers to whom to offer products. The the last few months, her business is enjoying popularity with her customers. Because of this, she is thinking of setting up a small establishment in her home where she can offer customers permanent stock. This way, they won't always have to wait until the end of the month for the products, when the orders come in. In order to attain her goal, she needs to ask Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan of 500 nuevos soles. Alejandrina is a mother who is a fighter and she really likes to feel active. Her greatest wish is to be able to build a house for her family in the area where they live now. During the short time she has lived in the area, she has been able to win her neighbors over and they really respect and esteem her.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to set up a sales establishment.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
A soft drinks and food dealer is our featured entrepreneur for this story. She is Mrs. Marietta G., 48 years of age, married and a resident of Gotokan Diot, Ozamiz City. She is married to Jose G. and blessed with 2 children, both now at their adult age. Her husband is primarily engaged in farming and presently earning an average net income of PHP625 a week. To help her husband, she decided to engage in dealing soft drinks and food. For 20 years she has been able to sustain this business. This time she is earning an average net income of not less than PHP1,500 a month. 

She joined the cooperative in 2007. With good character and excellent credit repayment, she has already availed several loans. Her previous loan amount was PHP8,000. This time she is requesting an amount of PHP10,000, as her sixth loan availment, to add to her capital for her existing soft drinks and food dealing business. The future income resulting from this loan will be used towards loan repayments, savings and for future house repair. She is hoping that someday she will become a future soft drinks stock holder.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina A. is a 57-year-old married woman who lives in Hda. San Ramon, Poblacion, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. Agustina has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for eight years now and earns a living by running a food vending businsess. She is purchasing a solar lantern with a 3,100 Philippine peso loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and at the same time cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.

Agustina is shown in the accompanying photo with the solar lantern that she just bought from the NWTF-Project Dungganon branch in Bayawan City, Negros Oriental.

About NWTF’s Green Loan Products
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit. To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients. In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as charging stations for mobile phones. These families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes. The solar lantern offers a free, environmentally friendly, renewable source of energy that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem  that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lantern

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena K. is a 43 year old married woman who supports her family by her fish vending business. She lives in Prk Tinago, Bayawan City, Negros Occidental with her 47 year old husband, Nicaster, who is a fisherman, and their 2 children who are between 20-23 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.

Lorena is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can continue her fish vending business. This will be her 5th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lorena aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 8,000.

Monina is now borrowing Php 15,000 so that she can expand her store. This will be her sixth cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHp 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Monina aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additonal working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy M. is from the village of Agunod Plaridel Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, he owns a store selling daily use products such as biscuits, candies, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Randy has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Randy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Randy from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina O. is a 74 year-old widow who supports her family with a general store, an eatery, a cafeteria, and a sugarcane farm business. She lives in Brgy. Tapi, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has nine children between 35 and 42 -- most of them married with their own families.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 30,000.

Florentina is now borrowing Php 23,000 so that she can continue her general store, eatery, cafeteria and farm businesses. This will be her 18th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 20,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Florentina aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieve realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Unidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidad está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, decididas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Rosa Argentina C. quien tiene un pequeño kiosco en el colegio veinticinco de septiembre donde comercializa desde gaseosas, emparedados, tajadas con queso y chiverias. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son Cecilia J. comenzó vendiendo unos cuantos productos como gaseosa, huevos, pan, fósforos y chiverías con lo cual poco a poco fue formando una pequeña pulpería y Gloria Elena S. es propietaria de una panadería donde realiza desde pan simple, con queso, dulce,  reposterías etc.
Ellas invertirán el crédito para mejorar sus negocios y seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
The group Unity is comprised of three hard-working, decisive, and entrepreneurial women. The coordinator of the group is Rosa Argentina C., who has a small kiosk at the 20th of September School where she sells sodas, sandwiches, plantains with fried cheese and miscellany. Her associates in the group include Cecilia J., who started selling some products such as sodas, eggs, bread, matches and more, which slowly led her to start a small general store. Also, Gloria Elena S. owns a bakery where she sells plain bread, with cheese, sweet, desserts, etc. They will invest the loan into improving their businesses and to continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products such as sodas, bread, etc.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela N. is a 56-year old woman who lives in Common Brgy Daan Banua, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store, selling fish and shrimp. Her husband, Jacinto, is 59 and the caretaker of a fish pond. They have four children between 22 and 33 years old. Three of their children are currently employed while the other one just graduated from college.

Rosela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income with her fish store. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 28,000.

Rosela is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 25,000 was used to fund operations for her fish vending business which had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing  for her 17th cycle loan, the amount of Php 27,000, which she intends to use on her general store. Rosela is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her businesses

loans.name: Belly

texts.en: Belly T. is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in Hda. Carmen, Brgy. Daan Banua, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by her fish vending and general store business. Belly’s 62 year old husband, Carlos, helps his wife run the business. They have four children who are between 23 and 31 years old. Three of them have their own families while the other one is employed and helps the parents. Belly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase the family income by engaging in a fish vending and general store business. Now she earns an average monthly income of 7,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities. Belly is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP was used to fund the operations of her fish vending and general store business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 15th loan, in the amount of 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use on fish vending and the general store business. Belly is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Yolanda's Group

texts.en:
Yolanda S. is from the village of Boundary Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tundan 2.

Yolanda is 41 and married with six school-aged children. She has a store selling daily use products such as shampoo, candies, sugar, salt, soap and toothpaste. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Yolanda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Yolanda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Todos Unidos Group

texts.es:
El grupo Todas Unidas está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, esforzadas y luchadoras que habitan en San Judas, uno de los barrios más grandes de Managua.  Este sobre sale por su religiosidad y por sus pobladores quienes día a día buscan ganarse la vida.
La coordinadora del grupo es Martha Patricia G. propietaria de una pequeña pulpería  donde comercializa desde granos básicos, carne, chiverías, gaseosas y licor de todo tipo.  Ella con el préstamo  surtirá su negocio con mayor cantidad y variedad de productos.
Las otras dos integrantes son Teresa de Jesús Martínez Quintana la cual desde hace quince años se dedica al comercio de ropa, cosméticos y zapatos y Rosa Catalina Pereza  es propietaria de un taxi y un microbús los cuales piensa darles mantenimiento con el préstamo.
texts.en:
The Group Everyone United is comprised of three entrepreneurial and hard-working women who are born fighters. They live in San Judas, one of the largest neighborhoods in Managua. This area is known for its religiousness and for residents who struggle each and every day to earn a living. The coordinator of the group is Martha Patricia G. who owns a small grocery store where she sells basic grains, meat, snacks, sodas, and every type of liquor. With this loan, she will supply her business with a greater quantity and variety of products. The other two members are Teresa de Jesús Martínez Quintana, who has sold clothing for more than fifteen years, and Rosa Catalina Pereza who owns a taxi and minibus that she will be able to provide maintenance for with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, sodas, snacks and liquor.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling ocean-caught fish in her community. She is 55 years old, married and has three adult children. She is from the village of Punta, Panaon. Anita has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Anita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
