El grupo Mujeres Victoriosas son cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Joseling M. quien se dedica al comercio de ropa el cual inicio por medio de un préstamo. Ella invertirá en mercadería para surtir su negocio el cual algún día se convertirá en una gran tienda. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Concepción H. quien desde hace diecisiete años es comerciante de gaseosa y ropa usada,  Guadalupe H. vende  reposterías y refrescos y Ana del Socorro López Álvarez quien tiene una pequeña tienda de ropa en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
The group Victorious Women is comprised of four hard-working and entrepreneurial women. One of them is Joseling M., who dedicates herself to selling clothing, a business she started with the help of a loan. She will invest in merchandise to supply her business, which she hopes to eventually convert into a large store. The other members of the group are Concepción H. who has sold sodas and used clothing for the past seventeen years, Guadalupe H. who sells pastries and refreshments, and Ana del Socorro López Álvarez who has a small clothing store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esther está integrado por tres mujeres trabajo una de ellas es Darling H. quien distribuye productos Avon, perfumes y cremas entre sus conocidas y los pobladores de su barrio.
Sus compañeras de grupo Alma Nidia C. Marena comerciante de perfumes y Damaris de los Ángeles H. vende ropa zapatos y ropa.
texts.en:
The group Esther is comprised of three hard-working women. One of the members is Darling H.. She sells Avon products, such as perfumes and creams, to her friends and neighbors. Her associates are Alma Nidia C. Marena, who sells perfumes, and Damaris de los Ángeles H., who sells shoes and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase Avon products.

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en: Mrs. Sarann K. is 40 years old and is a villager who lives in Preaek Samraong village in Kandal province. She is a grocery seller who earns a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business. Mrs. Sarann K. is a widow with three children: one is a car mechanic, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the last one is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Bun Noeun

texts.en: Mr. Bun Noeun H. is a 28-year-old married man who lives in Khsom Village, Kandal Province. He and his wife, Mrs. San Chum, are farmers who own a two-hectare field on which they cultivate rice for a living. In order to support his farming activities, Mr. Bun Noeun H. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work. His wife is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Concepcion Group

texts.es:
El grupo concepción está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras que día a día salen aganarse el sustento. La coordinadora del grupo es María Concepción P. de 63 años quien desde muy joven le han gustados las artes manuales las cuales con el tiempo, la práctica y estudio ha ido perfeccionando. 
En 1979 P.  instala un taller de costura, decoración de eventos y piñatas en cuyo negocio le va muy bien. Ella con el crédito comprar materiales para la realización de las piñatas y otros artes manuales.
Sus compañeras son Eveling María L. quien desde hace dos años vende ropa, cosméticos y piñatas y Rosalia P. comerciante de cosméticos y ropa usada.
texts.en:
The group Concepción is comprised of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women, who struggle each and every day to earn a living. The coordinator of the group, María Concepción P., is 63 years old. She has loved working with her hands since she was a child and, with time, practice, and study, she has perfected her craft. In 1979, she installed a workshop in her home for sewing, making event decorations, and piñatas. The business has gone very well. She will use the loan to buy materials to make her piñatas and other handicrafts. Her associates are Eveling María L., who has been selling clothing, cosmetics and piñatas for two years, and Rosalia P., who sells cosmetics and used clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for party decorations and making piñatas.

loans.name: Norin

texts.en: Mr. Norin B. is 44 years old and lives in Preaek Thum Village, Kandal Province. He is a police officer and receives a small salary to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Leakhina Ly, is a farmer who rents a plot of land to grow crops. Aside from farming, Mrs. Leaknina Ly also sells fruit in a local market. Mr. Norin B. now is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support his wife's farming. This couple has four children: three are students in the local school, while the youngest one is two years old. His wife is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Elba Felicita

texts.es:
Elba felicita C. Gutiérrez es una señora trabajadora, esforzada, decidida  quien desde muy joven trabaja para ganarse el pan de cada dia. Ella desde hace veinte años aproximadamente inicio con su negocio de taller de carpintería donde realiza desde cunas, roperos, camas etc. 
C. con el préstamo invertirá en madera, pintura, clavos etc.  Ya que tiene muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Elba Felicita C. Gutiérrez is a hard-working and decisive woman who, from a very young age, has worked to make a living. About twenty years ago, she started a carpentry workshop where she makes cribs, dressers, beds, etc. She will use the loan to invest in wood, paint, nails, etc., since she has many orders pending.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood, paint, etc.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam Some is 53 years old and lives in Ta Skor Village in Kandal Province. She is a pig breeder who earns a small income to support her family. Since this business is going well she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy two mother pigs to increase her business activities. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions. Mrs. Sam Some is a widow with a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy two mother pigs

loans.name: Hosana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Hosana está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Ana María A. quien inicio vendiendo unos cuantos productos como gaseosa, huevos, café, sal etc. que poco a poco fue surtiendo hasta tener una pulpería bien formada. Además realiza a sopa los fines de semanas por encargo. 
Sus compañeros de grupos son Socorro B. G. quien vende cosméticos y Patricia del Carmen Amador que es comerciante de ropa. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The 'Hosana' group is made up three hardworking women, one of whom is Ana María A.. She began selling products including soft drinks, eggs, coffee and salt, which grew bit by bit until it became a general store. She also makes soup to order on the weekends. Her partners in the group are Socorro B. G., who sells cosmetics, and Patricia del Carmen Amador, who sells clothes. They will invest their loan in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Legumes, soft drink, bread, etc.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mr. Thy K. is 44 years old and lives in Trapeang Chrey Village, Kandal Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Khloek Buth, are farmers who own a three-hectare field where they cultivate rice to earn a living for their family. In order to support their farm, Mr. Thy K. decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer for plowing and to buy fertilizer and pesticide. This couple has seven children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory while six are students and also help with their parents' farm. His wife is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To hire a laborer for plowing and to buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Cueto Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Cueto está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas son Mercedes Ángeles P. Gonzales propietaria de una pequeña  pulpería la cual inicio con poca mercadería la cual por medio el tiempo fue mejorando.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Luz Adilia S. Hernández quien tiene un bar y cafetín  desde hace 11 años y Juan Francisco Gutierres S. propietario de un taller de recarga de baterías de carro.  Ellos invertirán en sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
The 'Cueto' group is made up of three hard working people. One of them is Mercedes Ángeles P. Gonzales, the owner of a small general store which began with little merchandise and grew over time. Her fellow group members are Luz Adilia S. Hernández, who has had a bar and a kiosk for the last eleven years, and Juan Francisco Gutierres S., who owns a workshop of rechargable car batteries. They will invest their loan in their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of legumes, meat, soft drinks and dairy products.

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
El grupo Buena Vista está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Cindy Yorlenis Arias C. quien vende cosméticos y ropa desde hace cinco años. El sueño de C. es mejorar su negocio.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Brenda Patricia Jarquín P. quien desde hace diez años vende ropa y Meylin del Socorro V. G. quien tiene una ferretería localizada en carretera norte, además de vender ropa por encargo.
texts.en:
The 'Buena Vista' group is made up of three hardworking women. One of them is Cindy Yorlenis Arias C., who has been selling clothes and cosmetics for five years. Her dream is to improve her business. Her fellow group members are Brenda Patricia Jarquín P., who has been selling clothes for ten years, and Meylin del Socorro V. G., who has a hardware store in the north and also sells clothes to order.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Kimheng

texts.en: Mrs. Kimheng H. 65 years old and lives in Boeng Kandal Village, Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Peng Brich, are farmers who grow corn and rice on a four-hectare plot of land for a living. For her farm, Mrs. Kimheng H. decided to ask for a loan to purchase corn seed and fertilizer and to hire laborers to plow her farm. This couple has four children; one is employed in a casino club, one is a farmer, and the other two are students in the local school and also help with their parents' farm. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To purchase corn seed and fertilizer and to hire laborers to plow her farm.

loans.name: Sarl

texts.en: Mrs. Sarl S., 29 years old, is a widow with a child who is a student in a local school. She is a villager who lives in Kbal Chrouy-ID village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sarl S. is a cloth seller who earns a small income to support herself. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more cloth to enlarge her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her life.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Mrs. Channy Y. is a 52-year-old woman who lives in Daeum Pring village in Kandal province. She is a fishnet seller and her husband, Mr. Cheng Koy, is a fisherman. With both businesses, they earn a small income to support their family. Mrs. Channy Y. is now requesting a loan to buy more fishnets to enlarge her husband's business. With this loan, she hopes to increase their income to improve their standard of living. This couple has five children: two are laborers, while the other three are students in the local school and also support their parents' business.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mr. Sary L., 61 years old and a resident of Ta Pech village in Kandal Province, is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice. Sary is requesting a loan to buy fertilize and gasoline to support his crop.  His wife, Mrs. Yorn Duch, shown on the left in the picture, owns a washing place for motorcycle washing. With both businesses they can earn a small income to support their family. This couple has two children who are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilize and gasoline

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
Mr. Khon N., 63 years old, is a villager who lives in Ta Pech village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Neang Dork, are farmers who own 3 hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. Mr. Khon N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support his farming. This couple works hard on the farm to support the family. They have two children: one is a farmer and one is a student in the local school. 

Mr. Khon N.'s wife is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Ramos

texts.en:
Ramos Q. Jr. is from the village of Kahulugan, Gingoog City. He is 42 years old, separated from his spouse, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ramos sells electronic cellphone load in his local community. Ramos has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,400 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Ramos joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. He used this loan as working capital. Ramos is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his second from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with a son who attends school. He has had an electronics business for two years and was previously a teacher. For extra income, he still teaches and also operates a grocery store. He sells his electronics products from a shop.
George wants to purchase mobile phones, batteries and phone covers with his 20,000 KES loan. He aspires to be the leading shop for electronics and to sell wholesale one day. He wanted to join Kiva partner, Yehu, because he liked their transparency. George's greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones, batteries and phone covers

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 45 years old, married, and has five children aged between 12 and 26 years old. Four of her children are currently attending school. She relies on farming to cater for her family's needs. She has been farming for 25 years, selling her eggs, milk, maize and beans to the local market. 
Susan has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to start a poultry project. With the income she earns from this project, she will be able to pay for her children's education. Her biggest challenge is the cost of poultry feed, which is very expensive, and the diseases that often strike and increase her veterinary expenses and reduce her income. In future, she would like to expand her poultry project, especially during the peak seasons, in order to earn more income.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old Alfred is a married father of six children, aged 14 to 27 years. Four of the children are currently attending school. He is a farmer in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He has been farming for 10 years and mainly depends on the income from the maize, vegetables, and beans that he sells to the local market to cater for his family's needs.

Alfred recently completed his first loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 30,000 KES, which he used to set up his poultry project. He has requested this loan from Juhudi for 40,000 KES to expand his poultry project. His biggest challenge in this business has been the fluctuation in the market price of their produce and the high cost of drugs and poultry feed. He believes that this loan will help him expand his project, hence increasing his overall produce, which will earn him more income and enable him to educate his children. In the future he hopes to set up a store that will be a major supplier of eggs in the area.

He says that he is "grateful to Juhudi for empowering him economically."

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a farmer in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He is 58 years old and married with nine children, aged 4 to 20 years. Eight of the nine children are currently in school. He has been farming for 30 years and has one employee. He also owns a posho mill (which grinds maize into flour) in the same area. His main produce is vegetables, maize, beans, and milk that he sells to the local market. From the two operations he has been able to support his family financially.

He recently completed his first loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 20,000 KES and has requested this second loan for 20,000 KES to start a poultry project. His main challenge is the poultry diseases in the area and the fluctuation in the market prices of farm produce. He says that the income from the poultry project will enable him to meet the basic needs of his family. In the future he hopes to access enough funds to enable him to expand his poultry project and acquire a zero-grazing dairy animal.

He says that he is "grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for enabling him to access financial services with ease."

loans.use: To start up a poultry project

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 70 years old and married with eight children, aged 14 to 47 years. Four of the children, including two grandchildren, are currently attending school. Paul is a farmer in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He has been farming for 46 years and has one employee. His main produce is maize, beans, watermelons, and cabbages, which he sells to the local market. Paul depends mainly on farming to educate the family and meet their needs.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 31,200 KES to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says that the income from this loan will help him meet the essential needs of his family, which are good health and education. His biggest challenge is the unpredictable weather conditions that affect his produce, and diseases like East Coast Rever that livestock are prone to in the area. In five years' time he would like to acquire more than 10 quality dairy cows.

He requests that "Juhudi Kilimo continue supporting the common man and maybe diversify its products to education loans."

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old and married with 4 children, aged between 4 months and 17 years. She is a farmer from western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. Grace has been practicing mixed farming for 10 years, and so far she has two employees. Her main produce is maize and beans. She also has some chicken broilers and layers (mainly kept for eggs) that she is able to sell to the locals. She also earns some income from the bricks that she makes and sells to the local market.

Grace has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 25,000 KES to expand her poultry project. She believes that this is a great investment and hopes to get enough revenue supplementing her other income to be able to meet her family's needs. Her biggest challenge in running this business is the high cost of poultry feed and the changes in weather that affect the chicks. In the future, she hopes to expand her business by increasing the number of chickens and also diversifying into exotic breeds as well.

This being her first loan, she is optimistic that it will have a positive impact on her economically.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Rumba

texts.en: Rumba is a married man with five boys, four of whom attend school. He is a tailor and wants to purchase materials and a sewing machine with the KES 40,000 loan. He has been in the business for eight years and was previously a preacher. He has a shop, and his customers are mainly women. The greatest challenge to his business is getting pictures of dress designs from the internet and the cost of expansion. He aspires to work together with other tailors. Rumba rents his home and has electricity but no piped water.

loans.use: To purchase materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 23 years old and married with two children, ages 4 years and 8 months. Her eldest is already attending school. She is a farmer in western Kenya near Kitale town. She has been practicing mixed farming for four years, producing maize, nappier grass (animal feeds), potatoes, and sugarcane. She sells her produce to the local market. She also earns income from the sale of livestock, like cows, sheep and goats.

She requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the income she earns from this loan will help her develop her farm and educate her children. Her main challenge is the unpredictable weather patterns and high cost of production. In future, she wants to acquire a well-established farm by expanding from the current 2.75 acres to 10 acres.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 34 years and married with three children, ages 5 to 15 years. All of the children are in school. She has been farming for 15 years, producing milk that she sells to the local market. She resides in western Kenya near Kitale town. She also earns some income from a kiosk in which she sells staple goods. She owns two posho mills (which grind maize into flour) that generate some income from her. One posho mill is located in the same building with the kiosk while the other one is located in a separate place.

She has successfully completed her first loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 30,000. She requested this second loan from Juhudi for KES 60,000 to expand her poultry project. Her challenge is the location in which her posho mill and chicken business is because it cannot attract many customers. In the future, she aspires to venture into a chicks business and acquire a piece of land in which she will install a posho mill and a shop, run a poultry project, and incorporate dairy farming.

loans.use: To expand on her poultry project

loans.name: Euphemiah

texts.en: Euphemiah is a married woman with a son, who is still too young for school. Her husband is a hotel attendant and she is a clothes vendor. She wants to purchase more clothes with the KES 20,000 loan. She has been in this business for three years and previously was a housewife. She sells her clothes in a shop to men and women. Euphemiah aspires to expand her business to grow her profits so that she can buy a plot and build a house. She wanted to work with Yehu because the clients are well-handled and the savings are secure. She rents her house and has no water or electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for sale

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona S. is from the village of Poblacon,Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Chona is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Chona owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Chona has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Chona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Chona is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used additional capital for her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Chona from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad L. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Natividad is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Natividad owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling fresh fish to the local community. Natividad has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Natividad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used additional capital for her business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Natividad from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro T. is from the village of Southwestern Pob., Calamba Misamis Occidental. He is 39 years old. Alejandro is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Alejandro owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as milo, some food for snacks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Alejandro has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alejandro joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandro is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alejandro from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with two grown children. She is an entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk. Nataliya used to work as a deputy director at a knitting factory. However, it was closed down and she was forced to launch her own trade. Now Nataliya sells men’s suits, pants and shirts in the central marketplace of her hometown. She offers a nice selection of assorted inventory at affordable prices. Nataliya has been in this trade for 10 years. Her monthly profit amounts to 5,000 UAH. 

Nataliya is seeking a loan of 7,500 UAH to purchase 100 pairs of men’s pants for further retail sale. This business is the main source of income for Nataliya. She started with one vending location. Lending assistance helped her open her second location. She is hoping to continue growing her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase 100 pairs of pants

loans.name: Sanu Devi

texts.en:
Sanu Devi M., a resident of Thecho, lives with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Sanjay M., is a carpenter. He opened his own furniture shop three years ago. He makes various kinds of furniture in his shop, such as beds, chairs, tables, and drawers. He makes furniture according to the orders he receives from customers.

The demand for this furniture is increasing. To meet the demand of his customers, he needs to purchase wood. Due to lack of funds, he is unable to purchase the wood. Mrs. Sanu Devi M. is requesting a loan in the amount of 30000.00 NPR to help her husband purchase wood for his work. Her husband's income is the only source of income for her family.

Mrs. Sanu Devi M. has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 9 and her son is in grade 3.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Ganga

texts.en:
Ganga is a 41-year-old married woman living with her husband and two sons. They are 10 and 2 years old. Her husband works as a tailor. 

Ganga manages a business selling clothes, which she started a while ago and has been doing for quite some time.  She co-operates well with others, and is a very hard working woman.  

She has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business and purchase additional clothes. 

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarmila M. is a grocery storekeeper in the village of Thecho. She opened her grocery store 3 years ago to improve the economic condition of her family. She sells various types of grocery goods, such as rice, maize, noodles, biscuits, and cold drinks, in her shop. Due to the increasing demand for grocery goods, she is requesting a Rs 30000.00 loan to buy different varieties of grocery goods for her shop.

Mrs. Sarmila M. lives in a single-family residence with her husband and two children. Her husband works in a government office. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 9 and daughter is studying in grade 2.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiya M. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Thecho, Lalitpur. She sells different types of grocery goods, such as rice, maize, and various snacks, in her shop.

She opened her grocery shop two years ago. Her main goal in opening her shop was to improve the economic condition of her family. Due to a lack of money she cannot further expand her business. Therefore, Mrs. M. is requesting a Rs 15000.00 loan to add other kinds of grocery goods to her shop.

Mrs. M. lives in a single-family residence with her husband and two children. Her husband is a farmer. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 5 and daughter is studying in grade 7.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Bekha Maiya

texts.en:
Bekha Maiya M. is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband and three sons. Her husband, Mr. Chandra Man M., works as a taxi driver. All of her sons are now in school.

Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop five years ago. She sells different grocery goods in her shop. She opened her shop to strengthen the economic condition of her family. Now she is requesting NPR 15000.00 to increase the necessary stock of food in her shop, such as noodles, rice, biscuits, etc. She wants to use her income to provide a better education for her sons.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Shiromi

texts.en:
Shiromi is a 25-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura in the Matara area of southern Sri Lanka.  She has two children, one son and one daughter.  They are 5 and 9 years old, respectively.  Shiromi's husband has worked as a mechanic for 20 years.  Shiromi helps her husband in this business.

Shiromi has requested a loan of 20,000 LKR from BRAC to assist her husband's mechanic business and purchase new equipment.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy equipment for her husband's business

loans.name: Nadeeka

texts.en:
Nadeeka is a 27-year-old married woman living with her husband and baby in the town of Telijjawila. Her husband is an employee of Shell Gas Company.  

Nadeeka has managed a business selling small packets of household goods. She buys the goods, then packages and sells them.  Twelve years ago, she started this business.  She is very enthusiastic about her business.

She has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Kusum

texts.en:
Kusum is a 46-year-old married woman living in Telijjawila, in the Matara area of Sri Lanka.  She has two sons who are 19 and 11 years old.

Kusum runs a fortune-telling business, which she has been doing for seven years with the help of her husband and son.  Her customers come to her to have their fortunes read and predicted, a common practice in Sri Lanka. 

She has requested a 50,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business.  She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka for the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To help expand her fortune-telling business

loans.name: Indrani

texts.en:
Indrani is a 55-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura, a town in the Matara area of southern Sri Lanka.  She has three sons and one daughter.  They are 25, 22, 19 and 17 years old.

Indrani manages a business of rice paddy cultivation with her husband. She has asked for a loan of 20,000 LKR from BRAC Sri Lanka for the development of her business.

She hopes to improve the cultivation and purchase materials. Also, she wants to provide nutritious options for her family through the increased income that she hopes to earn.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan.

loans.use: To buy materials for her rice paddy

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has been a farmer in Naivasha for the last four years. She generally sells her products at the Naivasha market. She plants maize, beans, kale and other vegetables, which she harvests and sells. 

She is 23 years old and married to Samuel Ndungu. They have two children in school.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend, and this will be her first loan. She plans to buy pesticides and fertilizers to help increase her yield.

She plans to start large-scale farming in the future so that she can supply products to the main market in Nairobi.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her crops

loans.name: Lealtad De Wilacota Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento LEALTAD D. WILACOTA se formo en la zona D. wilacota al sur D. la cudad D. La Paz, es una asociacion que inicia su primera secuencia D. credito. Esta compuesto por 9 socios integrantes habitantes en la misma zona. Muchos D. los integrantes D. la asociacion son jovenes que desean emprender con un negocio para poder ayudar con los gastos D. su familia.
                                                                                                                                                                     El banco D. Emprendimiento actualmente cuenta con una mesa directiva la cual a sido elegida D. manera popular y tambien por la responsabilidad D. las persona que lo componen. 

La Sra. Angela es la presidenta, vive actualmente en la zona D. ovejuyo con sus dos hijos ella es madre soltera por lo que su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que tiene que ser Padre y Madre para ellos, la Sra. Angela venD. ropa para niños en distintas zonas D. la ciudad, vive con su madre quien cuida a sus niños mientras ella trabaja, trabaja todos los dias el dinero del prestamo lo utilizara en la compra D. ropa al por mayor y asi incrementar su capital D. trabajo y mejorar su negocio, es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora con ganas D. superacion su deseo es comprar una casita a la larga y asi mejorar su calidad D. vida D. toda su familia.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y en muchos casos sacan a su familia adelante solas, desean mejorar la calidad D. vida D. toda su familia, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion dle credito.
texts.en:
The Lealtad D. Wilacota Entrepreneurial Village Bank was formed in the Wilacota area to the south of the city of La Paz. They are in their first loan cycle. The group is maD. up of 9 members who live in the area. Many of them are young but hope to start a business to help with their household expenses. The bank currently has a board of directors which has been elected; the board members stood out for being very responsible. Angela is the group president and lives in the Ovejuyo area with her two children. She is a single mother who has to work hard to be both father and mother to her children. She sells children's clothing in various parts of the city. She lives with her mother who takes care of the children while Angela works everyday. She will use the loan to buy clothing wholesale to increase her working capital and improve her business. She is a very responsible, hard-working woman who hopes to move forward and someday buy a home and improve the standard of living of her whole family. All the group members are very responsible and in many cases, support their families on their own. They hope to better the standard of living of their families and they are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the support they are receiving through these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: San José Obrero Group

texts.es:
El Comité San Jose Obrero se conformó en fecha 01  de diciembre  de 2008, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. María Justa F. se acercó a la asesora en una Renovación de Crédito que la misma tenía en la  zona, para averiguar de como funciona el programa de Comité de Mujeres, ya en el 6º ciclo, todas ellas muy contentas dentro del Programa.
Todas ellas están trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria, ayudándose mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora María F. quien se dedica a la venta de remedio naturales.
Cabe destacar que el uso de las medinas naturales en Paraguay es muy común en todas las familias mismo por el mate que se consumo en las mañanas y para el tratamiento de muchas enfermedades, por ello el negocio de los remedios naturales se vuelve muy rentable. 
Ella obtiene buena ganancia por lo quiere comprar los remedios en gran cantidad procesarlo y envasarlos, para lo que solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
The San José Obrero Committee was initiated on December 1, 2008, thanks to its current Director General, María Justa F., who approached the adviser at a loan renewal meeting in her area to find out how the Women's Committee worked. Now on their sixth loan cycle, the members are very happy with the Program. They all work together, providing mutual support to achieve the goals they share. Mrs. F. earns her living selling natural remedies. It's worth noting that natural medicines are in broad use among all Paraguayan families, for infusions taken in the morning and to treat many ailments, so they make for a profitable business. Mrs. F. earns a nice profit and would like to buy remedies in quantity in order to process and package them, which is why she is seeking a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicinal herbs wholesale for processing and packaging, as well as plastic containers, oilcloth, packing tape, and paper for labels.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita C. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old. Lucita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lucita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lucita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lucita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lucita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her retail shop

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Las Cabañitas Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento: LAS CABAÑITAS  se encuentra ubicado en el Barrio Villa Fatima, ubicado en la calle Escuadrón Velasco, el B.E. esta en su 2DO ciclo, compuesto por 10 personas, Se fundo el  24 de Noviembre  del 2009, a iniciativa de un grupo de señoras, 

Como PRESIDENTA tenemos a la señora Fabiola,  TESORERA la  Sr. Fátima y SECRETARIA la Sra. Miriam, en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican en  mayoría en la  venta de cosméticos, ropa, profesora,  y otros. Las reuniones se llevan acabo los días jueves a horas 09:30 AM en la casa de la señora Sandra. Los nuevos clientes, están conformes de trabajar con Emprender debido a que dentro de la capacitación del  B.E. LAS CABAÑITAS se les estableció una proyección de sus ahorros a la finalización  del ciclo  en la cual  aprenderán a ahorrar  y compartir con sus amigas cada 14 días.

FABIOLA  (Presidenta), esta casada y tienne dos hijos pequeños,  vende de cosméticos  de manera ambulante  en diferentes mercados populares, zonas y en el establecimiento donde trabaja, a parte de esta actividad es profesora  en  y  le va bien el negocio. En el banco comunal ha aprendido a ahorrar, a quererse y valorarse como persona, siente útil con lo que le enseñan en las capacitaciones. El sueño de la señora Fabiola  es tener su propia vitrina ,su tienda de negocio ,y  progresar en la vida y asi mejorar su calidad de vida.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion dle credito.
texts.en:
The “Las Cabañitas” (Little Cabins) communal bank, located in Villa Fatima neighborhood, Escuadrón Velasco Street, is in its 2nd cycle composed of 10 members; it was established on 24 November 2009 thanks to the initiative of a group of women. Fabiola is president, Fátima is treasurer and Miriam is secretary. There are women in the group who sell cosmetics, clothing and other items; one is a teacher. The meetings are on Thursdays at 9:30am in Sandra’s house. They are new clients but happy to cooperate with Emprender because in their communal bank training they established a savings projection that at the end of the cycle they’ll learn to save and share with their friends every 14 days. Fabiola, president, is married and has two small children. She’s an itinerant cosmetics salesperson in various popular markets, zones and places where she works. Besides this work, she’s also a teacher and she does well with her business. She learned to save and to have self-esteem in the communal bank; she feels useful with the training she gets. Fabiola’s dream is to have her own display case, her store, and to make progress in life thus improving her quality of life. All the members are grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida P. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Leonida joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Comité San Antonio, así se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá en fecha 17 de junio de 2.008.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo.
Elba es una de la integrantes es una de las señoras mas activas del comité, su familia es muy trabajadoras, sus hijas son hijos son todos estudiantes, su marido es albañil y constantemente tiene trabajo  de esta manera toda la familia se ayuda y llevan una vida muy saludable.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos ya que ella se dedica a la veta de los mismos en su tiempo libre ella sale a ofrecer sus productos a vecinas y amigas y esta muy satisfecha con su actividad. Nos comenta que deja un buen ingreso para sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
The group of women that formed in the city of Itá on June 17th, 2008 call themselves the "San Antonio Committee". They all work to collect funds, and they help each other to reach their common objectives, which all the members of the group have. Elba is one of the members. She is one most active women in the committee. She has a very hard working family. Her children are all students, and her husband, who works in construction, always has work. And so her family members all help each other, and they live a very healthy life. She is requesting the loan to buy cosmetics, since she makes her living selling the same. In her free time, she goes out to offer her products to her neighbors and friends. She is very satisfied with her work. She tells us that it supplies her with sufficient income for her personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire make-up, such as blush, powders, nail polish, creams etc.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La Señora Laura tiene 29 años, está  casada con el Sr. Fabiano de 31 años, ambos son  comerciantes y tienen una hija de 5 años llamada Estefani quien actualmente está cursando el primer grado de la   Educación Básica.
 Ellos viven en la casa de los padres de Laura ya que les fue imposible comprarse una casa propia.
Laura se dedica a la compra y venta de calzados, comenta que hace más de 15 años se dedica a la venta pero trabajando para otras personas, y que hace tres años se hicieron de capital vendiendo sus electrodomésticos y empezaron a trabajar por cuenta propia. 
Ya que sus ventas las realiza en forma ambulante, ella depende mucho del buen clima, ya que en los días de lluvia se dificulta las ventas, pero deseosa de salir adelante siempre busca la manera de aumentar sus ganancias; para ello solicita el crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de calzados, pues tienen bastante demanda en su negocio.
Ella demuestra que es una gran persona dispuesta a seguir luchando para lograr aumentar su nivel de vida y considera el crédito como una herramienta fundamental para que su negocio crezca de manera a asegurar el bienestar de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Laura, age 29, is married to 31 year old Fabiano. They are both merchants. They have a five year old daughter, Estefani, who is currently in first grade. They live in Laura’s parents’ house because it was impossible for them to buy their own house. Laura buys and sells footwear. She says that she has been selling for over 15 years, but she worked for other people. Three years ago they started working independently using money from selling their domestic appliances. She sells as a street vendor, and she relies a lot on good weather. On rainy days it is difficult to make sales. She wants to get ahead, so she always looks for a way to increase her earnings. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy footwear. There is a lot of demand in her business. She demonstrates that she is a great person prepared to continue fighting in order to improve her standard of living. She considers the loan to be a fundamental tool for her business to grow in a way that assures the well-being of her whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes, sneakers, clogs, and boots for women, men, and children

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine L. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are still going to school. To make a living, Josephine is starting a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Josephine is just starting this business.

Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and to have additional working capital for her little business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and also to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan  Carlos

texts.es: EL SEÑOR JUAN UN HOMBRE TRABAJADOR DEDICADO A LA GOMERIA YA HACE DOS AÑOS ATRÁS TRABAJA EN UN AMBIENTE PEQUEÑO YA QUE EL ALQUILER ES CARISIMO, ESTA CASADO Y SU ESPOSA E HIJO LE COLABORAN EN ESTE DURO TRABAJO, TENIENDO LA NECESIDAD DE ALGUNAS HERRAMIENTAS Y COMPRA DE ACEITES, SOLICITARON UN CREDITO EN EMPRENDER, EL SR. JUAN Y SU FAMILIA EMIGRARON DE UNA PROVINCIA DEL INTERIOR DEL PAIS,  TUVIERON QUE PASAR MOMENTOS DIFICILES EN LA CIUDAD MUCHAS VECES NO TENIAN QUE COMER, AHORA YA SE ENCUENTRAN EN CONDICIONES YA ESTABLES TIENEN LA ESPERANZA DE PERMANECER DURANTE UN TIEMPO LARGO SI TODO MARCHA BIEN, Y ASI AMPLIAR SU PEQUEÑA GOMERIA, ES UNA  PERSONA RESPONSABLE, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan is a hard-working man who works with tires. Two years ago he began working in a small space since rent was very expensive. He is married and his wife and son help him with the hard work. Finding themselves in need of some tools and oils, they asked for a loan from Emprender. Mr. Juan and his family moved from an interior province and they experienced a lot of difficult times in the city. Many times they did not have food to eat. Now they are living with more stability and they hope to stay for a long time if everything continues well, and to be able to expand their small tire shop. Juan is a very responsible person, and is very thankful for Emprender and Kiva for trusting him with the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oil and tools

loans.name: Eutiquio

texts.en:
Eutiquio C. R. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 34 years old and single. To make a living, Eutiquio runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling snack food products in the local community. He is just starting this business.

In 2010, Eutiquio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Xoljuyup 2 Group

texts.es: El crédito solicitado serán utilizado para ampliación de capital de la actividad a las que se dedican cada uno de las integrantes del   Grupo  por lo que se le considera  una inversión rentable ya que ellas venden ropa tipica, y viendo la necesidad de apliar màs sus negocio acuden a la asociaciòn ASDIR para el apoyo de dicha ampliaciòn y para poder supera y tener màs ganancias tener superaciòn pasar otro nivel de vida,  mejorar relatan las mujeres trabajadoras.-
texts.en:
The requested loan will be used to increase the capital in the activities in which each of the members of the group are involved. It is considered to be a profitable investment because they sell typical clothing. Seeing the need to expand their businesses, they come to the ASDIR Asociación for help with this expansion. They want to be able to do well and have more income. These hard-working women say that they want to excel in order to have an improved standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El comité de nombre Santa Lucia se conformó en fecha 17 de noviembre de 2.008, con 18 mujeres todas amigas y vecinas, quienes se encuentran trabajando en el 5º ciclo todas ellas  muy contentas con el programa.
Se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como venta de frutas y verduras, venta de carnes, venta de golosinas, venta de canasto, venta de ropas, venta de gallinas y huevos, venta de mandioca, venta de comestibles, venta de carbón, etc.
La señora Justina solicita un préstamo para la compra de gallinas, ella anteriormente realizaba otro trabajo pero como no le fue bien quiere dedicarse a la venta de gallinas.
Ella desea implementar la venta de gallinas faenadas y lo ofrecería en los negocios del  barrio al principio, luego desea contar con sus propio gallinero para criar, engordar y vender ella misma ya este procedimiento le dejaría mayor ganancia.
Agradece por la oportunidad que le Brinda la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva mediante el préstamo y se compromete en dedicarse al máximo a su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Santa Lucia Communal Bank was formed on November 17th, 2008, with 18 women. They are all friends and neighbors. They are working in their fifth cycle, and they are all very happy with the program. They work at different activities like selling fruits and vegetables, selling meat, selling sweets, selling large baskets, and selling charcoal, etc. Justina is requesting a loan to buy chickens. She previously did other work, but because it did not go well for her, she wants to work selling chicken. She wishes to establish a business selling slaughtered chickens. At first she would sell to the neighborhood businesses. Then, she wants to have her own henhouse to raise, fatten, and sell the chicken herself. This will leave her with greater income. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan offered by the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, and she promises to devote herself to the maximum in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna L. is from the village of Talon, Gingoog City. She is 50 years old, married, and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Lorna operates a buying and selling business, buying agricultural crops like bananas, cassava and copra. She then transports these crops and sells them in the city. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase crops and also as additional working capital. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more agricultural crops to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more agricultural crops to sell

loans.name: Tranquilino

texts.es:
El Sr. Tranquilino tiene 66 años, vive en el Barrio San Antonio con su pareja quien es la Sra. Isabel Olmedo, donde ambos tiene un despensa bien surtida hace mas de 20 años. 
Don Tranquilino había empezado este negocio debido a  que no existía ninguna despensa cercana al barrio en el tiempo que se mudó a la que ahora es su comunidad.
Gracias a los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya fue creciendo de a poco, y hoy día su despensa es como un mini-mercado por el buen stock de sus mercaderías con que cuenta actualmente. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de mercaderías tales como: harina, arroz, fideo, azúcar, bebidas en gral. debido  a que llega la Semana Santa, periodo en el cual las ventas son más altas de lo habitual.
texts.en:
Tranquilino is 66 years old and lives in the neighbourhood of San Antonio with his partner, Isabel Olmedo, where they have run a well stocked grocery store for more than 20 years. Tranquilino started this business when they first moved to the area that is now their community, since there was no other grocery store close to their neighbourhood at that time. Thanks to the loans that they obtained through Fundación Paraguaya, bit by bit their business began to grow, and today their grocery store is like a mini-market due to the good quality of their merchandise. The loan that Tranquilino is applying for now will be used to purchase merchandise such as flour, rice, pasta, sugar and beverages, since Holy Week is coming and this is the time when they usually sell the most products.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, rice, pasta, sugar and beverages

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.es:
La señora Nicanora tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos que aún viven con ella. Posee una despensa en su domicilio ubicado en un conocido barrio de la ciudad de Itá, donde provee a sus clientes antiguos y a ocasionales de yerba, bebidas en general, carne, panificados, lácteos, carbón, azúcar, arroz y otras mercaderías hace más de 10 años.
La misma se inicio en el ámbito financiero gracias del pequeño préstamo que recibió por parte de la Fundación Paraguaya en cuyo cumplimiento demostró ser muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el tiempo la señora Nicanora logró aumentar su línea de crédito con la institución y gracias a eso hoy día posee una despensa bien surtida y una mayor clientela formada en su negocio.
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de mercaderías varias tales como: carnes, panificados, bebidas en gral., lácteos, etc.
texts.en:
Nicanora is 50 years old and married. She has 2 children who still live with her. She operates a food market in her home, which is located in a well-known neighborhood of the city of Itá. To both longstanding and occasional customers, she has sold yerba tea, beverages in general, meat, breads, dairy products, charcoal, sugar, rice and other merchandise for more than 10 years. She originally financed her business with a small loan she received from the Paraguaya Foundation, and she showed herself to be very responsible in making the payments for that loan. Over time, Nicanora has been able to expand her credit line with the institution, and thanks to this, today she has a well-stocked store and a solid customer base. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy a variety of merchandise, such as meat, breads, beverages, dairy products, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying meat, beverages, dairy products, yerba tea, breads, and bulk products

loans.name: Rathnawathi

texts.en:
Rathnawathi is a 50-year-old married woman living with her husband in the town of Hikkaduwa, in southern Sri Lanka.  They have three daughters who are married. They range in age from 31 to 25 years old. 

Rathnawathi has her own plant yard where she grinds cinnamon leaves to produce cinnamon oil.  She and her husband run the business together; every day her husband goes to collect cinnamon leaves from their cinnamon garden. She has gained a great deal of experience about this type of affairs.  There is a strong local demand for their products, because Hikkaduwa is located in a tourist area of Sri Lanka. There are always tourists coming to buy their cinnamon oil products.

Rathnawathi is a hard-working woman who is very knowledgeable about her business. She is asking for a 20,000 LKR loan in order to purchase more leaves to increase the capacity of her cinnamon oil production. Eventually in the future, she hopes to purchase a new grinding machine with her profits.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase cinnamon leaves

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: LA SRA. CARMEN  TRABAJA CON NUESTRA INSTITUCION DE MANERA MUY RESPONSABLE YA QUE SUS CREDITOS LOS PAGA CON MUCHA PUNTUALIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD COMO ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL TIENE EL INGRESO DE SU LIBRERIA LA MISMA QUE EMPEZO CON NUESTRO FINANCIAMINETO Y FUE DESDE AHI QUE LE EMPEZO A IR BASTANTE BIEN YA QUE EN ESTOS MOMENTOS CUENTA CON UN NEGOCIO CON BASTANTE MERCADERIA, COMO SEGUNDA ACTIVIDAD TIENE UN AUTOMOVIL QUE LO TRABAJA UN CHOFER CUYOS INGRESOS QUE GENERA ES POR LA RENTA DE SU MOVILIDAD QUIEN TRABAJA EN TRUFI 1 DE LA ZONA, CON ESTAS ACTIVIDADES ES CON LAS QUE MANTIENE A TODA LA FAMILIA COMPUESTA POR LA MAMA, LA HERMANA Y SUS DOS HIJOS LOS CUALES AUN SON PEQUEÑOS, CONOCIENDO A LA SEÑORA LO TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE SE HIZO ACREEDORA DE LA TASA KIVA, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA UNA FOTOCOPIADORA PARA OFRECER ESTE SERVICIO EN SU LIBRERIA. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Carmen works with our institution in very responsible fashion. She always makes her payments responsibly and punctually. Her primary source of income comes from her bookstore, the same store that she opened through our financing. She got along fine in the beginning, and these days she can count on a business with ample merchandise. As a second form of income, she rents out her automobile to a driver who works in the city's share-taxi zone 1. In these ways she can maintain her family that includes her mother, her sister, and her sister's two small children. Knowing that Carmen is a hardworking and responsible woman, she was granted the Kiva lending rate. With this loan, she will buy a photocopier in order to offer the service in her bookstore. She is very grateful for Emprender and Kiva for having the confidence to make her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchse of a photocopier

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita R. is from the village of Talon, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old, married, and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Zita cooks snacks like banana que (deep-fried banana covered with carmelized brown sugar), ordinary hot cakes and other delicacies and sells them in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Zita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials and more ingredients needed to cook snack foods. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials and more ingredients needed to cook snack foods

loans.name: Alda Lucia

texts.es:
Alda Lucia M. M., tiene la edad de 52 años, es acompañada por su pareja de vida, que habitan en el barrio Laureles Sur, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, que actualmente radican en Guatemala, ella se dedica a la costura y tiene más de 15 años en este negocio  y fue gracias a su mama que le enseño los oficios de la costura, dándole una fuente de trabajo e ingresos para poder brindarle el sustento diario a sus hijos.

Ella consiguió su primera máquina de coser, gracias a un crédito, ahora sus hijos le apoyan  económicamente a sus padres, a futuro desea comprarse una máquina de coser industrial, esta compra le traerá mayores ofertas de trabajo, que le den un mejor sustento, por ahora lo que más la tiene con inquietud  es el cambio inmediato, que deben de realizar al techo de su hogar  y es para este propósito que solicitan el préstamo para el repello y cambio de las laminas de zinc del techo de su vivienda.  Un mejor habitad les dará la tranquilidad de descansar en un espacio seguro y digno que les mejore los niveles de vida del matrimonio.
texts.en:
Alda Lucia M. M., 52, is accompanied by her partner in life, with whom she lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. They have 3 grown children who currently live in Guatemala. She works as a dressmaker, and she has more than 15 years of experience in this business. Her mother taught her the skills of dressmaking, giving her a source of work and income so that she could provide support to her children. Alda got her first sewing machine thanks to a loan. Now her children support their parents financially. In the future, she wants to buy herself an industrial sewing machine. This would bring her better work opportunities and provide a better income. But for now her greatest need is to replace the roof of her house, and to do this she is requesting a loan for the plaster and sheets of corrugated metal needed to complete that project. This will provide a better home environment that will give her the tranquility of being able to rest in a secure and decent space, and will improve the couple's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials to replace the roof of her home

loans.name: Xoljuyup Group

texts.es: El crédito solicitado serán utilizado para ampliación de capital de la actividad a las que se			 dedican cada uno de las integrantes del grupo ya que cada uno de ellas se han dedicado a la fabricaciòn de blusas para dama y las venden en otros pueblos cercanos y con los ingresos que obtiene sirven para mantaner a sus familias e hijos  viendo la gran necesidad de acudir a la ASOCIACION ASDIR para pedir el apoyo a su apliaciòn de capital para mejorar las ventas  y obtener mas ganancias y tener otro nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The loan requested by this group of women will be used to increase the supply of capital that each of the members requires in order to carry out their work. Since each member of the group earns their money by making women's blouses and selling them in nearby towns, the loan will support this work. The members use the income they receive from their sales to support their families and children. Recognizing their own need for a helping hand, the group decided to ask the ASOCIACION ASDIR to assist them in expanding their capital supply. This in turn will enable them to increase their sales, earn more money, and achieve a better standard of living for themselves and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Aplicaciòn de capital

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: El Sr. ALFONSO esta casado, es un cliente antiguo de la institución, es muy responsable y puntual en el pago de cuotas, se dedica al servicio de transporte, tiene su movilidad propia con la que trabaja como radiotaxi, vive en su casita ubicada en la zona de San Isidro Bajo, con su esposa que se dedica a las labores de la casa; sus hijos ya son independientes y viven también por la zona, el solo mantiene el hogar, trabaja solo para mantenerse el y a su esposa, El crédito será invertido en la compra de cuatro llantas y motor de arranque para su movilidad, al cliente le gusta tener su movilidad siempre en buen estado para poder trabajar sin problemas y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Alfonso is married and is a long-time client of this institution. He is very responsible and punctual in making his payments. He works in transportation services; he has his own car that he operates as a radio taxi. He lives in a little house in the San Isidro Bajo area with his wife, who takes care of the housework. Their children are already grown, and they live in the same area. He works to be able to keep his home and to provide for his wife and himself. This loan will be invested in buying four tires and a starter motor for his car. His clients like that he always has his car in good working order and without any problems so as to provide the best service possible. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for having the confidence in him to grant him this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires and starter motor for his car

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité “Renacer”tiene  mas de 3 años de formación, la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero hay nuevas integrantes que emprenderán actividades productivas para ayudar a sus familias.
Incluyen entre las actividades realizadas la venta de frutas y verduras , venta de comestibles artesanales como empanadas de carne ,empanadas de pollo ,empanadas de jamón y queso, y otros.
Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.   
La venta de ropas es una actividad muy practicada por muchas mujeres y entre ella se incluye la señora Olga quien también se dedica a dicha actividad. Ella ofrece sus ropas en un salón frente a su casa.
Ella nos comenta que hay días en tiene buena venta y otros en las que no tiene, además quiere renovar sus mercadeáis ya que se acerca la temporada fría y los tipos de ropas que se compra cambian.
Actualmente encontró una oferta muy buena de un lote de pantalones de Jeans  a muy buen precio para concretar la venta solicita el prétamos.
texts.en:
The group "Renacer" was formed more than 3 years ago. The majority of its members already have productive businesses, but there are new members who will start up new businesses to help their families. They have a variety of types of businesses, including: the sale of fruit and vegetables, the sale of handmade foods such as meat empanadas, chicken empanadas, ham and cheese empanadas, and other items. They yearn for a better future for their children, and toward this end they redouble their efforts to provide the materials for their training and development. Many of the women in the group sell clothing. Among them is Olga, who also works in this occupation. She offers her clothing in a room at the front of her house. She tells us that there are days when sales are good, and others when sales are low. Also, she wants to renew her merchandise, since the cold season approaches and the type of clothing that people buy will change. Today she has found a very good offer to buy a large quantity of jeans at a very good price. In order to carry out this purchase she requests a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy jeans

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: La Sra. Emma esta casada, tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende fruta, en la zona de Pampahasi, y por las tardes se dedica a la confección de busos deportivos, vive también en la zona, su esposo es entrenador de Futbol de inferiores en el equipo de la ciudad, tiene dos hijos, una niña que está en colegio y un bebé que cumplirá recién un año, con las dos actividades la Sra. Emma ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, la Sra. es muy trabajadora trata de variar sus productos para atraer mas clientela. El crédito será invetido en la compra de diversidad de frutas, uno de sus deseos de la Sra. es hacer construir su casita ya que tiene un terreno y esta ahorrando para la contruccion, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emma is married and has a small store where she sells fruit in the region of Pampahasi. In the afternoons she works making athletic clothing. She lives in that same area, and her husband is a junior league soccer coach for the city's team. They have two children: a daughter in high school and a baby son who is almost one year old. With her two jobs Mrs. Emma helps her husband with the expenses of the home. She is a very hard-working and tries to vary her products to attract more customers. The loan will be invested in purchasing a variety of fruits. One of her dreams is to build a small house since she already has the land and is currently saving to begin construction. She is very thankful for Emprender and Kiva for trusting her with the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Sorca Maibe

texts.es: LA SEÑORA SORCA CON SU PECULIAR NOMBRE ES CONOCIDA  EN LA ZONA EN QUE VIVE, LA SEÑORA SORCA INICIO SUS TRABAJOS YA HACE TRES AÑOS POR MOTIVOS ECONOMICOS EN SU FAMILIA, PARA AYUDAR  EN LA ALIMENTACION  D. SU HOGAR , SER UN APOYO PARA SU ESPOSO YA QUE LA SITUCCION ACTUAL ES BASTANTE TERRIBLE, Y AHORA ESPERA AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA UNA  FOTOCOPIADORA QUE LE SERA MUY UTIL, Y ASI TAMBIEN CUBRIRA LAS NECESIDADES D. SUS CLIENTES. Y SI TODO MARCHA BIEN  LA SEÑORA TIENE DESEOS D. ABRIR UNA LIBRERIA QUE MUCHA FALTA LE HACE A LA ZONA ELLA SE DEDICA A LA TRANSCRIPCION D. DOCUMENTOS, PROYECTOS, TRABAJO QUE LE LLEVAN  A SU DOMICILIO, LA SRA. ES SECRETARIA, TIENE 2 HIJITOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y CON MUCHAS GANAS D. SUPERACION, ESTA AGARDECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sorca, with her unusual name, is well-known in the area where she lives. Sorca started out with her business three years ago on account of her family's financial situation, to put food on the table and to be a support to her husband in these rough times. She works as a secretary, transcribing documents and projects, and she brings her work home. Now, she hopes to expand her business. With this loan she plans to buy a photocopier, which would prove very useful, and also it will cover what she needs for her clients. If all goes well, Sorca wants to open a much-needed bookstore in her area. She has two small, school-aged children. She is very hard-working and has a great desire to succeed. She is thankful to Emprender and Kiva for giving her confidence through granting this loan.
