Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchse of a photocopier

loans.name: Alily

texts.en:
Alily D. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old, married, and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Alily plants and harvests coconut for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately $350 a month for these activities.

In 2004, Alily joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Alily is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business, and part of this loan will be used to pay for services extended by her farm helpers. This will be her 15th loan from from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su cuarto ciclo. Podemos hablar de la Sra.Gabriela A. con 23 años de edad , que se dedica a producir tortas, ella elabora las tortas de acuerdo a los pedidos que ella recibe de sus clientes, este trabajo lo realiza por la mañana y tarde es una persona muy trabajadora. Ella la mayor entre otros hermanos y gracias a su trabajo ella puede pagar sus estudios terciaR. y de los hermanos que van en la escuela, agradece por el apoyo que recibe de la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva.
solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas que ella utiliza para elaborar sus tortas.
texts.en:
This committee is in its fourth cycle. We can talk about Mrs.Gabriela A., who is 23 years old. She makes a living by selling made to order cakes. She works in the morning and the afternoon and is a very hard worker. She is the oldest of several siblings and thanks to her job can pay for their third-level studies and for her siblings who go to primary school. She is grateful for the support she receives from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva. She is asking for a loan to buy tools to use for making cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools to make cakes like sleeves, coloring, and decorative accessories.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: LA SEÑORA OLGA ES UNA MUJER EMPRENDEDORA DEDICADA AL TRANSPORTE DIARIO EN SU VEHICULO, ELLA ES CHOFER DE TRANSPORTE URBANO, LA SRA. OLGA INICIO SU LABOR YA HACE UN AÑO VIENDO UNA REALIDAD DIFICIL EN SU FAMILIA, TENIENDO ASU ESPOSO ENFERMO Y A DOS NIÑOS QUE MANTENER ESTE FUE UN IMPULSO BASTANTE MOTIVADOR PARA REALIZAR EL TRABAJO QUE AHORA EFECTUA. SIENDO UN RETO DE AQUI PARA ADELANTE, Y UNA VEZ QUE SU ESPOSO SE ENCUENTRE MEJOR DE SALUD ES LA QUE DE COMPRAR OTRO VEHICULO PARA QUE AMBOS PUEDAN TRABAJAR, SU ACTIVAD ES UN RETO YA QUE LA MAYORIA DE LOS CHOFERES DE TRANSPORTE URBANO SON HOMBRES, HAY POCAS MUJERES EN ESTA ACTIVIDAD, A UN PRINCIPIO ELLA CUENTA QUE FUE DIFICIL YA QUE TUVO QUE PASAR POR MUCHAS BURLAS, PERO SUPO SUPERAR TODO ESTO. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA REPUESTOS PARA SU MOVILIDAD YA QUE ESTA PRESENTANDO ALGUNAS FALLAS. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Olga is an enterprising woman dedicated to providing daily transportation services in her vehicle; she’s a public transportation driver. Olga started this work a year ago when her family was undergoing a difficult reality. Her husband was sick and she had two small children to support. This was a motivating force for her to start the business she now has. This is her challenge from this day forward. Once her husband recovers his health her challenge will be to buy another vehicle so that both can work. Her work is a challenge because most of the city’s urban transportation workers are men; few women are in this occupation. At the beginning, she tells us that it was very difficult because she had to put up with a lot of mockery. However, she overcame all of this. She will use the requested funds to buy replacement parts for her vehicle because it needs some repair work. She is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts.

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Azucena C. O., tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y su esposo labora como mensajero, brindando el sustento de vida a la familia, ellos habitan en el Barrio Laureles Norte, tienen tres hijos,  la mayor de 30 años se vale por si misma, pero los otros dos pequeños dependen económicamente de ellos.

Dentro de las prioridades, esta la remodelación de la infraestructura del hogar, es por esto que solicitan de un préstamo para la compra de ventanas y un portón de hierro que refuerce la seguridad del hogar, debido a que ellos habitan en un barrio capitalino que muestra altos índices de delincuencia y amenaza con el buen vivir, esta es la razón de la compra y la inversión que desean llevar a cabo, para la proteccion de los pequeños.
texts.en:
Maria Azucena C. O. is forty-four and married. Her husband works as a courier to support the family. They live in the Laureles Norte neighborhood and have three children. The eldest, who is thirty, is on her own, but the other two little ones are still dependent. Maria's priorities include renovating their home. She is seeking a loan so she can buy windows and an iron gate to reinforce the house's security. Their neighborhood is in the capital, which has a higher crime rate that threatens their well-being. That's why she wants to make the expenditures, to invest in the protection of her little ones.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy windows and an iron gate.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Santa Marta, se conformó en fecha 21 de agosto del 2008, gracias a que la actual Directora Finanzas la Sra. Eulalia J.,  quien contactó con la asesora que también tenía un grupo en la misma zona, se informó del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 5º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
 Es un excelente grupo gracias al  trabajo solidario realizado y continuan trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Encarnacion M., quien es la presidenta del grupo, especificamente invertira el credito para la compra de Golosinas.
Encarnacion es vendedora ambulante, con mucho esfuerzo dia a dia recorre los colegios,las plazas,  las canchas deportivas para ofrecer sus golosinas y asi ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
The Santa Marta Women's Committee was formed as of August 21, 2008, thanks to the current Finance Director Ms. Eulalia J.. Ms. J. contacted a consultant who had another group in the area, the Women Entrepreneurs Program Committee. Once advised about this other program, she managed to gather 15 women who are working jointly, comfortably and with solidarity in their 5th cycle of the program. It's a great group thanks to the solid work already done and continued work with the program to this day. They perform fundraising activities and help each other to reach the common goals of the group and Fundacion Paraguaya. Encarnacion M., who is president of the group will invest the loan to buy sweets to sell. Encarnacion is a street vendor, who works hard everyday on a route to schools, squares, sports fields to offer and sell her candies to earn a living.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for the preparation of food (meat, vegetables, flour, spices, eggs, etc), purchase of clothes, buy lingerie, buy ingredients for making cakes, buying fruit and vegetables, buying drinks, buying articles for making clothes, buying ingredients to make mass purchases of food for pigs, buy sweets, buy dry goods, etc.

loans.name: Serenidad Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Serenidad, se conformó en fecha 17 de enero del 2009, gracias a que la Directora de Finanzas la Sra. Ma. Mercedes Colmán  que se dedica a la venta de especies, ya formó parte de otro grupo anteriomente, que al desintegrarse dicho grupo, desidio contactar con la asesora y    formar su propio grupo, la misma contacto con sus vecinas y logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 5º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Todas ellas participan activamente en las reuniones semanales, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya
Iluminada F. la actual presidenta del Comite Serenidad, invertira su credito en su pequeña Mercederia que con mucho sacrificio ha venido cargando de mercaderias y complementando su negocio con articulos para la costura y compostura, bordados, accesorios e inclusive juguetes
texts.en:
The group of women called Serenidad [Serenity] was formed January 17th, 2009 thanks to Finance Director Mrs. Maria Mercedes Colmán, who sells spices. Previously, she was part of another group, and when this group dissolved, she decided to contact the adviser and form her own group. She also contacted her neighbors and was able to unite 17 working women. They are in their fifth cycle, united together within the program. They all participate actively in the weekly meetings, and help one another to reach their communal objectives within the group and with Fundación Paraguaya. Iluminada F., now the president of the Serenidad group, will invest the credit in her small market, which, with much sacrifice, she has been stocking with merchandise and supplementing with items for sewing and repair, embroidery, accessories and even toys.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell, ingredients for food preparation, materials for clothing production

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Jeanet

texts.es: LA SRTA. JEANET VIVE EN CASA FAMILIAR DE SUS PAPAS , PRESTA SERVICIOS, COMO PELUQUERA Y OTROS. LA CLIENTE ES DE CLASE HUMILDE Y SENCILLA  LO CUAL SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA APERTURAR SU PROPIO  SALON DE BELLEZA EN SU DOMICILIO Y COMPRAR LOS MATERIALES QUE NECESITA, ES SOLTERA, AHORRO YA ALGO DE DINERO CON EL DESEO DE ABRIR SU PROPIO SALON, Y EMPRENDER LE ESTA DANDO LA OPORTUNIDAD CON EL PRESTAMO OTORGADO, ES MUY TRABAJADORA SIEMPRE PREOCUPADA POR EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA YA QUE ES LA UNICA QUE MANTIENE EL HOGAR, OTRO DE US DESEOS ES DE SEGUIR ACTUALIZANDOSE EN EL CAMPO DE LA PELUQUERIA YA QUE SIEMPRE HAY NOVEDADES POR TEMPORADAS, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Jeanet lives with her parents in their home. She provides hair styling and other related services. Her customers are low-income, humble and unassuming. She is asking for funds in order to open a beauty salon in her home and to buy the necessary supplies and materials she needs. She’s single and has already saved up some of the funds she needs to open her own salon and Emprender is giving her the opportunity with this loan. She is very hard-working, always watchful of her family’s wellbeing since she is the home’s only source of support. Another of her dreams is to continue updating her skills as a stylist because there are always new things each season. She is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
EL señor Cesar Augusto R. G., tiene la edad de 40 años es soltero, taxista, y habita en el Barrio Laureles Norte.

La alza en el combustible ha afectado su economía doméstica, debido a que él tiene planes de comprarse otro taxi para aumentar la oferta y suplir la demanda que existe en estos días. El señro Cesar antes era cadete de policía, y con su salario ahorro lo suficiente para la compra de un carro taxi y así valerse por sí mismo, bajo sus propias reglas de trabajo, ahora él solicita un préstamo para invertir en su hogar en la compra de laminas de zinc, debido a que las que están en la actualidad se encuentran en pésimo estado y con las temporadas de lluvias que se avecinan para el próximo mes de mayo afectaran su vida cotidiana.
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto R. G. is a 40-year-old single taxi driver and lives in Barrio Laureles Norte. The spike in fuel prices has affected his personal finances, since he has plans to purchase another taxi to increase supply to meet the recent demand. Cesar was previously a police cadet, and saved enough of his salary to purchase a taxi cab and fend for himself, living by his own rules. He is now seeking a loan to purchase sheet metal for his home, as the sheet metal he has now is in poor condition. With the rainy season coming in May, it will affect his daily life.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheet metal

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: El grupo primavera esta compuesta por 6 mujeres y un hombre trabajadoras y trabajador que luchan para la vida hace  6 años comenzaron esta labor D. compra y venta D. ropa tipica, viendo la necesidad D. ampliar sus negocio acuden a la Asociaciòn ASDIR para el apoyo D. su capital y por lo tanto El crédito solicitado será utilizado para ampliación D. capital, D. la actividad a las que se dedican 	cada una D. las integrantes del grupo, por lo que se le considera que  la inversion será rentable, debido a que generaran más ingresos para la familia D. cada interesada
texts.en:
The Primavera group is comprised of six women and one man. They are hard-working, and they fight to earn a living. Six months ago they started the work of buying and selling typical clothing. Seeing the need to expand their businesses, they come to the Asociasión ASDIR for help with the capital in the activity in which each member of the group is involved. Their view is that the investment will be profitable. It will generate more income for each member’s family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA CRISTINA ES VIUDA, SU ESPOSO FALLECIO HACE POCO PARA ELLA FUE UN MOMENTO DIFICIL YA QUE SE ENCONTRO SOLA EL ERA SU UNICO APOYO, YA QUE ELLA SOLO SE DEDICABA A LABORES DE LA CASA, PERO SUPO SALIR ADELANTE POR EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA YA QUE TIENE 4 HIJOS, SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE EDREDONES, TAMBIEN TIENE UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO EN SU DOMICILIO, DESDE HACE 3 AÑOS, LA SEÑORA ESTA EN SU SEGUNDA SECUENCIA DONDE HA DEMOSTRADO SER MUY RESPONSABLE EN SUS PAGOS, ELLA SOLA MANTIENE SU HOGAR TIENE CASA PROPIA, ESTE CREDITO ES PARA COMPRAR MERCADERIA PARA ASI PODER SURTIR SU TIENDA, ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE SIEMPRE VIENDO A QUE NEGOCIO DEDICARSE YA QUE EL DINERO NO LE ALCANZA CON 4 HIJOS ES DURO PARA ELLA, PERO LA SRA. CRISTINA SIEMPRE OPTIMISTA POR EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Cristina is a widow. Her husband died a short while ago. This was a difficult time for her because she found herself alone. He was her only support because she only devoted herself to the housework. But, she knew how to get ahead for the family’s well-being. She has four children. She buys and sells comforters. She has also had a neighborhood store in her house for three years. She is in her second cycle, and she has shown herself to be very responsible with her payments. She alone supports her household. She has her own house. This loan is to buy merchandise to be able to stock her store. She is very hard-working and responsible. She always sees which business to work in when there is not enough money. With four children it is hard for her. But, Cristina is always optimistic about the well-being of her family. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust given in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Mario De La Cruz

texts.es:
El señor Mario de la Cruz R. A., vive acompañado de su esposa, la cual le apoya en la venta de los productos químicos que él vende, desde hace más de 10 años, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad que le apoyan económicamente a sus padres.

Uno de los máximos obstáculos que ha tenido en los últimos años ha sido la muerte de su caballo, el cual le ayudaba a transportar los productos de venta, gracias al ahorro de la familia es que pronto realizara la compra de un nuevo potro, pero una de sus prioridades hoy en dia, es la compra de los materiales de cerámica para la instalación del piso de su hogar y compra de laminas de zinc para entechar el porche de su hogar, espera que le ayuden económicamente y de esta manera mejorar sus niveles de vida y la de su esposa.
texts.en:
Mario de la Cruz R. A. lives with his wife. She helps him sell chemical products, which he has sold for more than 10 years. They have 3 adult children who support their parents financially. One of the major obstacles that he has had in the last few years has been the death of his horse, who used to help him transport the products he sells. Thanks to the family's savings, soon he will buy a new colt. However, one of his priorities today is the purchase of the ceramics materials for the installation of a floor in his home and in the purchase of sheets of zinc to put a roof over the porch of his house. He hopes that you will help him financially and in this way improve his and his wife's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Antonia's Group

texts.es:
El grupito D. 6 mujeres trabajadoras que han emprendido el negocio D. compra y venta D. ropa tipica, seis años atras y para apliar su negocio y ven esa necesidad para tener màs ganancias  acuden a la Asociaciòn ASDIR para 
El crédito solicitado será utilizado para ampliación D. capital, D. la actividad a las que se dedican 		cada una D. las integrantes del grupo, por lo que se le considera que  la inversion será rentable,		debido a que generaran más ingresos para la familia D. cada interesada, y asi tener mejoras en sus vidas.
texts.en:
This group of six hard-working women has undertaken the business of buying and selling typical clothing. They started six years ago, and they now see the need to expand their business to get more earnings. That is why they come to the Asociación ASDIR. The requested loan is to be used to increase capital in the activity in which each member of the group is involved. Their view is that the investment will be profitable. It will generate more income for each member’s family. That way they will improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
El Sr. Concepción P. A., tiene la edad de 43 años habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, es casado  y su esposa realiza los trabajos del hogar, son una familia de 5 miembros, sus 3 hijos son mayores estudian y trabajan para aportar a la economía doméstica de los gastos que se generan mes a mes,  el señor es técnico desde hace ya más de 15 años, siendo este la principal fuente de ingresos de la familia P..

Gracias a su propio esfuerzo logro la apertura de su taller, brindando mejores condiciones económicas a la familia, ahora necesitan de una inversión a la infraestructura  de su hogar, sobre todo al techo de la casa, el cual está en muy mal estado y amenaza con la inseguridad de todos los miembros de la familia, con el préstamo lograra un gran avance en la culminación de las edificaciones de su hogar, él dice sentirse satisfecho de los resultados que ha tenido, gracias a otros préstamos que ha tenido con Afodenic, pues esto ha colaborado al bienestar social de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Concepcion P. Aragon is 43 years old, married, and lives in the Juan Ramon Padilla Section. His wife works in the home, and they are a family of 5. The 3 children are grown, either studying or working to contribute to monthly household expenses. Mr. Aragon has been a technician for more than 15 years, providing the major source of income for the P. family. Through his own efforts, he was able to open a workshop, offering better conditions for his family. They now need to invest in the house’s infrastructure, especially the roof, which is in very poor condition, posing a threat to the safety of all family members. The loan will allow him to move forward significantly in completing work on his home. He feels satisfied with his results thus far, thanks to other Afodenic loans, for this has contributed to the well-being of his entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two daughters and two sons. Three of her children attend school but the youngest is not old enough yet. Her husband is a driver. Fatuma has a food kiosk and a green grocer. With the loan of 40,000 KES, Fatuma wants to purchase beans, rice, sugar, maize flour and vegetables. 

She has been in this business for 8 years and earns additional income from a merry-go-round. The greatest challenge to her business is the stiff competition and the lack of funds to rent a good shop. She aspires to own a permanent building for her shop someday so that she doesn't have to pay rent. 

Fatuma decided to work with Yehu because the organization does not harass its clients and enlightens them as to how to best use their loans and invest wisely. She rents her home and does not have piped water or electricity. She takes care of her parents, and her greatest monthly expenses are for school fees, food and the rent for her kiosk and home.

loans.use: Beans, rice, sugar, maize flour and vegetables

loans.name: Ernesto Rufino

texts.es:
El señor Ernesto Rufino B. Lopez, tiene la edad de 53 años es casado y con su esposa y sus 4 hijos mayores de edad todos, dos de ellos estudian su carrera universitaria y los otros 2 son casados e independientes, todos habitan en el Municipio de Ticuantepe, su esposa es comerciante y aporta a los gastos que se generan mes a mes en la familia, ellos tienen su propio negocio el cual es una librería y el Sr. B. es quien la administra.

El solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como ventanas y puertas, de esta forma culminar las edificaciones en su hogar, el cual sería el mayor logro de la familia, debido a que sus hijos están mayores y desean como padres, que un día perecerán, dejarles una herencia que les dé una garantía de vida a los hijos y la satisfacción personal de favorecer sus vidas.
texts.en:
Mr. Ernesto Rufino B. Lopez is 53 years old. He is married and has 4 children. All of his children are adults. Two of them are studying in college and the other two are married and independent. They all live in the town of Ticuantepe. His wife is a merchant and she constributes to the expenses that the family has from month to month. They have their own business, a bookstore, and Mr. B. manages it. He is asking for a loan to purchase construction materials such as windows and doors so that he can finish the construction of his home. This would be his family's greatest acheivement. Since their children are grown, and they are parents who will one day die, they wish to leave them an inheritance that can be security for their children's lives and have the personal satisfaction of favoring their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a married woman with two sons, one of whom is in school. Her husband works at the port clearing goods and she sells clothes and home products. With the ksh. 40,000 loan she plans to purchase more curtains, doormats, bed sheets, clothes and handbags. She has been in this business for seven years and sells her products from home and door-to-door. She aspires to own a shop in the future so that she doesn't have to transport her goods door-to-door. Asha wanted to work with Kiva partner Yehu because their terms are good and clients are not harassed with paying their loans.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba M. est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TAMBACOUMBA depuis 08 ans et occupe le poste de trésorière. Elle a 16 fois de suite bénéficié de crédits qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce de jus de citron, d'huile de palme et d'huîtres. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et de prendre partiellement les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Coumba M. is a 42-year old woman who is married and mother to five children, all of whom attend school. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in TAMBACOUMBA for eight years and is its treasurer. She has had 16 consecutive loans which she has always repaid without difficulty. She is developing a small business selling lemon juice, palm oil and oysters. Her aim is to contribute to the improvement in her family's living conditions and to cover part of her children's schooling expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her small business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with a four-year-old daughter who attends school. Her husband works in the port to clear goods. Mary currently rents her home and has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, water and electricity.
Mary sells shoes, which she displays on the street in town in the evenings. She earns additional income from selling juice during the day. With her 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase more shoes. Her greatest challenge is that she can't find a good selection of shoes to purchase at times. Mary aspires to open her own shop in town someday.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Fernando Jose C. S., tiene la edad de 40 años, es casado tiene dos hijos menores de edad que estudian la escuela primaria y dependen económicamente de ellos, la familia habita en el Barrio Medardo Andino, su esposa se dedica a las tareas domésticas diarias, el señor es fontanero y trabaja para la Empresa Nicaragüense de Agua Potable desde hace 6 años, siendo esta la fuente de ingresos de la familia C.. 

Dentro de sus Objetivos de vida, está el tener los recursos necesarios para poder brindarle a sus  hijos los estudios profesionales y que se valgan por ellos mismos a un futuro y les apoyen a sus padres a la sobrevivencia diaria, los recursos económicos de la familia son bastante limitados y es por esta razón que no han podido realizar mejoras a la infraestructura de su hogar, la idea principal de esta inversión es lograr que los hijos tengan una mayor privacidad con la construcción de sus cuartos independientes, la ayuda que se le proporcione a esta familia aportara al bienestar económico social de todos los miembros y marcara positivamente  al desarrollo de los pequeños.
texts.en:
Fernando Jose C. S., age 40, is married and has two minor children. The children go to elementary school and are economically dependent upon them. The family lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. His wife devotes herself to the daily household chores. He is a plumber, and has worked for the Nicaraguan Potable Water Company for six years. This is the source of income for the C. family. One of his life objectives is to have the necessary resources to provide his children with an education to become professionals. This will allow them to support themselves in the future and to help their parents with their daily survival. The family’s resources are pretty limited. That is why he has not been able to make improvements to the infrastructure of his home. The main idea of this investment is for his children to have greater privacy by building their separate rooms. The help given to this family will contribute to the socioeconomic well-being of all of the members. It will positively effect the development of the little ones.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman with a two-year-old son and a five-year-old daughter who attends school. Her husband is a driver. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.
Faith runs a salon. With her 40,000 KES loan, she wants to pay rent for her stall and purchase weaves and cosmetics. She has been in this business for eight years and previously was in school. Her customers are mainly women. The greatest challenge to her business is competition from other salons. Faith aspires to expand her business into a large salon with many customers. She also hopes that she will be able to support her children through university. She decided to work with Kiva partner, Yehu, because it can boost her business. Faith describes herself as an active woman.

loans.use: To purchase weaves and cosmetics, and pay rent for her stall

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is married to a mechanic and sells used clothes. She has been in this business for one year and sells her products from a stall near her home. Her men's clothing is the easiest to sell. Martha travels to Nairobi twice a month to buy stock. Her greatest challenges are finding customers and the rainy season (as her stall does not have a roof). In addition, transportation for her products is a challenge.
With her 40,000 KES loan, Martha wants to purchase more clothes to sell. She aspires to grow her business and open a shop in town in the future. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent. Martha describes herself as honest, down-to-earth and hardworking. She is pictured with her older sister (wearing a white t-shirt) who helps her with her business sometimes.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim, a married man with a daughter who is still too young to attend school, rents his home and has electricity but no piped water.  A fisherman who wants to purchase fishing nets with the ksh. 20,000 loan, Salim has been in this business for 15 years and earns extra income as a carpenter. Selling his fish at the market near the old port of Mombasa, his greatest challenge is the low season between April and October. Salim decided to work with Yehu because it was easy to join, and he aspires to purchase more fishing boats in the future.

loans.use: Fishing nets

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with five children who attend school. She owns her house and has no piped water or electricity. Her husband is a driver and she has a kiosk where she sells vegetables and clothes. She has been in this business for five years and was previously operating a retail shop. She now sells her products from home. Her other source of income is from renting houses.
With her 20,000 KES loan, Rose wants to purchase tomatoes, cabbage, kale, baby and women's clothes. Her greatest challenge is the rainy season when business is very slow. In the future, she hopes to expand her rental business by constructing more rooms for rent. Rose wanted to join Kiva partner, Yehu, because she liked that they are a cooperative and treat their clients well.

loans.use: To purcahse tomatoes, cabbage, kale, baby and women's clothes

loans.name: Mwanamgeni

texts.en:
Mwanamgeni is a married woman with four daughters and one son. Two of her children are in school, two are married and her son is working. Her husband works at a personal clinic, and she wants to open a boutique. With the ksh. 30,000, she wants to purchase shoes, materials, handbags, and pay rent for a stall. Previously, she was selling mandazi (Kenyan pastry).

Mwanamgeni anticipates that transportation will be a challenge as she plans to get her goods in Tanzania, but she hopes to prosper in this business and start other enterprises as well. She currently rents her home and has electricity but no piped water. Mwanamgeni's greatest expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase shoes, materials, handbags, rent for a stall

loans.name: Grupo Tzanjuyup Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de señoras,  del paraje Tzanjuyup, del departamento de  Totonicapán, son personas de escasos recursos economicos, pero no se debe de descartar que son trabajadoras, cuentan con un promedio de 3 hijos cada una de ellas, actualmente estan solicitando su segundo prestamo en la Asociacón ASDIR, en su primer prestammo lo utilizaron para la compra de Cerdos, Ganado vacuno, gallinas de engorde y ponedoras, el cual incrementaron  
sus animales, y de esa manera lograron venderlos en un trimestre del año, obteniendo ganacias sobre las ventas y por supuesto ellas lograron ahorrar en dicha organizacion, y por tal razón piensan de nuevamente aumentar sus compras de animales para poder criarlos y engordarlos, y con este prestamo se considera que mejorará sus condiciones de vida, ya que con las ganancias que obtienen podrán aportar un pequeño gasto familiar, con el esposo de cada una de ellas.
texts.en:
The women in this group from Tzanjuyup, Aldea Chivarreto, San Fracisco el Alto, Totonicapán department, know each other very well. They have worked together for the past eight years. They are organized in the following way: Juana Guzmán M. is the president. These five people work in selling packs (?), cosmetics, shoes, plastics, making backpacks and selling traditional clothing. Their stalls are in San Francisco el Alto, Totonicapán. The woman who sells traditional clothing sells from her house. Those who raise animals sell them in San Francisco el Alto. The woman who sells candy sells at the school in Tzanjuyup. They all need to increase their working capital. For this reason they approached the Asosiación ASDIR offices in Pologúa.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Grupo Chimaldonado Group

texts.es: Es un grupo de 4 personas y doña Lucia Maria Hernandez, es la coordinadora del grupo, ella cuenta con 4 hijos 2 varones y 2 mujeres, se dedica a la confección de prendas, tales como, playeras para niños, y faldas, asi mismo el resto de las integrantes cuentan con un promedio de 3 hijos cada una de ellas, y la actividad que cada una realiza es la confeccion de prendas,  llevan alrededor de 6 años en esta actividad de confeccion   y seguidamente la crianza de animales, y en esta actividad tienen mas de 10 años de criarlos, es el primer prestamo que realizan, se han agrupado para que ellas pueden vender sus productos en mayor cantidad y minimizar los costos de ventas, ya que ellas venden a 20 kilometros de su comunidad, estas prendas son enviadas al norte del pais, o sea a unos 500 kilometros de la ciudad de San Francisco El Alto, ellas han presentado su solicitud de prestamo con la Asociación ASDIR, y con ello ayudará a aumentar su capital de trabajo, asi mismo generará mejores ingresos mensuales.
texts.en:
This group of ladies is from Chimaldonado, village of Chivarreto, municipality of San Francisco el Alto, Totonicapan department. They know one another very well, since they have worked together for the past 8 years. Their group is made up as follows: Lucia Maria Hernandez is president. They work in service, farming and animal husbandry, childcare, literacy in the case of Odilia Santos Hernandez, and Juana raises animals, such as hogs, and the others also raise animals. They have worked to develop themselves personally and for their families. They have sales places in San Francisco el Alto, Toto, as for those working in childcare, they are Reyna and Lucia Maria Hernandez, they work for an organization known as SOPEP. Odilia Santo works for another agency called Conalfa, as a partner to the organization. They need to increase their working capital, and for this reason came to the Pologua ASDIR offices for financing, and to thus improve conditions from themselves and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Trabajo.

loans.name: La Bendicion Group

texts.es: Este grupo de señoras,del paraje Pacorral, de la aldea Patachaj, del municipio de San Cristóbal Toto, del departamento de Totonicapán, son personas que se conocen muy bien, desde hace 6 años han trabajado siempre juntas, en el cual lo integran de la siguiente manera: doña Santos Justiniana T. Chigüil, es la presidenta, ellas se dedican especialmente a la crianza de animales tales como; cerdos, ovejas, pollos y vacas,  y en  el caso de doña: Concepción A.  se dedica a la elaboración de jarros y ollas de barro y las otras personas se dedican al servicio como lo es a la confección de playeras y faldas venden sus animales en el centro de: Patachaj, San Francisco el Alto, Totonicapán  y en algunos casos  las personas lo recogen en la casa de una de ellas, en el caso de doña: Concepción A. , vende en, Olintepeque y San Andrés Xecul , San Francisco el Alto, y San Cristóbal, Totonicapán,   necesitan ampliar sus producción de animales y también de la venta de Ropa , por lo que se acercaron a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de pologuá, a solicitar un prestamo para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de sus familias,
texts.en:
This group of women is from Pacorral, of the village of Patachaj, town of San Cristóbal Toto, departament of Totonicapán. They are people who know each other very well. They have been working together for 6 years and the group is organized in this way: Santos Justiniana T. Chigüil is the president, and they mainly work raising animals such as pigs, sheep, chickens and cows. Concepción A. makes clay pitchers and pots and others makes t-shirts and skirts. They sell their animals in: Patachaj, San Francisco el Alto, and Totonicapán. In some cases, people pick them up in one of their homes. Concepción A. sells in Olintepeque and San Andrés Xecul , San Francisco el Alto, and San Cristóbal, Totonicapán. They need to expand their animal production and also clothing sales. Because of this, they went to the offices of ASDIR in Pologuá to ask for a loan for financing. They are doing this to improve their own living conditions and that of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tacajalve Group

texts.es: Este grupo de señoras,  del paraje Xecorral, de la aldea Tacajalvé, del municipio de San Francisco el Alto  del departamento de Totonicapán, S. personas que se conocen muy bien, desde hace 20 años han trabajado siempre juntas, en el cual lo  doña: Santos Maria T., es la presidenta, estas siete personas se dedican especialmente a la Comercio Venta de llantas para vehículos, venta de ropa nueva, venta de concentrado para animales, Artesanía Elaboración de Perrajes, Elaboración de Camisas  y a la crianza de animales tales como: Cerdos Ovejas y Vacas, las persona que vende. Ropa tiene sus  puntos de venta en,  San Francisco el Alto y el caso de la venta de llantas fco. el Alto, Toto, en el caso de las verduras y frutas y en el caso de la Ropa típica y Faldas, lo venden en la Retalhuleu, Mazatenango, Coatepeque y También en San Francisco el Alto y en algunos casos las personas lo recogen en la casa de una de ellas,  para venderlos  por docena en diferentes lugares , las personas  necesitan ampliar sus Capital de Trabajo, por lo que se acercaron a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de Pologuá , para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de sus familias
texts.en:
This group of members from the small village of Tacajalvé, in the town of San Francisco el Alto, Department of Totonicapán, know each other very well, having worked with each other continuously for the past twenty years. Their president is Santos María T.. These seven people earn their living selling tires, new clothing, animal feed, hand-made perrajes [shawls] and shirts, and raising animals like pigs, sheep, and cows. The members who sell clothing or tires sell in San Francisco el Alto. Those who sell fruits and vegetables or everyday clothing and skirts sell in Retalhuleu, Mazatenango, Coatepeque as well as San Francisco el Alto. In some cases they pick up their items at someone's house and sell them by the dozen at a variety of locations. Because they need to expand their working capital, the members approached the ASDIR Association office in Pologuá seeking financing for their businesses so they can improve their families' quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alamuta Group

texts.fr:
ALLAMOUTA est un groupe de solidarité de huit (08) femmes toutes mariées. Elles vivent dans le même village et ont formé leur groupe par affinité depuis le 05 juillet 2001. Elle font parti du Banc Villageois de TEREMBASSE dans la région de Ziguinchor au Sénégal, elles ont entre 40 à 55 ans et sont mères d'au moins cinq enfants. Elles sont de la même ethnie; les BALANTE.

leur activité principale est la vente de poissons frais et d'huile de palme

Pour augmenter leur capacité d'autofinancement  afin de renforcer et d'intensifier leurs activité elles ont décidé de devenir des membres clients de CAURIE-MICRO FINANCE depuis 9 ans et sont à leur dix-septième  prêt solidaire et n'ont jamais eu de problème de remboursement.

Leurs nouveaux prêts leur permettront de développer et de faire la promotion de leur activité commerciale en augmentant leur quantité d'approvisionnement en marchandises tels que le poisson frais et l'huile de palme qu'elle achète auprès des transformateurs résidant dans leur village.

En se faisant des bénéfices à partir de leur commerce, elles font face aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et augmentent leur niveau d'épargne dans leur Banc Villageois
texts.en:
ALLAMOUTA is a solidarity group formed by eight women, all married. They live in the same village and have formed their group on July 5, 2001, based on friendship ties. They belong to the Terembasse Banc Villeagois in the region of Ziguinchor in Senegal; they are between 40 and 55 years of age, and each has at least five children. They all belong to the same ethnic group, the Balante. Their main activity is selling fresh fish and palm oil. In order to improve their ability to support themselves and to strengthen their business, nine years ago they have decided to join Caurie Microfinance and are now on their 17th group loan. They never had any issues with repaying their loans. The new loan will allow them to grow and promote their business and to purchase larger stock of their wares such as fresh fish and palm oil which they purchase from producers in their village. The income derived from their business is used to meet everyday family expenses and to increase their savings at the Banc Villageois.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening the group's self-sufficiency

loans.name: Juana Nazaria

texts.es: Doña Juana V., cuenta con un Taller de 2 telares para Elaborar Cortes típicos para mujeres,  lleva 20 años de trabajar en la Tejeduría ella y su esposo laboran para el mismo oficio como también sus 2 hijos en donde gracias a ello los ha podido sacar adelante dándoles una mejor calidad de vida y así poder obtener mejores ingresos y poder aumentar su capital 	ya que su numero de su clientela a aumentado por lo que nos solita su préstamo para dicha Artesanía, su residencia es en el Caserío Chocanac de la Aldea V., Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana V. has a shop with 2 looms where she makes typical clothing for women. She and her husband have been in the weaving business for 20 years. Her two sons also work in this trade. Due to this business she has been able to get her sons ahead giving them a better quality of life. She has been able to make a better income and increase her capital as the number of customers has been increasing. She is requesting a loan for the business. She lives in the Chocanac housing area of the Aldea V. in Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Juana Catarina

texts.es: Doña Juana García Cuenta con un Taller de 3 Telares para la Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres habita junto con su esposo y sus 5 hijos, llevan 12 años en la Tejeduría. Todos sus hijos estudian como también le ayudan a trabajar en la Artesanía y de esa manera donde ellos pueden  cubrir sus gastos como educación alimentación y tener mejores oportunidades de vida como a través del préstamo obtener mejores ganancias. Su residencia se encuentra en el paraje la Planta Cantón Juchanep, Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana G. has a shop with 3 looms where she makes typical clothing for women. She lives with her husband and 5 children. They have been in garment weaving for 12 years. All her children are studying in addition to helping in the craft. This way they can cover their expenses such as education and food, and have better opportunities in life. They are requesting the loan to be able to obtain more income. Their residence is in the Planta Cantón Juchanep place of Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Juana Pabla

texts.es: Doña Juana Menchú Cuenta con un pequeño taller de 1 telar donde elabora cortes típicos para Mujeres  y su residencia es en el  Caserío Chocanac, de la Aldea Vásquez, Totonicapán, su numero de clientes a aumentado por lo que solicita su préstamo ya que ella es Madre Soltera y así poder sacar adelante a su hijo dándole educación como poder tener mejores ganancias y poder cubrir su demanda. Ya que lleva 5 años de trabajar en la Artesanía.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Menchú has a small workshop with one loom where she makes typical clothing for women. She resides in the Chocanac housing area of the Aldea Vásquez in Totonicapán. The number of customers has increased which is the reason for her requesting the loan. She is a single mother and wants to get her son ahead by giving him an education. She would like to have a better income and be able to meet her demand. She has been in this craft for 5 years.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Magdalena Soledad

texts.es: Doña Magdalena García cuenta con un pequeño taller de 2 telares para elaborar Cortes típicos para mujeres ya que su clientela a crecido por lo que solicita su prestamos para poder cubrir su demanda como también darles educación a sus hijos ya que en ello lleva 8 años de laborar en dicha artesanía por lo que desea incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Magdalena García has a small workshop with 2 looms where she makes traditional garments for women. Since her customer base has grown, she requests a loan so that she can meet her demand. In addition, she wants to provide her children with an education. For this reason she has worked for 8 years making these types of handicrafts, and she wants to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Valentin Pedro

texts.es: Don Valentín  Gutiérrez es Propietario de un pequeño Taller de 3 telares para la Elaboración de Fajas Típicas para mujeres ya su numero de clientes a crecido por lo que nos solicita su préstamo y así poder cubrir su demanda y en ello lleva 6 años de elaborar en dicha artesanía y vive con su esposa y su hijo y en la cual ellos desean darle mejor educación y calidad de vida. Su residencia se encuentra en el paraje Choatzam del cantón Juchanep, Totonicapán
texts.en:
Don Valentín Gutiérrez is the owner of a small workshop with 3 looms. He makes traditional sashes for women, and since the number of his customers has grown, he is requesting a loan so that he can meet this demand. He has 6 years of experience making these types of handicrafts. He lives with his wife and his son. He wishes to provide a better quality of life for them and a better education for his son. His home is found in Choatzam in the Juchanep canton of Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: Doña María T. tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa típica para mujeres, lleva 8 años de vender ropa y en ello nos solicita un préstamo para poder aumentar su capital y poder cubrir su demanda, ella vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo  en el que se dedican en la misma actividad, su residencia es en el paraje Chuimenchú del Cantón Poxlajuj, Totonicapán. Y en ello poder ayudar a sus hijos para darles mejor educación y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María T. has a small business selling traditional women's clothing. She has had this business for 8 years, and she is requesting a loan in order to increase her capital so that she can meet the demand of her customers. She lives with her 3 children and her husband, who is engaged in the same activity. She lives in Chuimenchú in the Poxlajuj canton in Totonicapán. With her business she can help her children by giving them a better education and quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Vicente Raul

texts.es: Don Vicente Velásquez el labora para una Radio Nacional como locutor lleva 11 años de de realizar dicha función en la cual nos solicita su préstamo para pagos de Colegiatura y darles mejor educación  a su Hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Vicente Velásquez has worked as a broadcaster for national radio station for 11 years. He is asking for a loan to pay school fees for his children in order to give them a better education and to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational expenses

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es: Doña María T. tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de Frutas, lleva 8 años de vender  y en ello nos solicita un préstamo para poder aumentar su capital y poder cubrir su demanda, ella vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo  en el que se dedican en la misma actividad, su residencia es en el paraje Pujacar  del Cantón Xantún, Totonicapán. Y en ello poder ayudar a sus hijos para darles mejor educación y nivel de vida
texts.en:
María T. has a small business selling fruit. She has been selling for eight years. She is asking us for a loan to be able to increase her capital to be able to cover her demand. She lives with her three children and her husband, who works at the same activity. They live in the Paraje Pujacar in the Xantú canton in Totonicapán. She wants to be able to help her children by giving them a better education and a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Don Carlos Z., cuenta con un Taller de 6 Máquinas para Confeccionar Palayeras,  lleva 6 años de trabajar en la Sastrería  él y su esposa  laboran para el mismo oficio como también su  hijo en donde gracias a ello los ha podido sacar adelante dándoles una mejor calidad de vida y así poder obtener mejores ingresos y poder aumentar su capital 	ya que su numero de su clientela a aumentado por lo que nos solita su préstamo para dicha Artesanía, su residencia es en el Paraje Chichaclan del Cantón Paquí, Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Carlos Z. has a shop with six machines for making t-shirts. He has worked as a tailor for six years. He and his wife work in the same field, and their son does as well. Thanks to this work they have been able to get ahead and have a better quality of life. They have been able to get better earnings, and they have increased their capital. The number of customers they have has increased. He is asking us for a loan for this work. They live in Paraje Chichaclan in the Paquí canton, Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Nueva Concepcion Group

texts.es: Este grupo de personas esta conformado por 4 integrantes el cual lo integran 3 mujeres y 1 hombre siendo así la presidenta doña Gregoria X. B., cuenta con 5 hijos, 3 mujeres y 2 varones, ella se dedica a la Artesanía, elaboración de canastas plásticas, ya que con ello contribuye al medio ambiente para no seguir contaminando con las bolsas plásticas, esto contribuye en el momento en que las personas que utilizan este productos les servirá para la compra de panes, verduras, artículos de consumo diarios el cual no es necesario tener que recibir bolsas plásticas, y el resto del grupo se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos, pero actualmente necesitan ampliar su capital de trabajo, y el señor se dedica a la confección de gabachas de tela, para señoras que necesitan dentro del hogar.
texts.en:
This group of four people is made up three women and one man. The president of the group is Mrs. Gregoria X. B.. Gregoria has 5 children: 3 girls and 2 boys. She works in handicrafts, making plastic baskets that help the environment by avoiding the contamination of plastic bags. These baskets are for people to use when they go shopping for bread, vegetables, and daily food purchases- making it unnecessary to get plastic bags. The other members of the group raise domestic animals, but now they need to increase their working capital. The man makes cloth bags for women to use in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Pacotom Group

texts.es: Doña María Candelaria es la presidenta del grupo, conformado por 5 integrantes, todas residen en el lugar denominado, Paraje Pacotom, D. la Aldea Santa Ana, del municipio D. Momostenango, el cual viven a 15 kilómetros D. la ciudad, tienen poco acceso D. vehículos hacia la comunidad, y por esa razón realizan ventas D. consumo diarios en el lugar, lo hace para su beneficio personal, como también hacia la comunidad donD. vive, y las otras compañeras del grupo se dedican a la elaboración D. canastas plásticas, y el cual necesitan D. un préstamo para aumentar su capital con la que cuentan, y para ello tuvieron que agruparse como grupo, y D. esa manera realizar una solicitud D. préstamo por cada una D. ellas, la cual se consideran personas honradas y honorables dentro D. la comunidad.
texts.en:
María Candelaria is the president of the group, which is comprised of five members. They all live in a place called Paraje Pacotom in the Santa Ana Village in the Momostenango municipality. It is 15 kilometers from the city. They have little access to vehicles going to the community. That is why she sells daily consumption items where she lives. She does it for personal benefit, as well as for the community where she lives. Her colleagues in the group make plastic baskets. They need a loan to increase the capital that they have. To do this they had to form a group. This way they could request a loan for each one of them. They are considered to be honest people who are respected in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Flor De Mayo Group

texts.es: Doña Fidelina Angélica S., es presidenta del grupo Flor de Mayo, hace 6 años se conocen son originarios de la Aldea Chinimabé Momostenango,  Ella cuenta con 5 hijos 2 varones y 3 mujeres, actualmente ella se dedica a la Fabricación de almohadas de algodón, así mismo se dedica a la Elaboración de delantales, blusas, entre otros, cuenta animales domésticos, ella necesita un aumento de capital para el trabajo que actualmente realiza, pero para poder acceder a un prestamos en la Asociación ASDIR, fue necesario reunir al grupo de señoras quienes integran 5 personas, ya que ellas también tienen el mismo objetivo de aumentar el capital de negocio con la que cuentan.
texts.en:
Fidelina Angélica S. is president of the Flor de Mayo group. They have known each other for six years. They are from the Chinimabé Momostenango neighborhood. She has five children, two boys and three girls. She currently makes cotton pillows. She also makes aprons and blouses, among other things. She has domestic animals as well. She needs to increase her working capital for the work she currently does. But, in order to access a loan from the Asociación ASDIR she needed to join a group of women. There are five of them that make up the group. They all have the same objective of increasing their business capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es: Es un grupo de personas la cual lo conforman por 4 personas originarios del Paraje Pologuá, siendo la presidenta del grupo doña Marta Dana M., ella cuenta con 4 hijos, 2 mujeres y 2 varones, el cual ella se dedica al Servicio, Venta de consumo Diario, ella cuenta con una Tienda en el centro de Pologuá, y el resto del grupo de señoras realizan también la misma actividad, para lo cual ellas necesitan un aumento de capital de trabajo, y con el financiamiento que obtendrán podrán realizar sus sueños de poder obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
This is a group of 4 persons from Paraje Pologuá who have joined together. Their president is Marta Dana who has 4 children, 2 girls and 2 boys. She is dedicated to selling home products daily from her store in the center of Pologuá. The remainder of the women are in the same activity and they all need to increase their working capital (to buy more merchandise). With the financing they hope to obtain, they will be able to realize their dreams of obtaining better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MORE MERCHANDISE TO INCREASE THEIR INCOME

loans.name: Mardoqueo Secundino

texts.es: Don mardoqueo Secundino Torres, se dedica al comercio venta de articulos de electricidad tales como Focos, lamparas, accesorios como tomacorrientes, alambres, y entre otras cosas, cuenta con 5 hijos 3 varones y 2 mujeres, es originario del paraje Chocruz Aldea Los Cipreses, del municipio de Momostenango, vive a 5 kilometros del centro de la ciudad de Momosteanango, actualmente necesita un prestamo que lo utilizará para capital de trabajo, el cual desea mejorar sus ganancias, al mismo tiempo mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mardoqueo Secundino Torres has a business selling electrical appliances such as lights, lamps, and accessories like electrical outlets and wires, among other items. He has 5 children – 3 boys and 2 girls. He is from Chocruz Aldea Los Cipreses in the municipality of Momostenango. He lives 5 kilometers from the center of the city of Momostenango. He currently needs a loan that he will use for working capital, with which he wants to improve his earnings while also improving his living conditions and those of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Joel Misael

texts.es:
La persona solicitante del crédito se dedica especialmente al  Comercio "Compra y venta			
de ropa tales como; playeras, pantalones camisas.  El vive en el Paraje La Cumbre San Antonio Pasajoc, del municipio de Momostenango, cuenta con 2 hijas son menores de edad, y el es el unico que trabaja de la familia, para poder mantener a su familia tiende a viajar mas de 500 kilometros de donde reside, ya que el explora otras ciudades de la region Guatemalteca, con la necesidad que tiene fue a las oficinas de la Asociación ASDIR, en Pologuá para solicitar un prestamo y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Joel Misael, who is requesting this loan, buys and sells clothing, including T-shirts, pants, and shirts. He lives in Paraje La Cumbre San Antonio Pasajoc, in the municipality of Momostenango, and has 2 daughters who are minors. Joel is the only worker in the family. To maintain his family, he travels more than 500 kilometers from where he lives, searching for opportunities in other cities of the region. Given his needs, he visited the offices of the ASDIR Association in Pologuá to request a loan, and in this manner, to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE TO SELL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING NECESSARY INGREDIENTS TO PREPARE THE MEALS SHE SELLS

loans.name: Marco Nelrain

texts.en:
Marco Nelrain P. is from the town of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 32 years old. Marco Nelrain is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Marco Nelrain owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transport services with his motorcycle to local community members. Marco Nelrain has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marco Nelrain joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marco Nelrain is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marco Nelrain from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Kahled is a 27-year-old young man from Jenin. He started a cafe eight years ago, and over the eight years Khaled has been able to attract a big number of regular customers by his excellent service and good quality food and beverages, especially since his cafe is located in the city center.

After eight years, Khaled came to FATEN and took a loan to replace the old tables of the cafe and buy a wide-screen TV as well as doing remodeling.

Khaled hopes to collect enough money from his work to able to get married soon as he lacks the financial resources at the moment, and the cafe is his only source of livelihood.

loans.use: Cafe Improvements

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is an employee of the Palestinian National Authority.  Yaser is married and has two daughters, three and two years old. His salary was the family's only source of income till his wife came up with the idea of opening a small beauty salon in one of the rooms of their house to help her husband support their family.

It's been less than a year since she started offering services to her family and the women who live in the same neighborhood of Tulkarem city where she lives, and the number of customers is noticeably increasing.

Yaser wanted to help his wife improve her salon so he took a US$ 800 loan from FATEN so she can buy the needed equipment and materials such as make-up kits and hair-coloring creams. He tells us that this will increase the number of customers she has and the income from the project which might prepare her for a salon outside the house.

Yaser stands in the picture at FATEN's office in Tulkarem.

loans.use: Purchase beauty shop tools and equipment

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina D. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Josefina operates a service-based business, providing boarding houses and rooms for rent to students and mall employees. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $350 a month from these activities.

In 2006, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 26,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to renovate some rooms. 

Josefina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovations. She wants to renovate gradually and beautify her boarding house so as to attract more boarders. This will be her 9th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business.

texts.en:
Jimmy B. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 24 years old, married, and has one infant child. To make a living, Jimmy provides transport services to local community members using his own motorcycle. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately $153 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Jimmy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business and part of the loan was used to pay the monthly amortization of his motorcycle. 

Jimmy is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. He wants to put an extension on his motorcycle in order to transport more passengers from their village down to the city. This will be his 5th loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family. 

About HSPFI:
