location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal A. is 24 years old and married. He and his wife live in Gaza. He has a shoe store in Bet Hanoun. 

Nidal needs this loan to increase his working capital. It will allow him to provide more shoes which will increase his sales and increase his budget.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed F. is 33 years old and married. He is from Beit Lahya, Gaza.  His family consists of five members, two of whom go to school. 

Raed has a chicken farm that he wants to improve and develop. This loan will provide working capital and allow him to buy some equipment, like fans and heaters, which will help to increase productivity. This in turn will increase Raed’s income and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fans and heaters

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca Y., from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City, is 34 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop that sells both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan, her fifth, of 16,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. Rebecca plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad A., is a 29-year-old married man from Gaza with five members in his family.

Mohammad has an advertising project and he wants this loan in order to buy a copying machine for the project. This will develop his project and increase his budget at the same time.

loans.use: To buy a copying machine

loans.name: Thanuja

texts.en:
Thanuja is a 30-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has a 2-year-old child. Her husband assists with her business and they are very close. They have a grocery shop where she is selling items to local customers and villagers for their daily consumption. She started this business three years ago.

Thanuja has requested a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to purchase items for her grocery shop and expand her business. She is grateful for BRAC because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy grocery items and expand her grocery shop

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud S. is 26 years old and from Gaza. He is married with five members in his family. Mahmoud works as a carpenter. He is requesting a loan to buy more equipment. This will help him to enlarge his business, increase his productivity and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase more carpentry equipment

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en: Hazem J. is 27 years old and from Gaza. He is married with three members in his family. Hazem owns a perfume store. He is requesting a loan to help him enlarge his business. He will buy new perfumes for the store, which will increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: To buy new perfumes for his store

loans.name: Reeta

texts.en:
Reeta is a 44-year-old woman living with her husband, three kids, and Reeta's mother in the town of Hikkaduwa. She has two sons and one daughter in her family. She is a hardworking woman and wants to be financially independent. Reeta sews dresses, continuing a business that she started six years ago. Her husband and children help her with the business. She is asking for a 30,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC to buy cloth to sew. 

Reeta hopes to provide a more nutritious diet for her family through developing her business. Also she wants to renovate the house and to pay the children's tuition fees. She is appreciative of BRAC for providing her a loan to help her expand her business. This is Reeta's third loan; she successfully repaid her first and second loans. 

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila L. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 42 years old, separated from her spouse, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mila owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Mila has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Mila joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mila is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie B. is a 34-year-old woman from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. Marjorie is married and has 1 school-age child. To earn a living, Marjorie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. More specifically, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells a variety of products to her local community members. Marjorie has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2008, Marjorie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was able to engage in business activities and, in turn, to improve her standard of living. Marjorie has recently successfully repaid a loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. That prior loan was used to purchase additional inventory and to increase her working capital. Marjorie is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 16,000 PHP ($375), which will be used to further expand the business. Notably, this loan would be the fifth loan taken out by Marjorie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and it reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To further expand her business

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden R. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) and her primary source of income is derived from selling canned goods. Eden also sells detergent soap both bar and powder to local community members. She is a 45-year-old woman from the village of Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. Eden is married and has four school-age children. Eden has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month.

In 2009, Eden joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was better able to engage in business activities and, in turn, to improve her standard of living. Eden has recently successfully repaid a loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This prior loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Eden is now requesting another loan, also in the amount of 11,000 PHP ($250), which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase her working capital. Notably, this loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Eden from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory and increasing her working capital

loans.name: Nymph

texts.en:
Nymph C. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nymph owns and operates a clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of clothes both for kids and adults to local community members. Nymph has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Nymph joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Nymph is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her seventh from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Dinusha

texts.en:
Dinusha is a 29-year-old married woman living in Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka with her husband and one daughter. Dinusha is an active lady. Her husband is a driver for the Ceylon Transport Board. 

Dinusha has an agricultural cultivation, producing local leaves that are sold for daily consumption and often eaten with rice and curry in Sri Lanka. She has requested a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC which she will use to purchase fertilizer and chemicals for the cultivation. In addition to Dinusha and her family members working on the cultivation, they employ several other locals to help in running the business, which has now been in operation for 4 years. Eventually she hopes to expand her cultivation with high yards, and she hopes to continue to see success. Dinusha is known as a hard worker in her community and is hoping to develop her business further with this loan.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and chemicals for leaves and plants

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora P. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 59 years old. Leonora is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Leonora operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables, hot dogs and longanisa (pork sausage) in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Leonora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used for the same purpose. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris O. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling school bags, pack bags and shoulder bags. She also sells stationery papers, notebooks and pillows in her community. She is 28 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Magting, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. Iris has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Iris joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Iris has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to invest in expanding the business. Iris is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Daylyn

texts.en: Daylyn P. owns and operates a business venture selling mineral water and soft drinks to tourists and in the local community. She is 24 years old, married and has one small child. They are from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. Daylyn has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Daylyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Daylyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase products to sell. Daylyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana S. is from the village of Mabuhay, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Susana buys agricultural crops such as cassava and banana from their neighboring village and sells it in the city. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $80 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Susana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional crops and part was for working capital. 

Susana is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more cassava and banana to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and banana to sell

location.town: Mabuhay, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen R. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 32 years old. Helen is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she is currently engaged in a business where she buys bananas from the neighboring village and then sells them in the city. Helen has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $105 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. 

Helen is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more bananas to sell. This will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Champika

texts.en:
Champika is a 24-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and one son in the town of Hikkaduwa. She works hard and places her priority on operating her business. Her husband is a fisherman. Champika's business involves dehydrating fish, and she has a lot of experience with this type of business. She has been doing this business for two years. Currently, there is strong competition in her area for selling dry fish, because local customers place a strong demand for it as dry fish is one of the main foodstuffs eaten in the Sri Lankan diet. Champika's husband helps her by delivering and selling the fish to customers, which greatly helps the business.

Champika has requested a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka which she will use to buy raw materials and develop the business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Renuka

texts.en:
Renuka is a 36-year-old married woman living with her husband, three sons, and one daughter in the town of Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka. Her husband has a business in which he sells firewood made from rubber trees. Renuka works with her husband in this firewood-selling business. In addition to working together, they employ two others to help run the business, which has now been in operation for a few years. Renuka is a very active lady and she and her husband make a very good team in their business.

Renuka is seeking a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy rubber wood. They desiccate the rubber wood until it is dry enough to burn. Then they bundle the wood to sell as firewood to local customers. Every day Renuka's husband goes to town to selling this firewood. Eventually, she hopes to buy a new machine to help split and bundle the firewood.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase rubber wood

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan B. is a 36-year-old trader who sells seasonal vegetables in his small shop in Agsu city. He is married and his three children are the meaning for his life. Ruslan started his business in 1996 and step by step he earned enough to build his own shop. 

He is a very polite man and that is the reason for the success of his business. Ruslan applied for a loan of 900 AZN to increase the amount of merchandise he sells.

loans.use: To increase the amount of merchandise

loans.name: Zefer

texts.en:
Zefer M. is a 42-year-old man who breeds livestock in the small village of Saatli city. Zefer has been breeding cows for the last 20 years.  He uses the milk from the cows for his personal use and also sells the cattle for meat.

He is married and doing everything to make his wife happy as well as his two adorable daughters. Zefer applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN  to purchase three calves and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Yaver

texts.en: Yaver Q. is 34 years old, married and has two children. He is a trader who sells different kinds of goods such as macaroni, candy, chocolate, tea and cigarettes. Yaver has ten years' experience in this business and now is a very successful entrepreneur who knows how to manage his business for a good turnover. He has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase more foodstuffs to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Caminando Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Caminando hacia el Futuro”, está conformada por 9 miembros emprendedores quienes viven en la zona de Catalina Huanca, distrito de Ate, departamento de Lima, trabajan con EDAPROSPO-prosperidad desde hace 3 años y 4 meses.
Milagros quien es socia del grupo, tiene 34 años, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 3 años de edad., asume el cargo de presidenta recientemente. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de desayunos a los camioneros desde las 6 am., además realiza ventas de tamales a domicilio los fines de semana. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado comprar un frigider. El gran sueño de Milagros es poner una juguería.
El  préstamo otorgado será utilizado para la compra de una extractora, una licuadora y un escurridor de naranja para su negocio. Agradecen el apoyo brindado e iniciativa para su constitución como Alcancía Comunal y se prometen cumplir con los pagos establecidos en las fechas pactadas.
texts.en:
The "Walking Toward the Future" village bank is composed of 9 enterprising members who live in the Catalina Huanca zone, Ate district, of Lima, Peru. They have worked with EDAPROSPO for the past 3 years and 4 months. Milagros, a member of the group, is 34 years old and lives with her partner with whom she has 2 children, 3 and 13 years old. She recently became president of the group. For the past 4 years, she has worked selling breakfast to the truck drivers every morning at 6 am; she also sells tamales door to door on weekends. With her hard work, she has been able to purchase a fridge. She dreams of one day having a juice shop. The loan will be used to buy an extractor, a blender and an orange colander for her work. The members of the group are grateful for the support they are receiving and for the help they've received in forming the Village Bank; they commit to fulfill all their scheduled payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an extractor, a blender and an orange colander for the business

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
“La Nueva Esperanza”, es una alcancía comunal que se encuentra ubicada en la zona de San Gregorio, distrito de Ate, departamento de Lima,  conformado por 10 socios quienes se dedican a labores de servicio, comercio y producción minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 1 año y 6 meses.
Olga tiene 36 años, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, asume actualmente el cargo de presidenta.
Desde hace 12 años se dedica al trabajo de obrera y servicio doméstico, además recientemente se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia, ha arreglado su vivienda y mejorado la educación de su hijos. El gran sueño de Olga es tener un club de nutricionistas. El reciente préstamo será destinado para comprar mercadería.
Agradecen el financiamiento para sus actividades comerciales y seguirán cumpliendo con sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
The New Hope is a village bank located in the San Gregorio zone of the Ate district of Lima, Peru and is made up of 10 members who work in day labor, sales and retail; they have worked with EDAPROSPO for the past year and a half. Olga, a 36 year old who lives with her partner with whom she has 4 children, is the current president. For the past 12 years, she has worked as a housekeeper and recently began selling cosmetics through a catalogue; due to her hard work, she has been able to improve her family's standard of living. She has repaired her home and improved her children's education. Her dream is to have a nutritionist club. This loan will be used to purchase inventory to sell. The group members are grateful for the loans to finance their businesses and they will continue to fulfill their scheduled payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mariscal Caceres Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Mariscal Cáceres” se encuentra ubicada en la zona llamada Andrés Avelino Cáceres, en el distrito de Ate, departamento de Lima, está conformado por 14 socios, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 8 años. Sus miembros realizan diversas actividades de producción, comercio y servicio.
Eulogia quien a su vez asume el cargo de presidenta, tiene 45 años, es conviviente tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 17 años, se dedica a la venta de jugos como ambulante en un paradero de Ate, desde hace 10 años, además también realiza venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria Eulogia apoya en la educación de sus hijos, y casi todos sus ingresos lo destina en el pago de pensión de sus hijos. El gran sueño de Eulogia es tener su propio puesto de jugueria. El reciente préstamo lo utilizará en la compra de mercadería para su negocio.  
Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y están comprometidos a cumplir con los pagos según el cronograma otorgado por prosperidad. (En la foto hijos de los socios).
texts.en:
The Mariscal Caceres village bank is located in the Andres Avelino Caceres zone in the Ate district of Lima, Peru, and is composed of 14 members who have worked with EDAPROSPO for the past 8 years. The group members work in various fields including production, sales and services. Eulogia, the current president, is 45 years old and lives with her partner with whom she has 2 children who are 19 and 17 years old. She sells juices near a bus stop in Ate and has done so for 10 years; she also sells beauty products from a catalogue. Through Eulogia's efforts, she has supported her children's education and almost all her money goes to pay those expenses for her children. Her dream is to have her own juice stand. This loan will be used to buy inventory for the group members' businesses. All the members are grateful for the support they are receiving and are committed to making their payments on the scheduled dates.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for their businesses

loans.name: Las Divinas De La Union Group

texts.es:
“Las Divinas de la Unión”, es una alcancía comunal conformada por  7 miembros entusiastas y emprendedores, quienes tienen por afinidad realizar actividad informal dentro del comercio minorista, trabajan con  EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad, recientemente.
Virginia Angélica asume el cargo de presidenta, a sus 35 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos de  17, 11 y 7 años de edad. Desde hace 1 año se dedica a la venta de desayuno (reparte en los mercados), se inicio en este negocio por la necesidad que existe en su hogar, además para obtener mas ingresos realiza lavados de ropa en domicilios, todos los ingresos que recibe los invierte en la terapia de sus 2 hijas que son sordomudas, su gran sueño es que su hijo tenga una profesión (carrera universitaria), el  reciente préstamo será destinado para la compra de una carreta para su negocio y así poder movilizarse.  
Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado de los inversionistas y se comprometen a pagar en los plazos pactados.
texts.en:
The "Divine Women of the Union" is a village bank made up of 7 enthusiastic, enterprising members who work informally as retail salesmen; they recently began working with EDAPROSPO. Virginia Angelica, the current president, is 35 years old, married and has 3 children who are 7, 11, and 17 years old. For the past year, she has sold breakfast which she sells in the markets; she began the business due to the needs of her family. She also washes clothing in order to generate more income; she uses all her income to pay for therapy for her 2 daughters who are deaf and mute. Her dream is to help her son to graduate from college to have a better profession. This loan will be used to buy a cart for the business so she can be more mobile. All the group members are grateful for the support they are receiving and they commit to make their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cart to make business more mobile

loans.name: Activo De Vitarte Group

texts.es:
ACTIVO D. VITARTE

La alcancía comunal “Activos D. Vitarte”, está conformada por 8 socias quienes se desempeñan en labores D. comercio minorista e informal, trabajan con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 12 años y 6 meses, sin duda es el grupo más antiguo D. la institución.
Constanza, mujer emprendedora y entusiasta, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta, tiene 60 años,  es viuda y tiene 4 hijos.
DesD. hace 6 años se dedica a la conversión D. gas llamado “BUBACAR SERVICE”, negocio que ha logrado poner con sus hijos. Con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria ha logrado aumentar más locales para su negocio, su gran sueño es seguir creciendo como empresaria.
El reciente préstamo, Constanza lo destinará en la compra D. mercadería (tanques, repuestos para carros) y así diversificar sus productos para cubrir la demanda D. sus clientes. Agradecen el financiamiento para sus actividades comerciales y seguirán cumpliendo con sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
The "Activo D. Vitarte" village bank is maD. up of 8 members who work in retail sales and have worked with EDAPROSPO for the past 12 and a half years; it is undoubtedly the oldest group that has worked with our institution. Constanza, the current president, is a very enterprising, enthusiastic woman who is a 60 year old widow with 4 children. For the past 6 years, she has worked in a gas conversion business called Bubacar Service; the business has helped her to support her children. Due to her labors, she has increased the number of storefronts of her business; her dream is to continue to grow her business. This loan will be used to buy inventory (tanks, replacement parts, etc.) and to diversify her products to meet her customers' demand. The group members are grateful for the loans to finance their businesses and they commit to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory (tanks, car replacement parts)

loans.name: Indalecia

texts.es: Indalecia es una abnegada mujer D. 62 años, vive en su casa propia a lado D. su esposo Leonardo D. 65 años y sus hijos que son mayores e independientes. Hace más D. 5 años se dedica a la venta D. productos energéticos D. una reconocida marca, ofreciendo familiares y amigos. En un inicio empezó con la venta D. jugos, preparando solo por pedido, aunque sigo realizando este trabajo, pero esta vez lo complementa con al venta D. productos Herbalife. DesD. entonces, Indalecia ofrece este producto, manifestando todos los beneficios que tiene así como recomendando al cliente cual es el más adecuado a su necesidad. Para ella disfruta mucho D. este trabajo y D. las ganancias que obtiene lo deriva para su propia manutención, además el sueldo D. su esposo, ayuda con los ahorros futuros y dejarles más adelante como una herencias a sus hijos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser tan puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, servirá para abastecer D. más productos para venderlos en estas próximas fechas del día D. la madre, pues ella cree que no hay mejor regalo que mejorar la salud.
texts.en:
Indalecia is a selfless woman who is 62 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband Leonardo, 65, and their children who are adult and independent. She has been selling a well-known brand of energy products for more than 5 years to friends and acquaintances. At first she started selling juices, preparing them only to order. Although she continues with this business, she now also sells Herbalife products. Indalecia now offers these products, demonstrating all of the benefits they proviD. and recommending the products most suited to the needs of each customer. She enjoys this work very much. With the earnings she gets from the business she can support herself and, along with the salary of her husband, help to save for the future so that they can leave an inheritance for their children. This is her second loan with MFP, and she pledges to be on time with her payments. With the loan she requests she will restock her business with more products, so that she can sell them for the upcoming Mother's Day, because she believes that there is no better gift than one that improves one's health.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: energy products

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita tiene 52 años, la comparte su vida con sus dos  hijas: Julia y Fanny de 24 y 20 años respectivamente. Todas ellas viven juntas en su casa propia. Hace más de 9 años instaló su propia guardería para niños, llamado “suspiritos”, lo cual ha significado su principal fuente de ingreso. Desde entonces, su actividad empieza, desde muy temprano decepcionando a las madres que dejan a sus hijos al cuidado de Felicita, ella durante el día educa a estos infantes hasta la hora en que llegan sus madres a recogerlo. Su mayor es poder ofrecerles a los niños mejor comodidad además de juegos para que su tiempo en la guardería sea de mucho provecho, estimulando su aprendizaje. En ocasiones su hija la ayuda en esta labor, es por ello que se esta forjando como profesora de educación inicial, por lo tanto Felicita se siente muy bien asesorada por su hija. Por lo pronto desea ampliar su guardería, para que sea lo más confortable para los pequeños. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar gras artificial para su jardín así como comprar juegos como columpios y toboganes.
texts.en:
Felicita, age 52, shares her life with her two daughters. Julia is 24, and Fanny is 20. They all work together in her own house. Over nine years ago she set up her own childcare center called Susperitos. This has been her main source of income. She starts very early taking care of the children that the mothers leave in Felicita’s care. During the day she educates the children until the time when their mothers arrive to pick them up. Her biggest desire is to make the children more comfortable. She also wants to provide them with more games so that their time in childcare is very beneficial and will stimulate their learning. At times her daughter helps her with this work. That is why she is learning to be an early childhood education teacher. Felicita feels very well advised by her daughter. Soon she wants to expand her childcare so that the little ones will be more comfortable. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has always been punctual with her payments. She wishes to use the loan to buy artificial grass for her nursery school. She also wants to buy games like swings and slides.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy articial grass, games, and swings for the children

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un hombre muy emprendedor, él  tiene 41 años y comparte su vida con su pareja y sus dos hijos. Todos elL. viven en su casa propia. Hace más D. 5 años se dedica en la venta D. productos necesarios para el consumo humano, es por ello que tiene una panadería y tienda a la vez, instalada en un espacio dentro D. su domicilio. La venta D. sus productos y panes es buena, debido al gran empeño que le pone todas las mañanas, desD. que amanece, preparando L. panes suficientes para abastecer a sus clientes.  Es así que sus clientes acuden a su establecimiento a comprar el pan ya listo, sacado del horno y que además consumen otros productos alimenticios que acompañan al desayuno como: leche, yogurt, salchichas entre otros, generándole buenas ganancias. Juan se siente muy contento con el trabajo que realiza, por tal motivo tiene planeado comprar mejores instrumentos y herramientas para facilitar la preparación del pan. Según manifiesta, todo esfuerzo es valido, con tal D. sacar adelante a su familia. Este  su primer préstamo en MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos L. pagos D. las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en ingredientes para la preparación D. sus panes además D. mercadería para abastecer su tienda, con lo cual espera obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan is an enterprising man who is 41 years old, and shares his life with his partner and their 2 children. They all live together in their own home. For more than 5 years he has been selling products necessary for human consumption. He has a bakery/store installed in a part of his house. The sale of his products and bread is good, due to the great effort he puts into the business. Every morning at dawn he is preparing the bread needed to satisfy the demand of his customers. For this reason his customers come to his establishment to buy the bread, fresh out of the oven, and they also consume other breakfast food products such as: milk, yogurt, and sausages, among others, generating good earnings. Juan feels very content with the work that he does, and for this reason he has plans to buy better utensils and tools to expedite the making of bread. As he says, every effort is valid, as long as it helps the family to get ahead. This is his first loan with MFP, and he pledges to be very punctual with each of his payments. With the loan he requests, he will invest in ingredients needed to make bread and he will also restock his store with merchandise, thus hoping to obtain good earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread, and to restock his store

loans.name: Gloria Janeth

texts.es:
Gloria T. de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral (lugar muy humilde con casas ya regeneradas y rodeadas de un estero) de Guayaquil. Su esposo es comerciante, ellos tiene dos hijas de 23 y 3 años. 

Gloria por la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio invirtió sus ahorros en la adecuación de su casa y construyo la parte delantera en un local (es muy común que en las casas de Ecuador construyan locales para negocios y también vivan hay mismo) también compro algunos víveres y empezó a venderlos.

Por la buena decisión que tomo ahora tiene una tienda, tambien Gloria puso en la tienda unas cabinas telefónicas para que su hija de 23 años le ayude. Ellas trabajan desde las 07:00 am hasta las 20:00 pm todos los días. Uno de los problemas que tiene y le dificultan trabajar es la presión inestable que tiene en su cuerpo.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar azúcar, arroz y bebidas para su negocio y así tener dinero para darle mejor vida a su familia. En el futuro quiere tener un local de fotocopiadoras.
texts.en:
Gloria T. is 43 years old and lives in a semi urban area in the outskirts of Guayaquil in a very poor area of reclaimed houses surrounded by a stream. Her husband is a merchant and they have two daughters ages 23 and 3.

Gloria had the idea to have her own business so she used their savings to alter their house and construct an area for a business in the front. It is very common for houses in Ecuador to have both space for a business and also living spaces. She also used her savings to buy some food and began selling it.

Because of this good decision, she now has a store where she recently installed telephone booths which her 23 year old daughter helps her with. They work from 7 in the morning until 10 at night every day. She has unstable blood pressure which makes it difficult for her to work.

With this loan she wants to buy sugar, rice, and drinks for her business which will allow her to make more money and give her family a better life. In the future she wants to have a photocopy store.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: rice, sugar, drinks

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina tiene 27 años, ella comparte su vida con José D. 28 y su pequeña hija Dayana D. 3 años D. edad. Todos ellos son muy unidos y viven juntos en su casa propia. Hace más D. 2 años se dedica la venta D. productos D. belleza D. reconocidas marcas, su modo D. trabajo consiste en solicitar pedidos a estas empresas cuando estos productos están D. oferta y luego vender a los clientes al precio original, logrando acumular un poco más D. ganancias. A Karina le gusta su trabajo porque le da el tiempo necesario para dedicárselo a su hija, quien necesita D. sus cuidados. Mas adelante desea instalar un bazar en el interior D. un mercado D. su zona, ya que sería conveniente por lo que hay mayor concurrencia D. personas. Sabe que tiene mucho camino por recorrer, por ello debe esforzarse mucho en su negocio para alcanzar el bienestar D. su familia. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos los pagos D. las cuotas. El crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. mayor cantidad D. productos para estas próximas fiestas, en donD. asegura que sus ventas serán muy buenas.
texts.en:
Karina is 27 years old, and she shares her life with José, who is 28,and her little daughter Dayana, who is 3 years old. The three of them are strongly united, and they live together in their own house. For more than two years Karina has worked selling name brand beauty products. She works by ordering products from businesses when they are on sale, then later re-selling those products to her customers at the original price, achieving a small profit that accumulates with each sale. Karina enjoys her work because it allows her the time she needs to spend with her daughter, who still requires her mother's care. In the future Karina hopes to set up a small shop insiD. a regional market in her area, where the greater traffic of customers would be better for her business. She knows that she has a long road to travel until she can reach this goal, and because of this she works very hard at her business, so that she may be able to achieve well-being for her family. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she promises to be very punctual in all of her payments. She will use the loan which she requests to purchase a greater quantity of beauty products before the upcoming festivities, during which her sales are certain to be very good.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar productos de belleza.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilú tiene 37 años, ella esta separada de su pareja, solo vive con sus hijos Katerin de15, Milagros de 13 y Álvaro de 04 años. Todos ellos viven juntos en su casa propia. Hace más de 5 meses se dedica la venta de comida, en un pequeño puesto que se encuentra ubicado en la parte exterior de su domicilio, ofreciendo gran variedad de platillos como anticuchos, parrilla de pollo, salchichas, entre otros. Es así que su buena sazón es degustado por sus fieles clientes que la visitan frecuentemente a su establecimiento. En un inicio repartía almuerzos a domicilio, pues los clientes le solicitaban de su servicio, sin embargo tuvo que dejar este ritmo de trabajo por la falta de capital. Ahora este negocio le resulta muy gratificante puesto que solo de dedica durante las tardes hasta las 10 de la noche, dándole tiempo en las mañanas para dedicarse a las labores del hogar. En un futuro Marilú quiere hacer crecer su negocio, como tener un restaurante, pero sabe que para eso aún le hace falta más capital y una mejor infraestructura, por no dejará de trabajar arduamente con tal de conseguir su meta. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar algunos utensilios de cocina que le hacen falta e ingredientes para preparar sus paltillos.
texts.en:
Marilu is 37 years old. She is separated from her partner and lives alone with her children, Katerin who is 15, Milagros who is 13, and Alvaro who is 4. They all live together in their own home. It has been 5 months since she started selling from a small stand outside her house, offering a variety of dishes such as kebabs, grilled chicken, sausage and others. It is so well seasoned that it is much enjoyed by her loyal customers who frequently come to visit her establishment. In the beginning she offered home delivery of lunches, because the customers asked for this service, however she could not continue working at this pace due to lack of capital. Now her business is very gratifying because she only has to work in the afternoons until 10pm, giving her time in the mornings to perform household chores. In the future Marilu want to make her business grow so as to have her own restaurant, but she knows that she needs more capital and a better infrastructure, but she will not stop working hard to reach her goal. This is her fourth loan cycle with MFP and she is committed to being punctual with her payments. With the loan, she wants to buy some cooking utensils that she needs to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and ingredients to prepare menu items.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra tiene 50 años, ella vive con su hija Sandra de 25 años, quien es su compañera y su motivo para salir adelante. Viven juntas en su casa propia. Hace más de 7 meses se dedica la venta de comida en un restaurante que instaló en su propio domicilio. Según manifiesta, comenzó hace algunos años atrás, cuando su establecimiento era de esteras, con el pasar D. tiempo, formó su propio puesto de comida, en el actualmente tiene ahora su restaurante. Sin embargo, tuvo que regresar a su tierra natal, ubicada al norte D. país, debido por la enfermedad de su padre, a quien tuvo que cuidar hasta su muerte. Posteriormente regreso a la ciudad de Lima para retomar su trabajo y ahora tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. La gran mayoría D. tiempo, su hija la ayuda en el negocio y poco a poco han logrado levantarlo. La buena sazón que tiene, fue motivo de sobra para que su establecimiento sea tan visitado, ya que ella prepara variedad de platillos al gusto D. cliente, además de la venta de algunas bebidas que complementan su servicio. En un futuro quiere que su restaurante sea amplio y bien equipado. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, desea implementar su negocio comprando un juego de sillas y mesas y además ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Sandra is 50 years old and lives with her daughter, Sandra, who is 25 and who is her partner and motive to succeed. They live together in their own home. For more than 7 months she has been selling food in a restaurant that she installed in her own house. According to the manifest, she started some years ago, when her establishment consisted of rush mats. With the passage of time, she formed her own food stall and now she has her own restaurant. However, she had to return to her native land, located north of the country, due to the illness of her father, to care for him until his death. After that she returned to Lima to work and is now eager to get ahead. The vast majority of the time her daughter helps with the business, and little by little, they have succeeded in raising themselves up. The great seasoning that her food has is the reason that so many people visit her restaurant. She prepares a variety of dishes to suit the customers as well as some beverages that complement her service. In the future she wants her restaurant to be large and well-equipped. This is her fourth loan cycle with MFP and she is committed to being punctual in all her payments. With the loan she wants to improve the business by purchasing a set of tables and chairs, plus ingredients to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a set of tables and chairs for the restaurant

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora, comparte su vida con su esposo Hernán D. 44, quien es taxista y sus dos hijas, Zoila y Cecilia D. 16 y 4 años respectivamente. Todos  juntos viven en su casa propia. DesD. hace algunos años tiene su propia botica, servicio que instaló con ayuda D. unas monjas, quienes le dieron la oportunidad D. tener un negocio y un trabajo en su barrio, por ser el único que venD. este rubro, resultándole muy rentable. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le da tiempo D. cuidar sus hijos. En ocasiones su esposo Hernán la apoya con las labores del hogar, por lo que han demostrado ser una familia muy unida. Ella tiene anhelos D. salir adelante ampliando su negocio, pero para eso debe construir su casa D. material noble y brindarle un mayor espacio a su botica, ella sabe que aún le falta camino por recorrer pero no se amilana  al contrario seguirá trabajando hasta alcanzar su meta. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos los pagos D. las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá para traer mayor cantidad D. productos y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sara is 45 years of age and is a very enterprising woman. She shares her life with her husband, Hernan (44 years of age), who is a taxi driver and her two daughters, Cecilia (16) and Zoila (4). Together they live in their own home. For some years now, Sara has run her own pharmacy - a service installed in her home, with the help of some nuns - who gave her the opportunity to have this business in their neighborhood. Being the only person who sells pharmaceutical products, has been very profitable. She loves her work because it gives her time to care for their children. Sometimes her husband Hernán helps with the the housework, and this has helped make them a very close family. Sara has hopes of expanding her business, which will help her succeed, however, in order to do that, she will need to build onto her existing house with good quality materials. Making these changes will proviD. more space for the pharmacy. She knows she has a long way to go, but isn't daunted by the tasks ahead and still works hard to meet her goals. This is her third loan with MFP and promises to be very punctual in the re-payment of the installments. She plans to use the requested loan to purchase more products and increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar productos medicinales.  (to purchase pharmaceutical products and inventory)

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda, a 44-year-old married woman from South Cotabato, Philippines, has three children, the eldest aged 21. In 2008, she started her hog-raising business and is also an Avon dealer. Erlinda says that she works hard because she wants her family to be happy. She wants to be able to provide for all the needs in her household, especially her children’s education. Erlinda is requesting a loan of Php15,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy feed for her pigs and hopefully an additional piglet to raise.

loans.use: Additional piglet and feed

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, a diligent woman, is 40 years old, married and has four children. She has a rice farm which her husband mostly focuses on. She assists him in making the farm productive. The majority of Judith's time is spent running their sari-sari store and making sure her children are fed. She also recently started to raise goats. She hopes to succeed in her ventures and have all her children finish their schooling.

Judith, who became a member of CEVI in 2008, says that her loans have been really helpful in maintaining her rice farm and sari-sari store. She is also thankful that out of her income, she was able to acquire goats to raise. Now applying for a loan of Php 15,000 to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies, Judith will also add merchandise to her store and hopes to buy another goat.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Judylee

texts.en: Judylee owns a ½ hectare rice field, three pigs and also a small sari-sari store. She also raises some chickens. Having three children who go to school, Judylee does her best to help her husband provide for their family’s needs and send their children to school. She joined CEVI in 2008 to gain financial support for her businesses. She says that CEVI's program is really helpful to entrepreneurs like her. She also likes its insurance program. She recently applied for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). If granted, she will use it to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. She will also buy feed for the pigs and chickens and also add merchandise to the sari-sari store.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies, feed and additional merchandise

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta loves dressmaking and is now able to earn from her hobby. She is 51 years old and married to Sergio. They are blessed with four children; the eldest is aged 25. 

Julieta has 1/2 hectare of land planted with rice, which her husband mainly manages. She raises pigs and focuses on her tailoring. She says that her loans from CEVI have helped a lot in her projects. She also has been helped by its insurance policy. She is now applying for a loan of Php 15, 000. She will use it to supply the rice farm with seed, fertilizer and other supplies. She will also buy feed for her pigs and acquire tailoring materials.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a rice farm and to raise pigs

loans.name: Luz Rene

texts.en:
Luz is married to Ronilo. They have three children; the oldest is 18 years old. Luz works in rice farming, and she currently owns three hectares of rice fields. She also has some pigs that she raises and sells. Luz works hard to help sustain her family. She hopes that all her children will finish college and find stable jobs.

Luz would like to request a loan of Php 15,000, which she will use to buy fertilizer and other farm necessities. She will also acquire feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy farm Supplies

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly joined CEVI in 2008 because she was in need of additional capital for her farm. She says that her loans were really helpful in maintaining her farm. With her income, she was able to open a sari-sari store at the front of her house. She aims to start raising pigs next so she can have another source of income. She wants her family to be happy and satisfied. Nelly is requesting to borrow 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) that she will use to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. She will also add merchandise to her store and, hopefully, she will also be able to acquire piglets that she’ll raise.

loans.use: For farm inputs and additional store merchandise

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.es: Veneranda tiene 46 años, ella comparte su vida con Edmundo y sus hijos Emily y Eder de 22 y 20 años respectivamente. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace algunos años se dedica en la venta de salchipapas (plato popular elaborado a base de salchichas y papas fritas), paralelo a ello, ha emprendido un nuevo negocio, que es la venta de CD musicales, por lo que espera tener un poco más de ingresos económicos, adicional a la venta de comida.  Ahora compró y habilitó dos estantes de madera para colocar los CD musicales y de películas para su mejor apreciación, por lo que esta entusiasmada y asegura que le ira bien este negocio. Además cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, quienes la apoyan con la venta. En un futuro desea instalar un gran local, en donde pueda vender comida e instalar un bazar, para ofrecer productos variados y los CD que vende también. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y espera ser tan puntual como lo fue en sus anteriores créditos. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar CD y también ingredientes y productos para preparar salchipapas.
texts.en:
Veneranda is 46 years old and shares her life with Edmundo and her children Emily and Eder, age 22 and 20 respectively. They live together in their own home. Some years ago, Veneranda began selling “salchipapas,” a popular plate made of sausage and fried potatoes. Parallel to this, she has started a new business, selling musical CDs, and expects a bit more income, to add to her earnings from selling meals. Now she has purchased and customized 2 wooden stands to display musical and film CDs, so they can be better appreciated and generate enthusiasm, assuring that the business will go well. In addition, she can count on the help of her children in sales. In the future, she wants to install a larger store to sell food, and to install a market that will offer varied products, plus the CDs that she also sells. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she hopes to be as punctual and she was in repaying her previous loans. With the requested loan, she wants to buy CDs, plus products and ingredients for preparing “salchipapas.”

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING VARIOUS MUSICAL AND FILM CDs & INGREDIENTS FOR MEALS

loans.name: Eidencia

texts.es: Eidencia tiene 40 años, vive con sus hijos Jessica de 22 años, Elsiza de 18 años, Nildo de 13 años, Denilson de 12 y Tatiana de 5 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia. Desde que era muy pequeña aprendió todos los trucos y habilidades para tejer bonitas prendas, actividad que actualmente realiza para mantener a su familia. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo, porque puede disponer del tiempo para realizar esta actividad, ahora contratan su servicio, para que realice la cantidad necesaria de prendas en una fecha determinada, es por ello que veces trabaja de noche, mientras que en las mañanas atiende a sus hijos. Todos los tejidos que elabora son exportados hacia otros países, como China, por tal motivo, su trabajo es muy agotador, ya que debe tejer de 10 a 25 chompas. Es así que lleva 11 años de trabajo, ganando experiencia y perseverancia y espera con el tiempo poner un negocio más estable, como instalar una puesto en un mercado muy concurrido; aunque hace algunos años intento hacerlo, vendiendo productos comestibles en su casa, sin embargo no funcionó, ya que la zona en la que vive no era muy concurrida, pero espera tener suerte esta vez. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar material para sus tejidos y poder ganar más y ahorrar y obtener una maquina que le facilite y ahorre tiempo en el tejido.
texts.en:
Eidencia is 40 years old. She lives in her own home with her children Jessica, age 22, Elsiza, age 18, Nildo, age 13, Denilson, age 12, and Tatiana, age 5. Since the time she was very young, Eidencia has learned the craft of knitting beautiful clothes, including all the tricks of the trade. Now she uses these skills to support her family. Eidencia really likes her work because it allows her to manage her own time; her services are now in demand, and she has contracts that request predetermined quantities of her products by a certain date. To get it done, Eidencia sometimes works nights, and in the morning takes care of her children. All the products she makes are exported to other countries, for example China, and making them is quite tiring since she has to knit 10 to 25 sweaters. Eidencia has been working this way for eleven years, gaining in experience and perseverance and hopes that, with time, she'll be able to develop a more established business - for instance, she would like to have a vending post in a well-attended marketplace. She already tried to do this several years ago, trying to sell groceries from her home, but it wasn't successful since the area where she lives didn't have a lot of customers. However, Eidencia hopes that next time it will work out. This is her first loan with MFP, and Eidencia is committed to be timely with her repayments. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials for her knitting; she hopes to earn more and save more and purchase a weaving machine that would allow her to use time more effectively in her knitting.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for knitting

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa C. is from the village of Brgy. 25, Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old. Teresa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Teresa runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and to increase her working capital. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Teresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Mrs. S., 34, is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables in the village, in a commune of Phnom Penh City. She has been growing crops since 2006. She is married and lives with her husband and three children. All of her children are students. Her husband is a financial earner who works in the construction field. S. faces some problems: her old house is broken which has affected the family’s living conditions. Because of that, S. is looking for a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house.

Milagros is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Milagros from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family.

loans.name: Gladis Karina

texts.es:
Gladis C. de 32 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín (lugar muy humilde, con casas de caña, caminos montañosos y calles de tierra) de Guayaquil. Su casa es mixta de cemento y caña solo cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básico.  Esta separada de su esposo y tiene que mantener a sus dos hijas de 15 y 9 años de edad.

Gladis tenia hace 11 años atrás un puesto de comidas en el mercado “Pedro Pablo Gómez” (lugar donde hay muchos comerciantes informales) de Guayaquil. Pero por políticas del Gobierno la echaron de ese lugar y tuvo que readecuar su casa para ubicar su pequeño puesto de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa.

Por esa buena decisión ahora tiene una tienda surtida con legumbres, pañales, arroz etc. Su horario de trabajo es desde las 05:30 am hasta el anochecer. La tienda es el único ingreso económico que tiene ella y sus hijas por eso quiere surtir más su tienda. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, bebidas y recargas para un nuevo servicio de celulares.

En el futuro quiere mejorar mejor su casa y que sus hijas terminen todos sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gladis is 32 years old, and lives in El Fortín, a humble place, with houses of cane, mountainous roads and dirt streets, on the outskirts of Guayaquil. Her house is a mixture of concrete and cane and has only water and lights as basic services. She is separated from her husband and has to maintain her 2 daughters, aged 15 and 9. Eleven years ago, Gladis had a stall selling meals in Guayaquil's Pedro Pablo Gómez Market, a location with many informal merchants. But due to changes in government policy, they were thrown out and she had to modify her house to include her small provisions store in the back. Due to this good decision now she has a store supplied with vegetables, diapers, rice, etc. Her work schedule is from 5:30 am until dark. The store is the only source of income for Gladis and her girls, and for that reason, she wants to expand her merchandise. With this loan she intends to buy rice, drinks, and rechargers for a new cellular service. In the future, she wishes to improve her house and assure that her daughters finish all their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING RICE, DRINKS, AND TELEPHONE RECHARGERS FOR HER STORE

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 53 años, ella vive sola en su casa que es propia, tiene una hija, quien es mayor de edad, casada e independiente. Hace más de 16 años, se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza de diversas marcas competitivas en el mercado, por lo que es líder y promotora de belleza en una de estas líneas, en ella organiza a un grupo de personas, preparándolas y asesorándolas para que realicen buenas ventas. De esta forma recibe varios incentivos por el esfuerzo y trabajo que ejerce, como regalos en productos y como buena comerciante, estos productos lo vende. Ella se siente muy feliz con la actividad que hace, es por ello que le dedica todo el día salvo los momentos que debe atender su casa. Su mayor anhelo es seguir mejorando en su negocio, por lo que espera tener un establecimiento propio, para ofertar su mercadería, por lo pronto se encuentra cómoda en el modo en que trabaja. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos para tenerlos en stock y así obtener buenas ventas en esta campaña por el día de la madre.
texts.en:
Gloria is 53 years old, and she lives alone in her own house. She has a grown daughter who is married and independent. For over 16 years she has been selling beauty products from various brands that are competitive in the market. She is a leader and a beauty promoter in one of these lines. She organizes a group of people for that line. She prepares them and advises them so that they get good sales. This way she receives various incentives for her effort and the work she does. She gets products as gifts. Like a good merchant, she sells them. She is very happy with the work she does. That is why she devotes herself to it all day, except for the time she needs to take care of her house. Her biggest wish is to keep working in her business. She hopes to have her own establishment in which to sell her merchandise and to feel comfortable in her work. This is her first loan with MFP. She promises to make all of her payments on time. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy products to have in stock. That way she will have good sales during this Mother’s Day season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more beauty products

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en: Mrs. Khoem P., 43, produces and sells cakes. She lives with her four children. Another two of her chidren have ready married and live independently. She became a cake seller in 2005, a skill she learned from a nearby neighbor. One of her sons is working as a taxi driver. Khoem P. was married but divorced her husband years ago. She is a hardworking woman and a determined citizen who triesto earn money to solve all of her family's financial crises. Because Khoem P.’s house has broken down, the family’s living conditions have been affected. Khoem P. will be using her first loan to mend her old house. Any remaining money from the loan will be used to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To mend her old house.

texts.en: Kimberly Ann A. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Kimberly Ann is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Kimberly Ann makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from peddling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Kimberly Ann has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Kimberly Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kimberly Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Kimberly Ann is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to increase her working capital, thereby allowing her to cook more and sell more snack foods. This will be the second loan taken out by Kimberly Ann from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Kek

texts.en:
Mr. Kek T. is a 26-year-old married man. (He was not available for photographing, so his wife is pictured instead). Kek T. works very hard raising ducks in his village and typically earns around $4 per day. He built a medium cage next to his house in which he breeds many ducks for eggs and for sale. He has two small kids who are not enrolled in school. He has another financial earner in his wife, who is a vegetable seller in the market. 

Kek T. hopes to operate another business for extra income, but he has not been able to do it because he doesn’t have money. Kek T. decided to seek a Kiva loan through HKL. He will use the loan to buy a cultivating machine, which will enable him to provide plowing services to farmers for a fee.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine

loans.name: Angelina's Group

While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fresh fish in the local community. Angelina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin Y., 65, is a local crop farmer who lives in a rural commune in Phnom Penh Capital. In addition to her crops, she raises a few pigs in a small pigpen. 

Sin Y. is a widow who is blessed with 2 children. Both are married and live at home. She also depends on the income from her daughter who is a garment worker. 

Sin Y. faces difficulties irrigating her crop as the watering system is far from her farm, so she is taking out a loan to buy a water pump. She will use the remaining cash from the loan to buy fertilizer to increase the yield of her crops.

loans.use: To buy a water pump

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING MORE DECORATIVE ITEMS OF PLASTER TO SELL FOR MOTHERS DAY

Edeltrudes owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells firewood & charcoal. Edeltrudes has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Edeltrudes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Edeltrudes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to increase her working capital. Edeltrudes is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Edeltrudes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income.
