loans.name: Kek

texts.en:
Mr. Kek T., 27, is the father of a lovely, young child who is not yet enrolled in school and who is dependent on him. He is married to Thai Lek, 29, who works as a seamstress in the garment industry.  

Kek T. is a local farmer who plants rice and vegetables on the land that he received from his parents. Kek T. lacks some accessories that he needs to support him in his farming. Thus, he is applying for a Kiva loan of $800 to buy insecticide, fertilizer, crop seeds and a pump for his farm. 

Note: Mr. Kek T. was not available when the photo taken so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy insecticide, fertilizer, crop seeds and a pump

loans.name: Mercie

texts.en:
Mercie C. is from the village of Bonifacio. She is 40 years old. Mercie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercie owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as candies, some food for snacks, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Mercie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately PHP 10,000 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mercie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercie has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC. Mercie is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Mercie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en:
Bayanjargal, 51, lives with her husband and four daughters in Hovd province, Mongolia, in an apartment. Her oldest daughter attends a university and her youngest two daughters attend a local secondary school.

Bayanjargal operates a meat trading business at a local food market. She has been operating her business since 2000 and has built a stable operation. The whole family supports her business and they have been planning to grow their business in future.

She has been paying her daughter's university fee with her earnings and providing money for her family expenses. Bayanjargal says, “I am working hard to provide good educations for my four daughters.”

She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase meat at wholesales price because demand is high in spring time.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita S. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. She is 55 years old and widowed. Teresita owns and operates a specialized retail store selling flowers in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more copra to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more copra to sell

loans.name: Altansuh

texts.en:
Altansuh D., 29, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent) in a yard belonging to his parents-in-law.

Altansuh operates a stationary trading business at Narantuul, the international trading center. He sells books, a variety of stationery, and other products from a good location just next to the main entrance to the market. He has been operating his business with his wife since 2004.

Altansuh and his wife are expecting a new baby, and his wife has been staying at home with their 3 year old son. Altansuh is a very hardworking and enthusiastic person.  He says, “I would like to expand my business. My responsibility has increased since my wife became pregnant.”

He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1430 USD) loan to purchase balls and other small products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita V. is from the village of Sta. Ana Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Rosita is married and has 2 school-aged children. Rosita owns & operates a business selling seafood such as fish in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: 16.05.01 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
"Sáu N. Thị (1) is a 50-year-old female who lives in the town of Thanh Hóa.  Sáu is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 16.05.01 Đông Hải (16.05.01 Đông Hải).


Sáu is married and has 2 adult children. She owns & operates a butcher shop where she mainly butchers & sells pork to the local community. Sáu has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month.


In 2004, Sáu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Sáu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Sau from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to make improvements to her house.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. Thị Lệ (49) is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her general store.


2.  H. Thị Dung (48) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


3.  N. Thị Chung (30) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her food making & selling business.


4.  N. Thị Hiếu (4) is a 41 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her general store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Sáu N. Thị (1) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa.  Sáu là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 16.05.01 Đông Hải (16.05.01 Đông Hải).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Sáu thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Sáu kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2004, Sáu đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Sáu đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. Thị Lệ (49) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  H. Thị Dung (48) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


3.  N. Thị Chung (30) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


4.  N. Thị Hiếu (4) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok Y., 64, is an old, village woman who lives in a rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is a vegetable seller. She buys vegetables from farmers and delivers them to the market for sale. Sok Y. has three children; one of them is married and the other two are single. To help meet the family's daily expenses, one of her children works for a company. Sok Y. has a life-partner in her husband who is an older man who can’t earn money. 


Sok Y. will use her first loan to purchase a motorbike which will enable her children to ride to work and elsewhere. The motorbike will mean lower expenses because the family will be able to get around without paying for taxis.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en:
Chuluuntsetseg Z. is a 35 year old widow who lives with her mother and 2-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has lived with her elderly mother since her husband's passing. 


Chuluuntsetseg earns her living by selling women's underwear at Narantuul, one of Mongolia's largest markets. She purchases her products cheaply in China and resells them at her counter. Chuluuntsetseg has been operating her business since 2005 and has gained significant experience over the past five years. Her working capital is currently 800,000 tugrugs. Chuluuntsetseg has been planning to expand her market stall. She also plans to repair her family home. She works very hard to provide a better life for her son and mother. Chuluuntsetseg says, “I would like to purchase another counter for my business”. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of women's underwear at wholesales price to resell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie C. is from the village of Tambagan, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Rosie is married and has 2 school-aged children. Rosie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food & daily-use products. She is also selling/renting cellphones and prepaid cards. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & to provide working capital. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Rosie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Danshii

texts.en:
Danshii C., 54, lives with her husband and son in an apartment in Hovd province, Mongolia.

Danshii operates a small retail kiosk from her yard. She sells consumer goods and food products.  She has been operating her business since 2006, and her entire family supports her business. Her 23-year-old son works in a brick factory in all seasons, besides winter, and contributes money towards family finances.

Danshii does not yet have much working capital, so her profits remain low. Besides her kiosk, she has been planning to grow vegetables in her yard to earn extra income. She planted her first batch of vegetables last year.

Danshii is a hardworking person and is focused on the future. She is requesting a 200,000 tugrug loan to purchase additional products for her kiosk as well as vegetable seeds.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her kiosk and vegetable seeds to grow

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sorn P., 50, has been planting a variety of crops on farmland he owns and typically earns around US$4 per day. He lives in a commune in Phnom Penh, the capital, with his wife and their two children, while another two children are married and live separately. His wife, Mrs. Noun Ly, 50, who appears in the photo, is a farmer who grows rice for a living.

To increase his family's income, Sorn P. wants to improve his farming business, but he lacks capital. Hence, he would like to request a loan of US$800. With the loan, he will buy a couple of cows to help plow the farmland, as well as buy fertilizer, insecticide, and crop seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy a couple of cows as well as seed, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Francacio

texts.en:
Francacio G. is from the village of Tuburan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is 56 years old and is single. Francacio owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Francacio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Francacio is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his sixth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Deelika

texts.en:
Deelika is a 28-year-old married woman living with her husband and one child in Hikkaduwa, southern Sri Lanka.

Deelika and her husband manage and run a fish-selling business in their village. The income they receive from the business helps to pay the family's day-to-day expenses. They started this fish-selling business fifteen years ago, and the income it has provided has helped to educate their child, on top of paying daily expenses.

Deelika is a very hard worker and helps out other members in the village whenever the opportunity arises.

Deelika is asking for a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help expand her business. Her business has a good location within the village and her business has lots of fish, which she hopes to expand with the help of this loan. Her customer base seems to be growing so she hopes this loan will help her expand further.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy some materials for her fish-selling business

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en: Charlita J. is from the village of Talisay, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Charlita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Charlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Charlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mr. Sok S. is a married man, 36 years old, and works very hard as a motor-taxi driver. He has a life partner in his wife who is shown in the photo here. She is a seamstress who provides a sewing service from home. The couple has four children, two of whom are married while the others are single. To help be responsible for the family, two of the daughters are employed as tailors.

Sok S. is taking out his loan to pay the fee to connect a new electricity line.

loans.use: To pay the fee to connect a new electricity line

loans.name: Agatona

texts.en: Agatona Q. is from the village of Talisay, Gingoog City. She is 39 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Agatona owns and operates a business buying copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) in the local community and selling it in the city. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Agatona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase more copra to sell. Agatona is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more copra to sell

loans.name: Ruda

texts.en:
Ruda D. is from the village of Boundary, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Ruda owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling aluminum products such as cauldrons, ladles, basins, etc., to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ruda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Ruda is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Gerly

texts.en:
Gerly is a 57-year-old married woman living with her husband in the town of Hikkaduwa in southern Sri Lanka. They do not have any children.

Gerly has a business selling grocery items from a shop in her town. Her husband is also a partner in this business. She has been operating this business for five years, so she has gained valuable experience in that time.

Gerly has asked for a 40,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to buy grocery items and further develop her grocery business.

Gerly is honest and careful in the business. She hopes to provide a nutritious diet to her family through the additional income her business generates.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Mr. Yin R. generates his daily income by driving a motor-taxi around his community. He started his job in early 2001 and is able to earn US$4 each day.

Yin R. is 40 and is married with three school-aged children, while another one is now married and lives independently. Yin R. has a life partner in his wife who is a sewing laborer in the garment factoR..

The family’s income is not enough to serve daily food frequently. That is why Yin R. desires to invest as a fisherman but this action needs some accessories for fishing. Thus, Yin R. has decided to seek a loan to purchase nets, traps, and a boat to use for his fishing activity.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps, and a boat to use for his fishing activity

loans.name: Badra

texts.en:
Badra is a 44-year-old married woman living in the town of Hikkaduwa in the Galle district of Sri Lanka. She lives with her husband along with their twenty-two year old daughter.

Badra has a small business selling fruits and vegetables at her local market. Her husband provides some support to her. She devotes her full effort towards developing her business, so both she and her husband can earn enough money for their family expenses.

Now Badra wants to improve her small market to be a self-sufficient businesswoman. She has requested a 40,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy more vegetables and fruits for her business.

Thank you for taking time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jennifer's Group

texts.en:
Jennifer L., from the village of Bocator Tangub City, is the 35-year-old leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Jennifer is single. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jennifer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Wasanthi

texts.en:
Wasanthi is a married woman living with her husband and two children in the town of Hikkaduwa in the Galle district of Sri Lanka. She is 23 years old. Her husband is an army officer, and she runs her small business at home.

Wasanthi currently has just one sewing machine and provides sewing services to her neighbors and relatives as they place orders with her. She wants to develop her business and in the future hopes to buy more machines and create employment opportunities for other women as well. 

Wasanthi has requested a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka for the improvement of her business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more material to sew

loans.name: Jodina

texts.en:
Jodina Z., from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental, is 41 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jodina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop that sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over four years, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jodina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan, her third, of 9,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. Jodina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Lynn

texts.en:
Lynn A., from the village of Proper Langcangan Oroquieta City, is 30 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lynn owns and operates a specialized retail store selling a variety of food products such as canned goods, candies, and shampoos in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lynn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Lynn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Geetha

texts.en:
Geetha is a 36-year-old married woman living with her husband and three children in Kekanadura, part of the Matara area of Sri Lanka. She is a hardworking woman and enthusiastic. She has one son and two daughters. Her husband is a jewelry maker.

Geetha and her husband have managed a business of making and selling jewelry for three years. She has requested a 30,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka for the business.

Geetha is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her. Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more materials and tools for making jewelry

loans.name: Marilou's Group

texts.en:
Marilou C. is from the village of Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old and is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. Marilou is single. She owns and operates a specialized retail store selling snacks and other delicacies such as biko, bingka, puto (varieties of rice cake), etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Marilou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Kumudu

texts.en:
Kumudu is 30-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura, part of the Matara district. Her husband is a jewelry maker, and they have one infant child.

Kumudu has managed a business sewing and selling clothes for two years. She has asked for a 40,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to purchase cloth to further develop her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy cloth for her business

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en: Hamlet H. was born in 1959. He is married and lives in Noyemberyan city, Tavush region, not far from Ijevan city. His family consists of his wife, who works as a librarian, and two school-aged daughters. For about 20 years, Hamlet worked as a mechanical engineer in one of Abovyan's city factories, but since 2003 he has been trading in jewelry  and souvenirs. With the income from his business, Hamlet supports his family and has been able to buy new furniture for his house and improve his family's living conditions. Hamlet asks for a 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy chains and bangles to resell and also to increase the assortment of souvenirs in his shop.

loans.use: To buy chains and bangles to resell and also to increase the assortment of souvenirs in his shop

loans.name: Chandani

texts.en:
Chandani is a married woman living with her husband and son in Kekanadura, part of the Matara district of Sri Lanka. She is a hardworking woman, and she helps her husband who makes jewelry. Pictured above is Chandani with her husband and son.

Chandani and her husband have managed the business of jewelry making for four years. She has requested a 40,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to purchase tools as well as gold to help their business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy gold and tools for making jewelry

loans.name: Necifora

texts.en: Necifora R. is from the village of Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 49 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Necifora owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her sari-sari store business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Necifora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Necifora is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en: Harutyun P. is 48 years old and lives in Vanadzor city. He is married with three children — two daughters and a son. One of his daughters is already married and lives separately; the second daughter is a student studying in Yerevan. His son is in school and recently became Armenian champion of freestyle wrestling. Harutyun is very proud of his son's achievements. For about 15 years Harutyun has been engaged in clothes trading in the Vanadzor clothes fair. His wife stays home and keeps the house. Harutyun needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy spring and summer clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy spring and summer clothes to resell

loans.name: Lakshika

texts.en:
Lakshika is a 34-year-old married woman living in the town of Kekanadura, in the Matara area of southern Sri Lanka. She and her husband have two sons.

Lakshika manages a business making coconut oil, in which she partners with her husband. She and her husband have been doing this business for four years now.

Lakshika has requested a 25,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to purchase dry coconuts to be turned into oil. She hopes to continue to see success in her business with the help of this loan.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy dry coconuts for making more coconut oil

loans.name: Gombo

texts.en:
Gombo H., 70, lives with his wife and son in Hovd province, Mongolia. He operates a grocery store in his yard. He has been operating his business since 2003 and has built a stable operation over the past seven years. His grocery store has an excellent location.

Gombo's wife, Avirmed, is retired and helps with her husband's business. Their son is a 32-year-old professional photographer, and is currently living at home due to a headache disorder.

Gombo is a very hardworking and decisive person who has taken responsibility for his family. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more food products for his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more food products for his grocery store

loans.name: Sriyani

texts.en:
Sriyani is 35-year-old married woman living with her husband and four children in Kekanadura, Sri Lanka. Her children are still in school and her husband is a carpenter.

Sriyani assists her husband with his carpentry business, and is a hardworking woman. She has asked for a 30,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her husband's business in order to purchase a new machine.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase a new machine for her husband's carpentry business

loans.name: Rozbek

texts.en:
Rozbek is 31 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). Rozbek is a very hardworking and optimistic person. Rozbek worked as a driver between 1998 and 2004 for the Altain zam company. In 2004 he purchased a car and began to provide transportation services independently. 

During the spring Rozbek plants vegetables in Buyant district. Rozbek learned to plant vegetables from his parents at a very early age. He harvests his vegetables in the autumn, and uses them both to feed his family and to sell for a profit. Rozbek saves some of the vegetables in a warehouse to sell during the spring when they will command a higher price. 

His wife, Mongolhan, has been operating a cafe at a local market for nine years and has built a loyal customer base. Rozbek's oldest two daughters attend local secondary schools. Rozbek's family and businesses are important to him. Rozbek says, “I have been planning to improve our house and yard for my family. In addition, I am planning to save money for my three children's education fees. ” He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase four tires and other necessary equipment for his car and to purchase new table and chairs for his wife's cafe.

loans.use: Tires and equipment for vehicle; table and chairs for cafe

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe L. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Fe is married and has 2 school-aged children. Fe owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Fe is requesting her third loan, for 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anupika

texts.en:
Anupika is a 37-year-old divorced woman living with her daughter, mother and sister in the town of Hikkaduwa in the Galle area of Sri Lanka. She is a hardworking woman. Her family members are very close and work well together.

As a main livelihood, Anupika manages a sewing business and sells ready-made products to tourists, something she has been doing for a long time. She knows about her customer's desires from her experience. She can speak English quite well, too, which helps with her tourist clients. After attending school, she got started doing this business, which was twelve years ago.

Anupika has requested a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka, and she plans to use the loan to buy material for her sewing business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more material for her sewing business

loans.name: Shinebayar

texts.en:
Shinebayr V., 45, is married and the mother of two sons. She and her family live together in a house which they own in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Shinebayr earns her living by selling underwear, socks, and children's clothing at Narantuul, the biggest market in Mongolia. She has been operating her business with her husband since 2002, and they have gained valuable experience as traders. In the beginning they had only one counter. Over the past eight years they have expanded their business, and have purchased another counter. Today they operate their business successfully from both locations. 

Shinebayr and her husband alternate purchasing their products. Shinebayr's oldest son is a college student and helps his parents' business during his spare time. Shinebayr's youngest son is 16 years old and attends a local secondary school. With her business earnings, Shinebayr purchased housebuilding materials, and the whole family now lives in the house she built. 

Shinebayr is an industrious person. She says, “I would like to invest money for my childrens' education in the future.” She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a new roof for her house and a personal computer for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a new roof and PC for her family

loans.name: Pradeepika

texts.en:
Pradeepika is a hard working, 27-year-old married woman living with her husband, son, and daughter in Telijjawila, part of the Matara area of southern Sri Lanka.

Her husband has a business selling general household goods and Pradeepika assists him.  He sells the goods by going and visiting his customers to make the sales. He has been doing this business for 10 years with the help of Pradeepika.  

She has asked for a loan of 30,000 rupees (LKR) from BRAC to purchase materials and improve her husband's business.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Charlen

texts.en:
Charlen L. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Charlen is married and has 3 school-aged children. Charlen owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Charlen has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Charlen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Charlen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Charlen is requesting a new loan, her third, of 11,000 PHP, which will also be used to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa B. is from the village of Sagrada, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 55 years old. Celsa is married and has 2 adult children. She is pictured at her house. Celsa buys and sells vegetables like cabbage, eggplant, string beans, etc. in the local community. Celsa has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2008, Celsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Celsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Celsa is requesting her fifth loan, for 10,000 PHP, which will be used to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as noodles, eggs, salt, sugar shampoo, soap, coffee, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Carmelita is now requesting her second loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Milinda

texts.en:
Milinda N., from the village of Clarin Plaridel Misamis Occidental, is 52 years old, married, and owns operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as biscuits, sugar, salt, rice, shampoo, soap, noodles, toothpaste, soft drinks etc. in the local community. Milinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Milinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is now requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second loan from GDMPC, and Milinda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Kamaamia Ole

texts.en:
Kamaamia Ole P. is 26 years old and married to Noonku P.. He is a father of two school-aged children.
Kamaamia is a wheat farmer and has his own piece of land. He has been in this business for the last two years. He learned about Kiva partner, KADET, from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be Kamaamia's second loan. He is planning to farm ten acres of wheat, which does very well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make with this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his wheat output. His future dream is to buy a bigger piece of land where he can be plant wheat on a large scale and attain financial independence.
Kamaamia believes he is hardworking and, having the right resources at his disposal, can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizer for the wheat that is already planted

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna P. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Luna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Luna has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Luna joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Luna is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI

loans.name: Shiromi

texts.en:
Shiromi is a 39-year-old married woman living with her husband and four children. She has one son and three daughters.  Her husband works as a mason.  Her children are still in school.

Shiromi has managed a business weaving bedsheets and other goods for two years. She has requested a loan from BRAC for 30,000 rupees (LKR) in order to purchase a new machine to help her business.

Thank you for taking time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: to buy a new machine

loans.name: Maxiama

texts.en:
Maxiama B. is from the village of Agunod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Maxiama owns and operates a retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as diapers, sugar, coffee, milk, sugar, noodles, shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc. in the local community. Maxiama has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Maxiama joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Kirrinkai Ole

texts.en:
Kirrinkai Ole T. is 45-years-old, married to Noorparaki T., and the father of four children. A cash crop wheat farmer who has been in the farming business for the last ten years, he learned about KADET from a friend who was already a registered KADET client. This will be his fourth loan, with which he is planning to plant twenty acres of wheat, a crop that has proven to grow very well in this area. With the profits Kirrinka hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his wheat production and buy some livestock.

His future goal is to buy a bigger piece of land upon which he can plant more wheat for commercial purposes and keep more sheep.

loans.use: To prepare the land for wheat planting

loans.name: Arminda

texts.en:
Arminda Q. is from the village of Lower Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 62 years old. Arminda is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Arminda owns & operates a business making & selling cooked food for daily meals. Arminda has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Arminda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Arminda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Anushik

texts.en: Anushik H. was born in 1963 in Kapan. She is married and has two daughters who are already married and live separately from their parents. For about 10 years Anushik has managed her own shop where she sells food and household goods. Anushik's husband helps her in that business and also keeps bees which adds to their family's income. Anushik purchases her inventory six times per month — five times in Kapan, and once in Yerevan. Anushik asks for an 850.000 AMD loan to increase her shop’s assortment of good and to buy a coffee grinder for her shop, which will help bring in more customers.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of goods and to buy a coffee grinder for her shop

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette D. is a 49-year-old very good member of ASHI. Since she became a member of said organization, she has maintained an excellent performance in terms of repaying the loan she received. She has been attending the ASHI center meeting weekly despite her busy schedule attending to the needs of her business and to the needs of her family. 

Despite being poor, Nanette enjoys her life because she has a husband who is very loving and supportive as well as having two sweet and thoughtful children (12 and 19 years old). Nanette and her husband dream that one day their children will have a different kind of life. They wish that they would be able to have the capacity to support their needs to graduate from college and have their own career. To be able to do this, they both work hard to grow their small business (fishing and fish selling) and increase its revenue. Now, Nanette is requesting a much larger loan from ASHI to purchase additional fishing gear. Her husband is the one who does the fishing and Nanette sells the fish in the public market. 

Nanette’s eldest child now is in college and will be graduating soon. She hopes that this year her business will have more earnings in preparation for the enrollment and her child’s other educational expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear.

loans.name: Mayranush

texts.en: Mayranush S. lives in Sevan city. She is 46 years old. She lives with her husband and three sons. Mayranush is a commodity expert, but she worked as a cook for about five years and then as a shop assistant. In 2002, she organized her own business. Mayranush's business consists of clothes trading, which she manages in a rented place at Sevan Fair. Mayranush has borrowed eight loans from Nor Horizon and now she is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy spring and summer clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy spring and summer clothes for her business

loans.name: Noun

texts.en: Mrs. Noun T. is a widowed mother, 64 years of age. She stays at home to either care for her grandchild or do housework. Noun T. has a daughter who is now married and lives with her in the family home. She currently depends on the income from two persons: her daughter who sews clothes in a garment factory for a salary and her son-in-law who provides a cooking service for wedding parties. Noun T.’s son-in-law needs to improve his service. This is why Noun T. has asked for assistance through Kiva’s field partner, HKL, in the amount of $400 to purchase more essential material to perform the good cooking service he provides.

loans.use: To purchase more essential cooking materials.

loans.name: 06.03.02 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Huy N. (60302011) is a 49-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa-Thanh Hoa.  Huy is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 60302 (060302-Hoang Hoa).


Huy is married and has three adult children.  To making a living, Huy operates a family member's business raising cattL. for saL..  Huy has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, Huy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Huy from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Huy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Huong (60302021) is a 40-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  V. T. Duyen (60302021) is a 55-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  L. T. Thong (60302002) is a 53-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 2,124,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Huy N. (60302011) là 1949 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa-Thanh Hoa.  Huy là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 60302 (060302-Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Huy thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Huy kiếm được khoảng 2000000 VND.  Vào 2003, Huy đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Huy đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Huong (60302021) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  V. T. Duyen (60302021) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  L. T. Thong (60302002) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2124000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Hanh T. H. L. is 37 years old. She is married with a son who is going to school. She sells pigs in the market. She has been doing this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2004 and repaid punctually. She is the group leader of four-member group loan from SEDA. For this loan, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND for her small business.

There are three other members in her group who are borrowing money:

Tuy P. D. is 48 years old. He wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for his small business.
Ly T. L. is 34 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
Tuyet T. L. is 26 years old. She is a hairdresser. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to expand her shop.

loans.use: Additional capital for her small business

loans.name: Laberta

texts.en:
Mrs. Laberta L. is from Bogo, Capalaran, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 53 years old and a widow with two children. She is a PDP-LP member. Laberta is a vendor at Molave Public market. Her main source of income comes primarily from her business alone. She approximately earns 3,000 a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 3000 PHP taken from PMPC. As of now, she has a new loan of 5,000 PHP taken from PMPC and the purpose of this loan is for additional capital for her business. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Savarn's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Savarn S. is 43 years old and the leader of a group loan. She was selected by five members who are located in Kaoh Kaev Leu village in Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Savarn S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. She also owns a small store to sell her goods. For her grocery business, Mrs. Savarn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business and hire people to plow her farm. Her husband, Mr. Sokhom Seng, is a policeman who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has four children who all are students in the local school and also supports their mothe ???

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Mr. Un C. currently works in the construction field. He is 31 years old and resides south of Phnom Penh City. He has two children, both of whom are teenagers and attend school. Un C. was married many years ago to Mrs. Yorn Leng, age 28. She is a sewing worker in the industry. By working, this couple is able to make around $10 each day to be responsible for their family. Un C. will be using his loan to build a hedge around his house to protect his property.  He will use any remaining money from the loan to improve his construction service. (Mr. Un C. was busy at his business activity when the photo was taken so his wife is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To build a hedge around his house to protect his property.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mrs. Mercedes A. is from Poblacion, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old and married with eight children. She is a PDP-LP member. Out of her eight children, three went to school. Mrs. Mercedes manages her snack vending business while her husband is a farmer, which supports their daily basic needs. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 3,000 PHP taken from PMPC. As of now, she has a new loan of 5,000 PHP taken from PMPC, which is intended for her business. It will serve as an expansion of her business and as additional capital. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her snack vending

loans.name: Tu's Group

texts.en:
Tu T. V. is 26 years old. She lives in Xom Thuong village. She is married with two children. The children are going to school. Mrs Tu sells fruit in the market. She earns 100,000 Vietnamdong to 150,000 Vietnamdong (VND) per day. She is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA’s microfinance program. She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND to buy more fruit to sell.

About other borrowers in her group:

Quang V. N. is 40 years old. He grows trees and breeds poultry. He wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to invest in livestock.
Mai T. N. is 41 years old. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to breed the pigs.
Hai T. N. is 54 years old. She has a store. She wants to borrow 654,000 VND to invest in her store.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Hovik

texts.en:
Hovik H. is 46 years old and lives in Geghamavan village in the Sevan area. Hovik is married and has three sons. One of his sons is serving in the Armenian Army and the other sons are studying in Sevan technical secondary school. Hovik worked as a worker for about five years and as a driver for about eight years. Hovik has been engaged in farming for 15 years. On his farm he has cows, calves and sheep. His wife helps him in farming. With their income from animal husbandry, they keep their family and pay for their sons’ education.   

Hovik needs a 400,000 AMD loan to buy two cows, which will help him to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Mrs. Norma S. is from Bogo Capalaran, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 46 years old, and a widow with seven children. Norma is a PDP-LP member. She is a vendor at Molave Public Market. She is selling different kinds of foods, which is needed by passengers. Her main source of income comes primarily from her business alone. She earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. Norma successfully repaid her previous loan of 3,000 PHP taken from PMPC. As of now, she has a new loan of 5,000 PHP taken from PMPC and the purpose of this loan is for additional capital for her business. This is her second loan from PMPC.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Anelita

texts.en:
Mrs. Anelita I. is from Poblacion, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 29 years old and married with only one child. Anelita is a PDP-LP member of PMPC. To make a living, she operates a sari-sari store and her husband works in the market selling pancit. She earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 9,000 PHP taken from PMPC. The purpose of that loan was for the expansion of her business. As of now, she has a new loan of 10,000 taken from PMPC and the purpose of this loan is for additional capital for her business. She plans that the additional revenue generated from the business will help to improve the background of her family.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
