Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en: Sallay S. is a businesswoman who sells clothes in Waterloo market. She is 34 years old and married to a man who works for an NGO. They have two children – a boy and a girl. Sallay has been in this business for 17 years. She is requesting this loan of 3,000,000 SLL to purchase more clothing for resale. She hopes to make more profit and change her situation forever.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Mrs. Nenita T. is from Panagaan, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 48 years old and married with two children. She is a PDP-LP member. To make a living, Nenita operates a sari-sari store and her husband is a farmer. She has managed her business for more than a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. As of now, she has a new loan of 5,000 PHP taken from PMPC. This is her first loan from PMPC and the purpose of this loan is for additional capital for her business.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Kawaita

texts.en:
Kawaita S. is 46 years old and lives in Waterloo with her husband and five children. Her eldest three children are in secondary school and her youngest two are in primary school.
Kawaita has been selling goods for 27 years now. She sells food items such as rice, beans, oil and salt, and items for home use such as soap and detergent. Kawaita has taken four previous loans from Kiva partner, LAPOSL, which she invested in her business to increase her profit. With this loan of 3,000,000 SLL, she will purchase additional items for sale. This will be of immense benefit to her because it is a step to her dream of being a major trader in her community.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, oil, salt, soap and detergents

loans.name: Laing's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Laing S. is 63 years old and is the leader of a group loan. She was selected by nine members who are located in Preak Ta Hang village in Kandal province.  Each member of this group loan will uS. the loan for a different purpoS.. Mrs. Laing S. and her husband, Mr. Oeng Seab, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate corn. Mrs. Laing S. decided to ask for a loan to buy corn seed to support her farming crop. This couple has a child who is at home and helps on the farm.

loans.use: To buy corn seed

loans.name: Maegret

texts.en: Maegret is 57 years old. She is a widow with six children. Her children are doing well at school. Her children had to switch schools from a private school to public school beause of the death of their father. To make a living, she sells periwinkles at retail prices to her customers. Periwinkles are used as soup ingredients in Nigeria and it is highly profitable. She has been in this business for seven years. She is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more periwinkles to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more periwinkles to sell

loans.name: Eth's Group

texts.en: In Trav village in Prey Veng province five people make up a group loan. Mr. R. Eth is the group leader, selected by all the members. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose. He is a chef and his wife, Mrs. Thy Chork, is a pig breeder who earns some money from selling pigs to support her family. Since his wife’s breeding pig business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, in order to improve breeding pigs, Mr. R. Eth decided to seek a loan to buy some piglets for breeding. He is the father of two children. One of the children is a laborer and the other attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita O. is from the village of Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Pablita owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transport services to local community members. Pablita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Pablita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. Pablita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Yeoun's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Yeoun M., 42 years old, is the leader of a group loan located in Preak Ta Hang village in Kandal province.  She was selected by the eight members. Each member of this group loan will use the loan to purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes. Mrs. Yeoun M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops. Her husband, Mr. Mith Phay, is a motorcycle taxi driver who earns a small income to support his family.  To support both businesses, Mrs. Yeoun M. decided to ask for a loan to buy corn seed and sesame seed, to hire people to plow her farm and to repair her husband's motorcycle. This couple has four children. Three of the children are students in the local school and the youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: To buy corn seed, sesame seed and to hire people to plow her farm

loans.name: Jonna Mae

texts.en:
Jonna Mae is 24 years old and is engaged in farming for a living. She is married and has a seven-year-old child. She and her husband work hard to make their rice farm productive. Jonna Mae wants to save early for her child’s future. She also hopes to have a stable income.
Jonna Mae is a member of Kiva partner, CEVI. She is now applying for a loan of 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: 18.04.024 Quang Hung Group

texts.en:
Dung N. T.ị (63) is a 33-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hóa. Dung is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 024 Quảng Hưng.
Dung is married and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Dung owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for saL.. Dung has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a monT. from these activities.
In 2008, Dung joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dung has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her fourT. from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Dung plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group
1. Hoàng T.ị Tâm (64) is a 25-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 2. Lê T.ị Khuyên (65) is a 39-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

loans.name: Montha's Group

texts.en: Mrs. N. Kimhai is a 31-year-old married woman. She is the leader of the group loan and was selected by four members who are located in Preak Raing village in Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. N. Kimhai is a grocery seller who owns a small store to support her business. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries to enlarge her business. Her husband, Mr. Rith Thy, is a printing house laborer who earns a small salary to support his family. This couple has a child who is two years old.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Josette

texts.en:
36-year-old Josette S. is taking life the way she and her family can enjoy despite being poor in many respects. She and her husband are both hardworking and struggling to improve their lives and make their five sweet and loving children happy.  Jonel, their eldest son, is 15 years of age and is presently studying in a secondary education. He strives hard to perform well in his studies to compensate for his parent’s hard work. The rest of her children are young. (They range from three to seven years old.) To support their basic, everyday needs and to sustain the education of Jonel, Josette decided to put up her own small business, hog fattening. Profit from her hogs, which are sold after three to four months of raising, is used to purchase better kinds of food and other necessary things for her family to enjoy. Josette realized that her hog fattening business earns fairly well. Therefore she wants to raise more hogs and to sell them to the market either alive or slaughtered in a larger volume to increase her revenue. In this case, she is requesting a bigger loan through ASHI. 

Josette and her husband are excited to see her business grow and become stable. They are whimsical about having a better kind of life for their children through the success of their business.

loans.use: To purchase more hogs for fattening and selling business.

loans.name: Pakk's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sreyneang C. is a 28-year-old married woman and the leader of a group loan. She was selected by four members who are located in Lech Pram village in Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use it for a different purpose. Mrs. Sreyneang C. is a seamstress in a garment factory and her husband is a construction worker. In both of these positions, they earn a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sreyneang C. is now requesting a loan to buy vegetable to sell. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve the family standard of living.  This couple has two children; one is attending a local school and one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina O. is from the village of Mapang. She is 71 years old, married and has one adult child. To make a living, Agustina is engaged in cooking and selling of foods and delicacies in her community. Through this activity, she is able to earn a monthly net income amounting to 5,000.00. 

In 2007, Agustina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agustina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business . Agustina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients and fruits for her fruitstand business. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Agustina from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is married and has six children. She dreams of all her children finishing college and finding suitable jobs. Juvy joined Kiva partner, CEVI, a year ago because she needed financial assistance for her rice farm. She was happy to be accepted as a member because she really needs her farm to sustain her family.
Juvy is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs that her farm lacks. She will also buy crude oil for the tractor she uses at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Mrs. M. was born in 1969,  is married and has five children; three are married and live away from home and the other two are single. To seek a daily income she sells food to people who work in the garment industry. Her husband assists her in selling food. To help provide more income for the family, two of the children are employed: one sells fast food  and the other delivers soap for a small firm. The family’s living situation is not good because their house needs repairs,  so she has asked for a loan to repair her old house. She also intends to use some of the loan as capital for her food business.

loans.use: To repair her old house.

loans.name: Muon's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of four people who are villagers in Trav village in Prey Veng province. Mr. Muon K. is the group leader, selected by all the members who will use the loan for different purposes. He and his wife, Mrs. Key Korng, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support their family. Their problem is that their field has infertile soil. So to improve production, Mr. Muon K. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. Through this activity, the couple supports four children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factory, and two are laborers in the local village.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries  to sell

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en: Jameel M. is 23 and lives in Bet Our Ramallah. His family consists of 6 members, and two of his brothers are in school.  He aims to open a branch for Jawwal,  the Palestinian telecommunications company, in Bet Our, which will increase his income.

loans.use: open a branch for Jawwal the Palestinian telecommunication company

loans.name: Ma. Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, photographed with one of her three children, owns and tills a rice farm in her hometown in Agusan Del Sur. She is married to Alex and both of them dedicate their time to making the farm productive. She also makes sure that her children are properly taken care of. She does her best to make her family happy. Since her children don’t go to school yet, she wants to grab this opportunity to save for their education.

Gemma joined CEVI last year to gain access to its program. One of the things she likes about it is the low interest rate. She is now asking for a loan of Php 7, 000 that she would use to buy fertilizers and other farming materials.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Josesa

texts.en:
Josesa A. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 38, married and has 1 child in school. To make a living, Josesa owns & operates a shop where she sells cellphone accessories and souvenir items to the local community. Josesa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Josesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josesa repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, and is now requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which she will also use to expand her business.  She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Six people who live in Trav village in Prey Veng province make up this group loan. Mr. Sary P. is the group leader, selected by all the members. Each member of the group will use their loan for a different purpose.
Mr. Sary P. is a widower with four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory while the others are studying in a local public school. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice, not to sell but to support his family. He is also a pig breeder. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. To improve breeding, Mr. Sary P. is seeking a loan to buy some piglets.

loans.use: To buy some piglets
